placeTeaching: Fundação António Cupertino Miranda, Porto, Portugal
mainThemes: Monge budista, autor, tradutor, fotógrafo e promotor de vários projetos humanitários, Matthieu Ricard explica-nos nesta conferência a importância e os benefícios do altruísmo: "O amor altruísta e a compaixão formam um par duplamente ganhador: não só estes são os sentimentos que melhor nos fazem, mas os comportamentos que deles advêm fazem bem aos outros."

organização: F. Kangyur R. | Songtsen | Stupa | U.B.P.
eventTitle: O Nono Capítulo da Via do Bodhisattva - Part 1 de 3
mainThemes:
Primeira parte dos ensinamentos de Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche sobre o Nono Capítulo do Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra – “A Via do Bodhisattva”, acerca da natureza última da realidade, dos fenómenos e do eu. Estes ensinamentos são baseados no comentário “Ketaka Norbu”, (traduzido com o título "The Wisdom Chapter") de Jamgön Mipham Rinpoche.

Inclui as sessões de revisão por Wulstan Fletcher, tradutor inglês de ambas obras, onde os ensinamentos de Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche e os textos são analisados e discutidos.

sessionThemes:
Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 1 | 14th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
Short presentation of Śāntideva | Commentaries on The Way of the Bodhisattva | Commentary by Mipham Rinpoche on the ninth chapter | Origin of the commentary, The Ketaka Jewel | The teachings of the Middle Way | Challenges of the ninth chapter | Different schools and their criticisms of Mipham Rinpoche | Structure of the text | The need to generate wisdom, the main aspect of the path.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 2 | 15th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
The reason why developing the wisdom, the main part of the path, is necessary | The description of wisdom, or of the prajñāpāramitā itself | The two truths, corresponding to phenomena being empty and appearing, and establishing the path to realize nonexistence of the self | Questions and answers

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 3 | 16th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
Presentation of the perfection of wisdom | Establishing the basis for the two truths | Presentation of the two truths to be realized | Refutation of objections
 
Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 4 | 17th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
How to develop the relative enlightened mind | How to develop the ultimate enlightened mind | The reasons for developing wisdom | A presentation of the perfection of wisdom | The basis which is that the two truths are devoid of real existence | Answer to critiques related to the meaning, emptiness itself | Answer to the critique of the words used to present the meaning, the answer to the critique of the Great Vehicle | Conclusion and synthesis of these arguments

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 5 | 18th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
Refutation of the objections of the Cittamātrins | Two kinds of Cittamātrins | | Historical context | Mind-Only—clarity and knowing | Mind- Only—perception and perceived existing simultaneously | Differences be- tween True Aspectarians and False Aspectarians.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 6 | 19th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
Refutation of objections in regard to the two truths | Refutation of objections of the True Aspectarians | Refutation of the objections of the False Aspectarians | Refutation of objections to emptiness as “the path”

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 7 | 20th Nov. 2017 | Morning Sessions
The need to study, reflect and meditate on such a great treatise, to enable us to escape the sufferings of saṃsāra | Refutation of objections to emptiness | Refutation of objections to the words, the Great Vehicle | Summary and conclusion
revision sessions

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 1 | 14th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session
Benefits of studying the Wisdom chapter | The origin of teachings on wisdom | Madhyamaka—the essentialization of Prajñāpāramitā | The two truths | Emptiness—the true nature of phenomena | Why bodhicitta is essential on the path | Faith and reason | The four ontological extremes | The different schools, arguments and consequences | The three turnings of the Wheel of Dharma | Benefits of the textual outline – the sabche.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 2 | 15th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session
The structure of textual outline, the sabche | How the sabche works as an aid to study | The distinction between relative and ultimate truth | The nature of unborn and appearing mode—pink elephants and magnolia tree billboards | Two kinds of reasoning—limits to reasoning | Emptiness, absolute truth beyond mind

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 3 | 16th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session
Distinction between the ordinary mind and the primordial wisdom | Different stages of the negation of the tetralemma | The figurative ultimate and the nonfigurative ultimate | The Mahāyāna divided into the sūtra path and the tantra path| Five stages | Figurative ultimate, the nonimplicative negative | Ordinary mind and language belong to the relative, they are not ultimate.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 4 | 17th Nov. 2017 | Afternon Session
Positing the ground, the emptiness of true existence | Refutations of objections to emptiness | Refutation of the objections of those who affirm extramental things | The Buddha’s purpose in talking about the aggregates and so on | Provisional teachings | Definitive teachings | The illusion of momentariness | Rigdra shendrug: something different arises of the same character | Refutation of objections based on reasoning | Illusion and the generation of merit | Karmic production | Degenerative effects of negative action in virtual reality | Nirvāṇa with clinging is saṃsāra | Saṃsāra without clinging is nirvāṇa

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 5 | 18th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session p. 387
Objections to emptiness that are related to the ground, path and result | Svātantrika tenet system | Refutations of the objections of the Cittamātrins | Refutation of the objections of the True Aspectarians | Refutation that the mind is truly existent | Interdependence, emptiness of real existence | Causality ruled out by idea of simultaneity | Self-knowing mind refuted on the ultimate level, not on the relative level.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 6 | 19th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session p. 427
Refutation of the True Aspectarians | Self-knowing mind is not refuted on the relative level |Self-cognizing mind, reflective self-knowledge | Refutation of the objections of the False Aspectarians | Rejection of the law of the excluded middle | The unreality of the mind | Really existing things in the relative sense and things that don’t exist | Refutation of objections to emptiness | Two kinds of self-clinging | Freedom from the four conceptual extremes.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 7 | 20th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session
Refutation of objections to emptiness as the “path” | Why understanding the first tetralemma is crucial | The predicability of existence | The lim- its of reason | Phenomena can exist in none of the four extremes | The four reliances | Receptivity, purity, and readiness | Dangers of misunderstanding emptiness | Debate, not scorn | Everything depends on our own efforts | We are not alone.

mainThemes: Meditação e Felicidade | Postura | Acalmar a mente | Estágios de meditação | Qualidades e palavras do Buda | Transmissão mestre a mestre |  Interdependência | Aspiração | Transmissões Orais; Tradutores importantes | Preciosa vida Humana | Tipos de Meditação | Desenvolver a concentração | Atenção plena, vigilância e cuidado | Como praticar śamatha | Perfeições | 3 tipos de Ações | Propósito da meditação | Apegos |  Padrões habituais e alaya | Consciência base e consciências nos 6 reinos | Aspeto luminoso da mente e luminosidade de base | Ignorância | 5 elementos, agregados e dualidade | Karma e experiências | Aspiração vasta | Alegria na prática. etc.

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: O que nos impede de realmente entrar na prática | O significado de “usar o mestre como um caminho” | Sobre as iniciações | Lembrando o que deve estar presente durante a prática do ngӧndro | Compreender a função de um guru sem sensacionalismo | O que está a amadurecer a nossa corrente mental e como isso acontece | O guru é mais importante do que a deidade da maṇḍala | O guru absoluto | A história de um homem do Tibete que queria aprender exorcismo | Estabelecendo uma cognição válida dos ensinamentos de Buda | Conexão direta entre a nossa própria devoção e essa realização | O significado de guru, em tibetano “lama” | Quatro maneiras de ver o mestre | Visualizando o objeto do guru yoga | Fazendo esta prática de acordo com diferentes sadhanas | Pontos a considerar antes de iniciar a prática: motivação, postura, cinco perfeições | Sabendo que o mestre é o Buda e que tudo o que ele faz é a atividade do Buda | A sua bondade é ainda maior do que a do Buda e incorpora a sabedoria de todos os infinitos refúgios

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th April 2025 | Morning Session | 1st part
[Audio-tracks 001-005] Main topics: Things preventing us from really entering
the practice

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th April 2025 | Morning Session | 2nd part
[Audio-tracks 006-010] Main topics: Seeing the function of a guru without
sensationalism; Importance of the empowerments

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th April 2025 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 011-016] Main topics: Valid cognition of pure perception;
The role of a guru and how to use the guru on the path; The space-like compassion
of Guru Rinpoche which can never be challenged by our emotions
and tantrums

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th April 2025 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 017-020] Main topics: Points to consider before starting the
practice: motivation, posture, 5 perfections; Doing entire practice of “The
Excelent Path to Liberation” followed by instructions

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th April 2025 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 021-033] Main topics: Knowing that the teacher is the Buddha;
Knowing that everything the teacher does is the activity of the Buddha;
Knowing that for us, the teacher is even kinder than the buddhas; Knowing
that the teacher embodies the wisdom of all the infinite refuges

eventTitle: Bardo, Calma Mental e Visão Penetrante
mainThemes: Um dos mais notáveis e extraordinários mestres, ilustre representante da escola Kagyü, explica, no decurso deste magnífico ensinamento: os bardos, ou estados intermediários e o processo de dissolução da morte; os vários estágios da meditação, inclusive a devoção e o repousar na natureza da mente, entre outros.

eventTitle: Retiro de Primavera / Treino da Mente 2
mainThemes: As preliminares e a razão pela qual praticamos | Pensar em 10 milhões, 8 biliões de pessoas, abre a nossa mente | Como é que começamos a praticar a Bodhicitta? Limitamo-nos a copiar, a fingir | Abrindo a mente até começarmos a amar cada ser como se fosse nosso filho único | Toxicidade do egocentrismo, sem reconhecê-la não haverá nem renúncia nem bodhicitta | Tonglen | O Guru como treino mental | Biografia de Jamyang Khyentse Wangpo | Pós-meditação | Oferecer água e tormas | O treino da mente é como um veículo: torna a nossa vida mais prática, mas precisa de ser mantido | Trazer o sofrimento para o caminho | Este “eu” é apenas um pensamento, um sentimento, e é composto | Kyabje Khyentse Rinpoche e Kyabje Trulshik Rinpoche | Ações virtuosas e não-virtuosas | Guru Rinpoche | Visualização | O nome de Buda Śākyamuni é muito precioso | Lembrem-se frequentemente do refúgio

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th April 2022 | Morning Session 
[Audio-tracks 001-014] Main topics: Quick overview of the topics preceding verse 10 in 37 Practices of a Bodhisattva; Exchange of oneself and others from 37 Practices of a Bodhisattva.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th April 2022 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio-tracks 015-024] Main topics: Q&A regarding bodhicitta; Exchanging oneself and others based on 37 Practices of a Bodhisattva; Post-meditation: how to use loss on the path.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th April 2022 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 025-035] Main topics:The benefits and need of the mind training; About different kinds of offerings to non-human beings; Chapter 13 from The 37 Practices of the Bodhisattvas.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th April 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 036-049] Main topics: Questions and answers regarding chapters 12 and 13 from 37 Practices of a Bodhisattva; Reading and commenting on chapters 14-18 from 37 Practices of a Bodhisattva.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th April 2022 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 050-057] Main topics: Śamatha practice | Text: ‘The Heart of Compassion’, a commentary by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche on Ngulchu Thogme’s root text ‘Thirty-Sevenfold Practice of a Bodhisattva’ | Verse 19 – How to use prosperity on the path; Verse 20 – Using hatred and desire on the path (a) How to use objects of hatred on the path | Buddha wants sentient beings to understand what the path really means | The essenceless nature of phenomena | The practice of loving-kindness, an antidote for anger | Examining emotions | Virtuous and non-virtuous actions | What is the hell realm from the Buddhist point of view | Importance of Guru Rinpoche

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th April 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 058-066] Main topics: Mind training | Text – “The Heart of Compassion” | Verse 21 – How to use objects of desire on the path | To know how to be satisfied with what you have | The value of practicing reflection and meditation | The importance of śamatha practice | Abandon promptly objects that arouse attachment | Our addiction to habits, possessions and desires | The destructive power of dissatisfaction | How we justify the habit of accumulating possessions | The goal here is training our mind | Aspirations provide support for our mind | The practice of visualization | Tsok offering practice | The importance of appreciating the Buddha and the joy this brings | Taking mind training into our daily life | Recognise and know what the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha are on different levels | The Refuge Practice

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group C | 4th May 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 148-156] Main topics: Refuge; The preliminaries; Vajrasattva Practice

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group C | 4th May 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 157-162] Main topics: Vajrasattva Practice; The Power of Suport; The Power of Regret; The Power of Antidote; The Power of Resolution

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group C | 4th May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks 163-175] Main topics: Suffering of Change; Nature of Phenomena and Self.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group C | 4th May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks 176-186] Main topics: A Beacon to Dispel the Gloom Practice; Causes and Conditions; The Meaning of ‘Oṃ maṇi padme hūṃ hrīḥ’.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group C | 5th May 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 187-197] Main topics: Vajrasattva Practice—Preparation, visualization and dissolution.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group C | 5th May 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 198-201] Main topics: Vajrayāna; Vajrasattva Practice—Requirements and accumulation.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group C | 5th May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks 202-224] Main topics: Nature of Phenomena and Self 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche

[Audio Tracks 225-231] Main topics: Birth, Enlightenment, Turning of the Wheel of Dharma and parinirvāṇa of the Buddha;

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | Introduction
[Audio-tracks: Intro 001-004] Main topics: Relating to the present situation of pandemic COVID 19. Bodhicitta; ego-clinging.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | 1st part
[Audio-tracks: 001-010] Main Topics: Introduction to Vajrasattva practice; Importance of refuge and bodhicitta; Why we do the Vajrasattva practice; Negative actions and obscurations; The four powers (support, regret, resolution and antidote)

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | 2nd part
[Audio-tracks: 0011-017] Main Topics: Vajrasattva visualization; Power of regret; Power of resolution; Visualization; Post meditation; Bibliography

mainThemes: O que é "śamatha" | Os quatro métodos de meditação | Atenção plena e vigilância | Influência da mente | Causas e condições | Ouvir e contemplar | Conhecer a mente | Postura de Meditação | A prática do Buda Śākyamuni: "Tesouro de Bençãos" | Obstáculos à meditação e antídotos | Atenção plena e vigilância | Entorpecimento e agitação | Respiração como suporte de meditação | Refúgio | "Prática diária em três partes" | "Guru Yoga" | Alargar o foco | Consciência clara | Contar a respiração | Coragem no contexto do Dharma | Auto-sabotar a prática | O calendário lunar tibetano: explicação sobre o quarto mês | Impermanência | Causas e condições | Treino baseado na razão | Libertação de animais e importância de salvar vidas, etc.

mainThemes: As Trinta e Sete Práticas dos Bodhisattvas - Versos 1 a 13 | A preciosa vida humana | Os 4 Raciocínios: dependência, funcionalidade, lógica e natureza | Refúgio, bodhicitta, renúncia e devoção | "O Caminho Rápido para a Iluminação" | Ensinamentos a partir do comentário às Trinta e Sete Práticas por Dzatrul Rinpoche, chamado Dütsi Pumzang | Atitude do Bodhisattva | Refúgio e nome secreto | Sādhana baseada no Louvor a Mañjuśrī | Karma, inocência e culpa | Acções negativas e sofrimento.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group 2 | 25th May 2017 | Morning session
[Audio 001-024] On: The Thirty-Seven Practices of a Bodhisattva is what somebody on the path should learn | Contains everything that the Buddha taught | Becoming happy is simply not having the causes of suffering | Four reasonings: dependence, functionality, logic or nature | Verse 1 –precious human life | “Precious” is something that we should appreciate | Eight lacks of freedom | Politically correct considering people lacking in faculties as lack of freedom | Mind doesn’t have stability or wisdom so it cannot make choices | Guru Padmasambhava and Virupa were not vulnerable to drink | Hell is made by the mind, the Buddha has said | Hungry ghost realms are result of our mind’s paranoias | Barbaric places | Lack of faculties | Human life endowed with eight freedoms, ten advantages is very important | Verse 2 – Abandoning native land | In our own place, our self-inflicted obligations arise | Revisit understanding of what friendship is | Reduce input of distraction would be really good | Verse 3 – Relying on solitude | That solitude can be your room | Verse 4 – Impermanence | This precious human life is not something we can take for granted | Verse 5 – Bad company | Acquaintances don’t help us in reducing our emotions | Keep a little distance from them | Not meaning we should not be friends | Bad company is not necessarily bad people | Verse 6 – Considering a spiritual friend. | These friends help us on the path | Term “Spiritual friend” is a bit misleading | It is a friend or somebody who is doing good to you | Not somebody who is massaging our ego | Verse 7 – To take refuge in the Three Jewels | Not a daily chores | In order to become awakened, take | Refuge as something that frees us from what we call the cycle of existence | It is a constant activation and reactivation of refuge | It has to become instinctive | The idea of religion is quite misleading | In the West it is based on monotheism | Buddha in the same way as others consider god or gods | object of refuge represents our goal and our guide | Visualization of | Connecting us with the result | Re-ignite our vows | Obama or Trump’s policy as my guide | Q. Taking refuge in the Dalai Lama | How to define the sangha | Taking refuge in Rinpoches as a stepping stone only | Definition of "sangye" and "chö" | Three Jewels refers to truth of cessation and truth of the path | bodhicitta is exposing our comfort zone.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 2 | 25th May 2017 | Afternoon Session
[Audio 025-040] On: What is Buddha? | Swift Path to Enlightenment | Text for the practice in sessions of 37 Practices of Boddhisattva | Condenses the entire teaching of Buddha | About Thogme Zangpo | Uncertainty of time of death | Importance of having idea of the essence of the teachings of the Buddha | About the author Dzatrul Rinpoche | Structure of text | Beginning homage | Humility | This is the only path of all the bodhisattvas | Cultivating the enlightened mind | Sublime noble field of hom- age and offerings | Like Bodhisattva Samantabhadra | Prostration with correct view | Production of your mind | Perfect Buddhahood, Samyaksambuddha | Preliminary practice: seven topics | the difficulty obtaining precious human life | Solitude | Imper manence | Four seals | Significance of reflection on impermanence | Not to lose this opportunity | Giving up negative company | Law of cause and effect | China: killing all the birds | Rely on the spiritual friends | Commentary Dutsi Pumzang is also pith instruction | refuge | rely on proper refuge | Qualified teacher | Not consider everything yellow as gold | Three things to avoid, three things to adopt, three complementary things | Meaning of Oṃ | Meaning of Hūṃ. 

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group 2 | 25th May 2017 | Morning Session 
[Audio tracks 041-060] On: Applying bodhicitta | Why give rise to bodhicitta | What is renunciation | This wish to become awakened is really important | What devotion is | Mahāyāna teachings — wish to become awakened | Reminder for that wish, is the sufferings of saṃsāra | Renunciation isn’t a lofty, spiritual thing | Devotion is attachment to the right thing | Bodhicitta requires understanding of suffering of sentient beings and devotion | Bodhicitta is doable | Break up our concepts of Bodhicitta and reconstruct it | Compassion with a spine! | Mind is fickle | Confidence in the necessity of Bodhicitta | Take refuge based on reasoning compassion, devotion, loving kindness are called skillful means. | Reasoning—these are part of wisdom | Without wisdom and compassion the path is not possible | Devotion to the Three Jewels beyond con- ceptual neurotic emotion | So for us to become a buddha, we need to know what the Buddha taught | Atiśa Dīpaṃkara and Ngulchu Thogme | Thirty-Seven Practices – essence of the teachings | Precious human life, impermanence | Contemplate prospect of future lives | we have no control | There is always worse possible | Hell realms are experiences of mind | Story of Jamyang Khyentse Chökyi Lodrö’s attendant reborn as snake | Fearlessness at death | death with no regret | Verse 8 | reverse jihad | Q. Not being able to pray for all | Collective karma. 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 2 | 26th May 2017 | Afternoon Session 1st part 
[Audio 061-079] On: Check your state of mind | Buddha talked to countless students | The Five Perfections | buddhas have the ability to teach in different worlds | Attitude of Mañjuśrī | Shepherd’s, Boatman’s, King’s Attitude | Two types of wisdom/omniscience | Maudgalputra and his mother rebirth | Power of a bodhisattva | The less you have obscurations, the more you can benefit others | Love without boundary, not dualistic love | Love, Compassion, Rejoicing, Impartiality | Overcoming difficulties to give | How to consider all compounded things | Dedication - incredible way to invest our virtues | Commentary Dütsi Pumzang cont. | We should show respect to texts | Keep some time for the study | Not giving up the Three Precious Ones | Arrogance, pride is the root of all failing | With refuge you will not reborn in the three lower realms | Nanda |Angulimala’s life story | Benefits of taking refuge | Accumulation of virtue and generosity | Result or fruit of taking refuge | Power of taking refuge | Helpful to make offerings | Pronounce the refuge prayer three times | Meaning of each repetition | Refuge name, secret name | Keep secret so it can be useful in the bardo | Verse eight of 37 Bodhisattva’s Practice. 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 2 | 26th May 2017 | Afternoon Session 2nd part
[Audio 071-079] On: Verse eight of 37 Bodhisattva’s Practices cont. | Different types
of preta | Nothing appears, without a reason | Similar causes create consequences | Reduce negative actions | Hells, description according to Dütsi Bumzang | Why these hallucinations | Duration of life in hell | Reviving, Black Line Hells, Blisters | Wrong views; those different acts and emotions create a result that’s not favourable | Results of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, negative speech | Aversion | Importance of law of cause and effect | The sādhana based on the praise of Mañjuśrī –transmission, instructions. 

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group 2 | 27th May 2017 | Morning Session 
[Audio 080-102] On: What is innocence | Motivation, intention and guilt | Karma and guilt | Answers to quell emotion | Mindfulness and habitual patterns | Causes for transgressing bodhicitta | Why is karma explained? | The story of the old man that oth- ers didn’t want to ordain | It’s negative because it brings suffering | Negative actions of the mind cannot be bodhisattva’s conduct | Negative action is not a judgment | As long as we have aggregates, there is suffering | Ignorance in our mind is impermanent | To understand relative truth and ultimate truth, we need wisdom | Ambition that “I want to be free from saṃsāra” | We can’t say “These sentient beings suffer, and these sentient beings don’t suffer.” | Q. Negative karma of the others and interdependence | The moment one thing finishes another thing comes | Once it is sown, the seed, it keeps growing | Thinking of all sentient beings is a method to make minds vast | If you want to cook, then you need to know what ingredients to have | Giving rise to bo- dhicitta | Based on reasoning as making a business decision | Buddha as a bodhisattva wasn’t a spiritual wimp |Self-centeredness | Reasoning of dependence, reasoning of functionality, reasoning of logic and reasoning of nature | Practice of exchange | “To dedicate all your merit to that person” | The protocol that a bodhisattva should follow | Instructions on dissolution and concluding the sādhana Swif Path | 37 Practices of the Bodhisattvas- up to verse 13. 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 2 | 27th May 2017 | Afternoon Session
[Audio 103-114] On: Thirty-seven Bodhisattva Practices | Verse 8 | Lesser mental disposition is to “never engage unvirtuous actions” | Meditation is getting used to what you reflected | Verse 9 | The three worlds of existence | Pleasures of these worlds | Whatever is compounded is impermanent | Impermanence of life | Even celestial realms are terrifying for the wise | Making use of precious human life | The Four Noble Truths | Free of the chains of actions and emotions | Discipline, concentration and wisdom | Discipline is the basis of all the trainings | Know the nature of circle existence | Rebirth in higher existences | Wisdom and compassion should be combined | Verse 10 | Not leaving our mothers behind | Generating the enlightened mind | Buddhists have good intellect, but... Christianity have lot of compassion, but.. | Repaying kindness of our mothers | Mother’s love | Impartiality | Ngöndro practice | Four means of liberation.

sessionThemes:
3rd April 2016 | Morning Session
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 001 to 011] On: Buddha Śākyamuni Sādhana | Creating the right environment | Remembering the 3 Jewels | Meaning of going for refuge in Tibetan | Cause of refuge | Thinking of the suffering of saṃsāra and the lower realms | Negative actions and the emotion causing them and the result of them | Why we think of suffering | Karma | Cause and effect as a reason to refrain from negative actions and take refuge | Renouncing even the god realms | Bodhicitta, the ground for it and not turning it into a trip | The importance of contemplating suffering to develop discipline | Developing a genuine renunciation | Cause and effect as the soil for the understanding of the emptiness nature | Transmuting fear into strong resolution not to engage in negative emotions | Proper understanding of cause and effect as basis of Mahāyāna practice.

3rd April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 1st part
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
[Audio 012 to 018] On: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Shechen Kongtrul on Dudjom Rinpoche’s qualities, the head of the Nyingma school | Tsewang Dorje’s dream about J.K. Chokyi Lodrö and his emanations | Kangyur Rinpoche, Jigme Lingpa visions | the birth of Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Buddha Śākyamuni’s enlightenment, Four Noble Truths; Patrul Rinpoche, Longchenpa and the four Mañjuśrīs | 3 Perfections; bodhicitta – “semkye” | Asaṅga’s definition | the view to have in the “middle” | motivation, right view, dedication – bodhisattva’s tricks.

3rd April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 019 to 022] On: Karma | Ripening effects, result similar to the cause, similar to the action and similar to the experience | Transforming neutral actions into positive ones.

4th April 2016 | Morning Session
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche pg. 79
[Audio 023 to 036] On: The King of Aspirations for Noble Excellent Conduct by Samantabhadra (Zangchö mönlam) | Transforming neutral actions | The title, why it’s the king | Explanation of the verses | Homage to Mañjuśrī | Gathering the causes for the accomplishment of our aspirations | Seven branches | Prostration’s object, removing narrowness | Offering, vast like the bodhisattvas | Confession to cleanse our obstacles to the aspiration becoming a path | Rejoicing | Exhortation and requesting to remain | Dedicating these branches, accumulating merit so that aspirations become reality | Why we meet the Dharma only later in life | Aspiring to be a renunciate | Breaking the narrow view towards our native languages | Gentleness and outrageousness | Bodhicitta and what obscures it | Imperviousness to negativity due to past aspirations | It’s the best poetry | Removing limitations to our activity in benefiting others | Past aspirations as cause for first westerners meeting K. Kangyur Rinpoche | Causes for people meeting or not the Buddha | Prayer of what is conducive to our path.

4th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 1st part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
[Audio 037 to 043] On: Continuation of commentary on The Sublime Prayer of Good Action (or The King of Aspirations for Noble Excellent Conduct or Zangchömönlam) by Samantabhadra | Perfecting the aspiration | Bodhisattva conduct | Buddha’s speech | Wheel of Dharma | Engaging in Buddha’s activity | The power of awakening | The power of excellent conduct.

4th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 044 to 049] On: The three sublime methods | The sublime bodhicitta | The importance of all beings | Recognising all beings as our mothers, recognising their kindness, repaying their kindness | The approach of the three vehicles | The story of the poisonous plant growing in the garden | Deluded perceptions | The importance of dedication | Buddha dedicating the king’s offering to the beggar | Dedicating free of the concepts of the three spheres | Perceptions and channels | Final motivation of K. Trulshik Rinpoche.

placeTeaching: VIP Executive Entrecampos, (antigo Villa Rica), Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: Os Ensinamentos do Buda: Coração Bondoso, Clareza da Mente
mainThemes:
Reconhecido internacionalmente pela erudição e clareza com que ensina, Sua Santidade Ratna Vajra Rinpoche, o 42º Sakya Trizin é considerado como um dos mais importantes detentores da linhagem Khön e um dos mais qualificados mestres de meditação e de filosofia budista da Escola Sakya.

Neste ensinamento S. Santidade explica a importância de uma mente calma e clara associada a um coração bondoso, no relacionamento com o mundo que nos rodeia
audio2-tracksTitles: Esta versão em faixas intercaladas foi elaborada apartir da tradução simultânea registada durante o evento.

mainThemes:
Prática da Maṇḍala; Acumulação de mérito; Maṇḍala de realização e maṇḍala de oferenda; Maṇḍala externa, interna e secreta; As seis pāramitās; Os três treinos; Limpeza e pureza; Oferenda—libertação de tudo o que nos impede estar no estado desperto; Transcender a resistência.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices III | Video 1 of 3 
Main Topics: The maṇḍala practice | Centre and periphery—all-inclusive | Necessary settings for awakening | Easiest way to accumulate merit | Accumulation of merit is a direct antidote to the obscurations of our disturbing emotions | Really wish to become awakened | Learning how we relate to our grasping, our fear, our insecurities and basically our addiction to our environment | Two maṇḍalas: the Accomplishment maṇḍala and the offering maṇḍala | Three levels: outer, inner and secret maṇḍala | Elements of the maṇḍala practice | Cleanliness and purity

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices III | Video 2 of 3 
Main Topics: Accomplishment and offering maṇḍala | Accomplishment— transcending grasping to the five aggregates | Offering—letting go of everything preventing us from the awakened state of being | Working on grasping to beliefs as being real | Opening our mind to the most beautiful possibilities and the most beautiful things | Outer maṇḍala: the outer world | Getting accustomed | Making it vast | Inner maṇḍala: our body | There’s nothing that cannot be transformed into accumulation of merit and of wisdom | Secret maṇḍala: our mind and thoughts | The effect of practicing maṇḍala | The six pāramitās are present

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices III | Video 3 of 3
Main Topics: Everything that we are doing now on this path is in order to become awakened | The three trainings | The wisdom of study and contemplation | Meditation—Getting used to that wisdom | Annihilate the very cause of the cycle of existence | Desperation of craving, which obscures | Maṇḍala practice gives us the framework to let go | The moment we think of the Buddha, the Buddha is there | Cleansing our obscurations | Elements of the offering maṇḍala | Working with our own sloppiness, with our own procrastination | What we accumulate | Maṇḍala practice is not just some kind of merit in the future | Transcending resistance | Maṇḍala practice is based on refuge and bodhicitta | Details of the inner maṇḍala offering | Details of the secret maṇḍala offering | Focus on the outer maṇḍala for now | It is important to read the texts | Even just to have the wish to practice is so precious, so rare | Work with what we have and where we are | Accumulate merit through the six pāramitās | Please keep this precious wish to practice | Please connect the maṇḍala practice with your own present experiences | Don’t stress, make the most of it, enjoy it! | Keep a kind heart

eventTitle: A Mente Desperta e Como desenvolver a Calma Mental
mainThemes: Um dos mais notáveis e extraordinários mestres, ilustre representante da escola Kagyü, explica, no decurso deste magnífico ensinamento: a bodhicitta, os antídotos às acções negativas; como estender o amor aos animais e humanos e também a visão, a natureza fundamental, a vacuidade e a clareza; śamatha e vipaśyanā, a respiração como suporte à meditação e outros métodos e as palavras do Karmapa Rangjung Dorje, entre outros temas.

placeTeaching: Hotel Altis, Rua Castilho. Lisboa, Portugal
mainThemes:
Nestes ensinamentos, Sua Santidade guia-nos através de aspetos essenciais do caminho budista, iluminando os ensinamentos fundamentais do Mahāyāna, o Grande Veículo.  Apresenta temas clássicos da sabedoria budista; e a sua hábil tessitura de diversos tópicos inter-relacionados – como o amor e a compaixão, o mérito e a sabedoria, a raiva e a paciência, a meditação, a concentração, a mente-da-iluminação, a natureza do “eu” e dos fenómenos – permite-nos integrar plenamente o Dharma no nosso quotidiano.
Este ensinamento está também disponível enquanto livro, sob o título "A Entrada no Caminho Mahāyāna, os Ensinamentos de Sua Santidade em Lisboa 2016."

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II+I | 3rd Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st part 
[Audio Tracks 001-015] Main topics: The 51 mental factors; The 37 Practices of the Bodhisattvas—verses 13-16.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II+I | 3rd Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 2nd part 
[Audio tracks: 016-021] Main topics: Thirty-seven Practices of a Bodhisattva verse 17,18,19,20 & 21

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II+I | 3rd Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 022-034] Main topics: Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration. The bardos, four types of birth.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II+I | 3rd Nov. 2017 | 2nd Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 035-047] Main topics: 37 practices of a bodhisattva, verses 1—12.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II+I | 4th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st part 
[Audio tracks: 048-054] Main topics: Mind training—attachment, relationships, sense objects; Attachment—Craving, sense objects, addictions; Vajrayāna—misunderstandings, emotions, alcohol, meat, partners, siddhas.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II+I | 4th Nov. 2017 | Morning session | 2nd part 
[Audio tracks 055-064] Main topics: Question and answers; Mind training; Disturbing emotions; Vajrayāna; Enjoying emotions; Attachment.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group II+I | 4th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks 065-078] Main topics: Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration. Rebirth as human or as god; Do beings disappear at death; Do beings continue living as before.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II+I | 5th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio tracks 079-086] Main topics: Question and Answers: Transference of consciousness; Interdependence; Attachment; Tonglen; Doctrinal superiority and compassion.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II+I | 5th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio tracks 087-095] Main topics: Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas - Verse 13; Bodhicitta— in intention, giving rise, not losing it; Four virtuous and non-virtuous dharmas or conducts.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II+I | 5th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session- conclusion. 
[Audio track 095] Main topics: Padmakara; Teachings in Portuguese; Making use of time for the teachings.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group II+I | 5th Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon session 
[Audio tracks 096-105] Main topics Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration. After-death; Rebirth; Visions of deceased; different classes of spirits.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II+I | 5th Nov. 2017 | 2nd Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks 106-116] Main topics: Limitless mental dispositions; the effects of actions; Sādhana practice of Chenrezig; Maṇi Mantra and it’s power.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group I | 6th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 117-135] Main topics: Bodhicitta accumulation; Vajrayāna empowerments—vows, precepts; Vajrasattva—confession, Four Powers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group I | 6th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 2nd part 
[Audio tracks: 136-143] Main topics: Dealing with suffering and compassion; Vajrasattva; Cleansing obscurations; Vajrayāna—Empowerments, Teacher and student relationship; Milarepa; Social and Environmental work and Training.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group I | 6th Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks 144-158] Main topics Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration—Offerings of food for the deceased, Can the deceased manifest to the living, how rebirth happens.

H.H. Dalai Lama representative & Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group I | 6th Nov. 2017 | 2nd Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 159-172] Main topics: [Not transcribed]; Presentation of Kün-ngo Tashi Puntsok, H.H. representative in Southern Europe; General presentation of H.H’s vision, main points and activities; Questions&Answers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group I | 7th Nov. 2017 | 1st Morning Session 
[Audio tracks: 173-188] Main topics: ngöndro: refuge, bodhicitta practice; wisdom aspect of bodhicitta; analytical meditation instructions; nature of the I and aggregates.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group I | 7th Nov. 2017 | 2nd Morning session
[Audio tracks: 189-198] Main topics: Vajrasattva practice; obscurations; levels of negative actions; Vajrayāna—vows, secrecy, meat; Mala—symbolism and secrecy.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group I | 7th Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 199-213] Main topics: Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration—The eight similes of rebirth (The lesson learnt simply by listening, the lamp lighting another lamp, the reflection in a mirror, stamp on paper or a mould to shape soil, fire caused by a magnifying glass, sprout from a seed, saliva at the thought of some taste, an echo).

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group I | 7th Nov. 2017 | 2nd Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 214-227] Main topics: Vajrasattva practice—chapter from The Guide to The Words of My Perfect Teacher, practice instructions, purification basis, Four Powers.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
mainThemes: Observar o estado da mente; Os reinos de existência e emoções; Motivação para a prática; Obscurecimentos habituais; Qualidades do Buda, Dharma e Sanga; Gérard, Kangyur Rinpoche; Os ensinamentos de Buda; Existência cíclica; Obstáculos à meditação, 9 estadios da meditação; O Tesouro de Bençãos; Os sete ramos de acumulação de mérito; História da Particula do Oceano; Antídoto à preguiça; Quatro atenções plenas próximas; Via da acumulação; As 4 Verdades; Causas do sofrimentos; Aspectos da cessação do sofrimento; Refúgio

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
eventTitle: Retiro da Primavera | Treino da Mente 1
mainThemes: As 4 Nobres Verdades | Analisar, contemplar, investigar não apenas os fenómenos externos, mas o sujeito interno | As preliminares consistem em assegurar que as bases da via são estáveis | A Bodhicitta relativa e absoluta | 5 forças do treino da mente: resolução, familiarização, sementes positivas, repulsa e aspiração | As coisas não são permanentes, independentes ou singulares – primeiro desenvolver certeza nisso, depois há que sentar e aplicar | Usando os obstáculos como degraus no caminho | Lembrar-se de dedicar | Instruções para a morte | Todos os 84.000 ensinamentos de Buda foram concebidos para subjugar o apego ao ego | Vacuidade | Pensar nos outros antes de nós próprios | Śrāvakayāna, Mahāyāna e Vajrayāna | Emulando aqueles que seguem os ensinamentos | “Enlightened Courage”, orientações sobre como aplicar o treino da mente | 3 coisas que não devem deteriorar: determinação, entusiasmo e Bodhicitta | De todas as nossas atividades a mais importante é sentar e praticar

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
8th April 2024 | Morning Session | Part I
[Audio tracks 001-006] Main Topics: mind training 1; “Enlightened Courage” by Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche: a commentary on Ngulchu Thogme Zangpo’s work on the Seven Point mind training root text by Chekawa; the Four Noble Truths; Studying the preliminaries; the Mahāyāna path; relative and ultimate bodhicitta

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
8th April 2024 | Day 1 | Morning Session Part 2
[Audio Tracks: 007-012] Main Topics: mind training 1; “Enlightened Courage” by Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche: a commentary on Ngulchu Thogme Zangpo’s work on the Seven Point mind training root text by Chekawa; The five strengths; relative and ultimate bodhicitta

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
8th April 2024 | Afternoon session
[Audio Tracks: 013 to 023] Main Topics: “Enlightened Courage” by Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; the five strengths

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th April 2024 | Morning Session | Part I
[Audio Tracks: 024 to 032] Main topics: Proficiency in mind training; explanation of the four noble truths; emptiness; interdependence; tonglen; bodhicitta; revulsion and aspiration

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th April 2024 | Morning Session |Part II
[Audio Tracks: 033 to 037] Main topics: Commitments of mind training; practice commitments of the Śrāvakayāna and Vajrayāna; practice of tonglen; consistency in mind training; Different approaches according to Śrāvakayāna, Mahāyāna and Vajrayāna paths; Emulating those who follow the teachings

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th April 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part I
[Audio Tracks: 038 to 043] Main topics: Being inspired to learn the Buddha´s teachings; Verse 22, “Thirty-seven Practices of a Bodhisattva”; commitments of mind training; relative and ultimate cannot be separated; working on strongest defilements first.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th April 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part II
[Audio Tracks: 044 to 049] Main topics: “Enlightened Courage”; guidelines on how to apply the mind training; three essential factors; devotion, enthusiasm, and bodhicitta; two aspects of Dharma: exposition and practice

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th October 2018 | Morning | 1st part
[Audio tracks: 001-011] Main topics: The path and practice—Understanding it, the motivation of it. Facing emotions directly. Unconditional devotion, what is real renunciation. Example of teachers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th October 2018 | Morning session | 2nd part
[Audio tracks: 012-015] Main topics: Buddha Śākyamuni Sādhana— Instructions; Eight freedoms—it’s seeds, cutting the weeds; Appreciating the opportunity.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
12th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st part
[Audio tracks: 016-027] Main topics: Precious human life; Positive and negative actions; Two Vehicles; Past and future lives and the law of cause and effect.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
12th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 028-039] Main topics: Mother’s kindness; Love; Birth and death process; Sur offering—four guests; Dilgo Khyentse R.—Driver in Tibet; Pema Wangyal R.—birth, studying with Dudjom R.

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Razões e benefícios de fazer a prática de Maṇḍala | Reunir condições favoráveis no caminho | Mandala de realização e de oferenda | A oferenda como antídoto para o apego | Sete riquezas dos seres nobres – roda, joia, rainha, ministro, elefante, cavalo e general preciosos – e o vaso do tesouro | A montanha preciosa, a árvore dos desejos, a vaca que tudo satisfaz e a colheita espontânea | Oito deusas de oferendas | Sol e lua | O pára-sol precioso e o estandarte da vitória universal | Oferenda externa, interna e secreta de Maṇḍala | Corpo, fala e mente empenhados em acumular mérito e sabedoria | O campo de mérito | Oferendas puras e impuras | Compaixão na prática de fazer oferendas | Sūtra do Ser Sublime | Benefícios

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
7th May 2023 | Morning Session 
[Audio-tracks 001-012] Main topics: Reasons and benefits of doing the Maṇḍala practice | To gather favourable conditions on the path |. Explaining the Maṇḍala practice in detail.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
7th May 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 013-025] Main topics: Offering as an antidote to attachment | Seven riches of the noble ones.| Eight offering goddesses | Sun and moon | Jewel canopy, banner of universal victory | Outer, inner and secret maṇḍala offering | Body, speech and mind engaging in accumulating merit | Merit and wisdom.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
8th May 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 027-038] Main topics: Maṇḍala offering | The elements of the offering | Ways of accumulating merit | The field of merit | The mindset to practice generosity | The objects of offering | Our motivation when offering | Pure and impure offerings | What to offer and what not to offer | Compassion in the practice of making offering.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
8th May 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 039-050] Main topics: Sūtra Of The Sublime Being; the benefit of maṇḍala offering.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2017 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio tracks: 001-015] Main topics: reasons for meditating, obstacles to meditation, interdependent origination as basis of teachings, homage to the Buddha, Buddha’s epithets.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
28th October 2017 | 2nd morning session | Prelude 
[Audio: 016] Main topics: Precisions on silence during the retreat.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2017 | Morning session | 2nd Part
[Audio: 017-023] Main topics: Śamatha instructions—placing the mind, following and counting the breath, silence.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2017 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part 
[Audio 024-027] Main topics: Śamatha instructions—Exhaling stale air, motivation, posture; Mind training.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2017 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio 028-032] Main topics: Śamatha instructions—breath as support, image of the Buddha, midfulness, vigilance, calming the mind; Vipaśyanā.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2017 | morning session | 1st part 
[Audio 033-037] Main points: Śamatha—Key points to remember; Buddha’s blessings.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2017 | Morning session | 2nd part 
[Audio 037-038] Main topics: Post meditation; Simply being aware; Not getting pulled.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st part 
[Audio 039-042] Main topics: Śamatha instructions—Mindfulness and vigilance, placing, patching, continuous placing; Consciousness; Thoughts; Meditation.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2017 | Afternoon session | 2nd part 
[Audio 043-048] Main topics: Question and Answers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th October 2017 | Morning session | 1st part 
[Audio 049-051] Main topics: Training the mind—the actual mindfulness practice, making disturbing emotions less powerful; Receiving the blessings of the Buddha; Practicing for the sake of all sentient beings.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th October 2017 | Morning session | 2nd part 
[Audio 052-055] Main topics: Posture—channels and gaze.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th October 2017 | Afternoon session | 1st Part 
[Audio 056] Main topics: Meditation posture.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th October 2017 | Afternoon session | 2nd part 
[Audio 057-058] Main topics: Unwholesome Mental Factors; Importance of Śamatha

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
30th October 2017 | Afternoon session | Conclusion 
[Audio 060-061] Main topics: Silence; Fulfilling Kangyur Rinpoche’s wishes; Saving lives, helping others, protecting the environment; acknowledging institutions.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
31st October 2017 | Morning Session 
[Audio 062-073] Main topics: Questions and Answers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st October 2018 | Morning Session 
[Audio tracks: 074-078] Main topics: To be aware of the breath.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2017 | Afternoon Session | 1st part 
[Audio 079-097] Main topics: Śamatha—five obstacles and it’s antidotes; Mindfulness and vigilance in life; Obstacle to calm mind.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2017 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part 
[Audio tracks: 088-095] Main topics: Śamatha meditation; the truth of the path; the eightfold noble path; the three trainings; taking refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma and the Saṅgha; the four reliances

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
2nd November 2017 | Morning session
[Audio 096-105] Main topics: Refuge—ceremony, precepts.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
2nd November 2017 | Afternoon Session
[Audio 107-117] Main topics: 51 mental factors, Questions and answers.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | Introduction 
[Audio-tracks: Intro 001-004] Main topics: Relating to the present situation of pandemic COVID 19. Bodhicitta; ego-clinging.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | 1st part 
[Audio-tracks: 001-009] Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices; getting accustomed to bodhicitta practice; working with our self-centeredness; what defines buddhas and bodhisattvas; the two aspects of bodhicitta: bodhicitta in intention and bodhicitta in action

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | 2nd part
[Audio-tracks: 010-019] Main Topics: four immeasurables: impartiality, loving-kindness, compassion, sympathetic joy; best place to practice; training bodhicitta with the four immeasurables: accumulating merit; the power and qualities of bodhicitta; ten Dharma activities; four unwholesome actions

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video teachings | 3rd part 
[Audio-tracks: 020-024] Main Topics: mindset; bodhicitta percepts; duality; developing bodhicitta; what destroys and degenerates bodhicitta; self-centeredness; bodhicitta in intention; practice of exchange; importance of repetitiveness; discipline; diligence; patience; accumulations

"Breves Práticas Preliminares da Quintessência Secreta da Grande Perfeição" Kyabje Kangyur Rinpoche , Padmakara (Pt)

"Brief Preliminary Practice from the Secret Heart Essence" Kyabje Kangyur Rinpoche, Padmakara"

"Uma Lamparina para Dissipar as Trevas - Práticas Preliminares do Senhor da Grande Compaixão" Kyabje Trulshik Rinpoche Ngawang Do-ngak Tendzin Chökyi Lodrö, Ed Padmakara Pt

"A Beacon to Dispel the Gloom - Recitation text for the Preliminary Practice of the Lord of Great Compassion" Kyabje Trulshik Rinpoche Ngawang Do-ngak Tendzin Chökyi Lodrö, Ed Padmakara

organização: F. Kangyur R. | Songtsen | Stupa | U.B.P.
placeTeaching: UBP, Av. 5 de Outubro, Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: O Nono Capítulo da Via do Bodhisattva - Parte 3 de 3
mainThemes:
A terceira e última parte dos ensinamentos de Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche sobre o Nono Capítulo do Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra – “A Via do Bodhisattva”, acerca da natureza última da realidade, dos fenómenos e do eu. Estes ensinamentos são baseados no comentário  “Ketaka Norbu”, (traduzido com o título "The Wisdom Chapter") de Jamgön Mipham Rinpoche. Além deste capítulo, Khenchen Rinpoche também ensinou o décimo e último capítulo d'A Via do Bodhisattva que consiste na "dedicatória".

Inclui as sessões de revisão por Wulstan Fletcher, tradutor inglês de ambas obras, onde os ensinamentos de Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche e os textos são analisados e discutidos.

sessionThemes:
Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 1 | 6th Oct 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: Root cause of saṃsāra—grasping the personal self | Liberation through the wisdom that realises no-self | Four close mindfulnesses | The body is just a label | Knowing through inference—the body does not exist inherently | All form is like a dream | The nature, cause and result of feelings | Happiness and suffering are not existent in the mind, nor in external objects

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 2 | 7th Oct 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: Four close mindfulnesses | The close mindfulness of feeling | Attachment to pleasure and pain | Antidote to grasping—meditation and analysis, mind- fulness and vigilant introspection | Lack of inherent existence of feelings | Examination of the cause of feelings | Examination of the result of feelings | Examination of the feeling subject | That which feels has no true existence | The close mindfulness of the mind | The five consciousnesses have no inherent existence | Illusory existence is there on the relative level because of causes and conditions | Close mindfulness of phenomena | The way phenomena arise is beyond understanding—they are without origin
 
Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 3 | 8th Oct. 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: Close mindfulness of phenomena | Investigation of cause, result and nature | The three doors of liberation | The cause is devoid of characteristics | Refutation of objections that the two truths are untenable | The two truths are established to guide beings to the ultimate | When self-arisen wisdom appears, the ordinary mind ceases | Analysis is tenable even though it is without existence | A truly existent analysis is untenable | In everyday perception there is cause for everything | A cause has the power to produce many different results | Things arise in interdependent origination | A refutation of the belief that something that is not the cause of the world is a cause

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 4 | 9th Oct 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: Refutation of misconceptions | Refutation of the view that the world is caused by a conscious god | In permanence no action can happen | Examination of the way in which effects are created | Refutation of the view that the world is produced by inert unconscious entities | Sāṃkhya philosophy is quite subtle and profound | “Real,” “existent,” “nonexistent” are all conceptual elaborations | Understanding nonexistence becomes an antidote to clinging to things as existent | The Middle Way: avoiding extremes of nihilism and eternalism

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 5 | 10th Oct 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: Cause, result and nature | The cause is devoid of characteristics | An exposition of the correct view | The twelve links of interdependent origination | Nothing is that does not have a cause, and nothing is existent in its causes | Things arise but they don’t have their own substantial nature and they are empty of their causes | The nature of phenomena is emptiness | The result is established as being beyond expectation | There are no entities, and likewise there’s no ceasing of the same | At all times there is nothing but the state of perfect equality

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 6 | 11th Oct 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: The result of realizing emptiness | Equalizing of one’s eight worldly concerns | The effortless display of love for others | Beings cling to self and suffer endlessly | Thus life passes quickly, meaninglessly | Dedication | Wishing happiness for sentient beings in the immediate term | In the ultimate, wishing for their long-term happiness | When one is free from the concept of three spheres; subject, object, and action, that becomes the ultimate dedication

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 7 | 12th Oct 2019 | Morning Session
Summary: Dedication: whereby the merit of striving in the way of bodhisattva is pledged to the welfare of others | Dedication of virtue in order to free beings from suffering | Aspiration prayers for all beings | May all achieve supreme enlightenment

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 1 | 6th Oct 2019 | Afternoon Session
Summary: Wisdom is the basis of the whole Mahāyāna enterprise | The textual out- line explained | Śāntarakṣita and the synthesis of Madhyamaka and Cittamātra |Two kinds of Cittamātrin Mind-Only school | Refutations of mind as ultimately existing | The co-emergent and imputed self | The personal no-self and the phenomenal no- self | The fruit of the realization of the personal no-self is liberation from saṃsāra. The fruit of the realization of the phenomenal no-self is omniscience, the state of a fully enlightened Buddha | The four close-mindfulnesses | The Mahāyāna path wakes us up to the true reality of phenomenal existence | The distinction between nonconceptual and conceptual consciousnesses | Close-mindfulness of the body | Hallucination of “wholes” as the basis for karma and suffering | Close-mindfulness of feeling

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 2 | 7th Oct 2019 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: Only through understanding and realizing the emptiness of the person- al self is liberation from saṃsāra possible | Understanding the no-self of phenomena is the means to realize the full enlightenment of omniscience | The close-mindful- ness of feelings | The problem with relative truth is not the fact that it happens to us, but the fact that it causes us pain | When phenomena are understood, they lose their power over us | An examination of the cause of feelings | What we think to be a real feeling is an imaginary construction | Waking up is hard work but there is no alternative | Nothing wrong with feeling, with anything provided you leave as it is | An examination of the result of feelings | An examination of the feeling subject | Simultaneity rules out causal connection | There is no rational explanation for anything that we take to be normal | The close-mindfulness of the mind | The close-mindfulness of phenomena | What we crystallize as an individual thing is a kind of hallucination

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 3 | 8th Oct 2019 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: The close-mindfulness of phenomena | Phenomena are unborn | A specific investigation on the cause, result and nature | Phenomena, being empty, are de- void of really existent characteristics | The system of two truths is propounded solely for didactic purposes, as an entry to the path | When the ultimate truth in itself is realized, there are no two truths | The appearances of saṃsāra is an individual matter | The true realization of emptiness is freedom from mental elaboration | Primordial wisdom is not something created, it has been there all the time | A refutation of an objection that reasoned analysis of phenomena is untenable | What is knowledge and how do we know things? | The nature of what is called the cause | Misconceptions about the cause | Defects of eternalism

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 4 | 9th Oct. 2019 | Afternoon Session p. 319
Summary: Aspects of Madhyamaka and Indian philosophy | Intermingling of Hinduism and Buddhism | Clear differences | History of the Bodhicaryāvatāra | The Dunhuang manuscripts | The theistic question | The Sāṁkhyas and theory of causality | Cause, result and nature of phenomena | Pointing out inconsistencies | Re- futing the possibility of God | Puruṣa (the conscious element) and prakŗti (matter) – both eternal | Refutation of the Sāṁkhya position | Different ways of expressing buddha nature

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 5 | 10th Oct. 2019 | Afternoon Session
Summary: Theism as clinging to self | Buddha nature is not a cause | An exposition of the correct view | Twelvefold chain of dependent origination | Explanations of the causal process | Refutation of the four theories of production | Cause, result and nature | The nature of phenomena is emptiness| On the level of ultimate truth, no things are real, yet on the level of relative truth they are ineluctable | Two kinds of self | Difficulty of the co-emergent self | Interdependence completely excludes the possibility of real existence | The hallucinatory effect of language— we think that existence is possessed by things | Even through a hundred million causes, no change takes place in nonexistent things | Nonexistence is just a space, a gap | Saṃsāra is an illusion, nirvāṇa is also an illusion. Emptiness is also empty of emptiness | Two kinds of ālaya | Madhyamaka is only interested in the question of real existence | Nirvāṇa and saṃsāra are two manifestations the buddha nature | Three doors of perfect liberation all refer to emptiness

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 6 | 11th Oct. 2019 | Afternoon Session
Summary: Result of realizing emptiness | Equalizing of the eight worldly concerns through the understanding of ultimate bodhicitta | Beings all have one taste | Who are our relatives and friends? | Effortless display of love for others | Do not waste this precious human life | An enormous bundle of twelvefold chains of interdependent links, constantly evolving | Energy to engage in the practice | The desire to emerge definitively| Atiśa’s troublesome cook| Four kinds of maras | Need to gain certainty about the pure and unmistaken path | Ultimate bodhicitta is the ground, the practice of tantra is impossible without understanding emptiness| Buddhahood is easy for someone who is happy, it’s difficult for someone who is miserable | The heavenly realms | Samatha without vipaśyanā creates karmic cause of birth in the form realms and formless realms | Bodhicitta is a state of wisdom, and compassion unfolds from that point of view | Sectarianism, civil war, repression and the Rimé renaissance | Mipham Rinpoche’s extraordinary synthetic gift

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 7 | 12th Oct. 2019 | Afternoon Session
Summary; Tenth Chapter divided into three parts: a brief exposition, a detailed teaching, and the conclusion | Why is it important to dedicate?| Problems with the word “merit” | Sönam – a source of energy and strength | Dedication protects your virtue, your merit | Two types of virtue - sönam chatün and tarpa chatün | Important for dedication to be free of the three concepts of agent, action and object of action | Make great aspirations | Dedicating the merit to all beings | Suffering in the lower and higher realms| Try not to downplay the teachings on the lower realms | In the dream, suffering is very real | Emptiness nature means this can change | For the Bodhisattva, no distinction between abuser and abused | The three deities and wisdom, love and power | Dedicate virtue, mingling it with Śāntideva’s —just as we might mix a drop of water with the great ocean| The dedication should be linked with aspiration, heartfelt longing, commitment, and prayer | Way of the Bodhisattva is a path of great confidence, know that you can do it | The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are our witnesses | Self-denigration – it is a lazy mind that says it cannot practice | Meditate on compassion, wishing that beings be free from sorrow and its causes.| Visualization - the solid room is the illusion, Mañjuśrī is the reality | The wish for women to have the same advantages as men | Many great women teachers | The life story of Yeshe Tsogyal

mainThemes: Recordando a bondade do Buda | Compreender o que significa praticar | Veículos mundano e supramundano | Histórias sobre mahāsiddhas | Ngöndro | 100.000 não é uma palavra mágica | Criar músculos requer repetição | Tomar refúgio no despertar | Preciosa vida humana, impermanência, lei da causa e efeito e sofrimento do saṃsāra | Importância e diferentes tipos de motivação | Conectando a prática com a Bodhicitta | Razão pela qual ela é a essência dos ensinamentos | Dedicação | As cinco perfeições | Conduta ao escutar ensinamentos e ao praticar | Práticas preliminares de Chenrezig, Vajrakilaya e Padmasambhava | Histórias de Kyabje Kangyur Rinpoche | Unindo o corpo, fala e mente do Guru com o nosso corpo, fala e mente | Conselhos de pós-meditação | Na altura da morte, abandonar o medo, a raiva, o apego e ser estável | Oito liberdades, dezasseis liberdades adicionais e dez vantagens

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st May 2023 | Morning Session 
[Audio-tracks 001-012] Main topics: Preliminary practices; refuge and bodhicitta; the importance of knowing who the Buddha was; the main purpose of the Buddha’s teaching; effecting our mind.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st May 2023 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio-tracks 013-025] Main topics: A framework for all practices that we do; the importance and different kinds of motivation; the importance of keeping the motivation alive and why and how to dedicate.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2nd 2023 | Morning Session 
[Audio-tracks 026-035] Main topics: Buddha Śākyamuni Sādhana; mind training; Five Perfections; law of cause and effect.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
2nd May 2023 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio-tracks 036-049] Main topics: Conduct related to listening to teachings and practicing; Preliminary for each session; Four Thoughts that Turn Our Mind Away from Saṃsāra; precious human life; eight freedoms.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3nd May 2023 | Morning Session 
[Audio-tracks 050-059] Main topics: The first steps on mind-training: preliminary to the preliminaries; The importance of the contemplation of the precious human life; a precious opportunity to train the mind not to be caught and enslaved by the dream-like experiences of the six realms – not real, though perceived as real – like hallucinations, experiences of the mind.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd May 2023 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio-tracks 060-078] Main topics: Questions; Refuge practice; fuelling our motivation; precious human life; eight intrusive characteristics; eight additional freedoms and eight incompatible propensities; five individual advantages; five circumstantial advantages; reading transmissions.

eventTitle: A Linhagem Khyentse | O sūtra que leva à recordação das Três Jóias

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group B | 1st May 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 001-012] Main topics: The Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas. Mind training as essence of Dharma. Disturbing emotions and peace of mind.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group B | 1st May 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 013-017] Main topics: the Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas. Verse 21; Verse 22—Nature of perceptions and of mind. 

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group B | 1st May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 018-034] Main topics: The Wheel of Analysis and Meditation that Thoroughly Purifies Mental Activities; Negative emotions and how to relate to the objects of perceptions

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group B | 1st May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 035-047] Main topics:The Blessings of the Teachers and Teachings, The Bodhisattva Way of Life; Interdependence; Mind Training;

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group B | 2nd May 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 048-054] Main topics: Preciousness of the Thirty-Seven Practices; Refuge and devotion—not as culture, the reason of the path, of Buddha as guide not as creator; Faith.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group B | 2nd May 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 055-058] Main topics: Verse 22 and 23; Emptiness and Appearance; Post-meditation—trace of view of emptiness and illusory aspect.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group B | 2nd May 2018 | Afternoon Session |1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 059-075] Main topics: The Wheel of Analysis and Meditation That Thoroughly Purifies Mental Activity—Dividing the body, the object of attachment into it’s parts; The five aggregates.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group B | 2nd May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks 076-088] Main topics: Suffering and Causes of Suffering; Compassion, The Six Pāramitās, Emptiness and Appearance

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group B | 3rd May 2018 | Morning Session
[Audio Tracks 089-116] Main topics: Verses 25-37; Generosity; Discipline; Patience; Diligence; Concentration; Wisdom; The Four Instructions Taught in the Sūtra; Abandonment of the Negative Emotions; Accomplish the Good of Other’s Through Attention and Mindfulness; Dedication of Merit

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group B | 3rd May 2018 | Afternoon Session |1st Part
[Audio Tracks 117-128] Main topics: The Wheel of Analysis and Meditation That Thoroughly Purifies Mental Activity—Analizing the body and the aggregates; All phenomena in change; Non-self.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group B | 3rd May 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 129-139] Main topics: Refuge; Patience; Generosity; The Bodhisattva Way of Life

placeTeaching: Hotel Altis, Rua Castilho. Lisboa, Portugal
mainThemes: Sua Santidade, 41º Sakya Trichen, um dos mais importantes mestres da atualidade, líder da escola Sakya, fala-nos da importância da compaixão e do treino da mente para a paz e a felicidade, tão urgentes e necessárias hoje como sempre. Como S.S. afirma, “precisamos de encontrar a verdadeira paz e felicidade interiores e isso só é possível através de progressos mentais alcançados com a prática espiritual”.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II | 3rd Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st part
[Audio Tracks 001-015] Main topics The 51 mental factors; The 37 Practices of the Bodhisattvas—verses 13-16.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II | 3rd Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 2nd part
[Audio tracks: 016-021] Main topics Thirty-seven Practices of a Bodhisattva verse 17,18,19,20 & 21

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II | 3rd Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 022-034] Main topics Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration. The bardos, four types of birth.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II | 3rd Nov. 2017 | 2nd Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 035-047] Main topics 37 practices of a bodhisattva, verses 1—12.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II | 4th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st part
[Audio tracks: 048-054] Main topics: Mind training—attachment, relationships, sense objects; Attachment—Craving, sense objects, addictions; Vajrayāna—misunderstandings, emotions, alcohol, meat, partners, siddhas.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II | 4th Nov. 2017 | Morning session | 2nd part 
[Audio tracks 055-064] Main topics: Question and answers; Mind training; Disturbing emotions; Vajrayāna; Enjoying emotions; Attachment.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group II | 4th Nov. 2017 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks 065-078] Main topics: Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration. Rebirth as human or as god; Do beings disappear at death; Do beings continue living as before.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II | 5th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio tracks 079-086] Main topics: Question and Answers: Transference of consciousness; Interdependence; Attachment; Tonglen; Doctrinal superiority and compassion.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group II | 5th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio tracks 087-095] Main topics: Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas - Verse 13; Bodhicitta— in intention, giving rise, not losing it; Four virtuous and non-virtuous dharmas or conducts.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II | 5th Nov. 2017 | Morning Session- conclusion.
[Audio track 095] Main topics: Padmakara; Teachings in Portuguese; Making use of time for the teachings.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group II | 5th Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon session
[Audio tracks 096-105] Main topics Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration. After-death; Rebirth; Visions of deceased; different classes of spirits.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group II | 5th Nov. 2017 | 2nd Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks 106-116] Main topics: Limitless mental dispositions; the effects of actions; Sādhana practice of Chenrezig; Maṇi Mantra and it’s power.

The transcription includes:

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group I | 6th Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks 144-158] Main topics: Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration—Offerings of food for the deceased, Can the deceased manifest to the living, how rebirth happens.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Group I | 7th Nov. 2017 | 1st Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 199-213] Main topics: Sūtra Questions Regarding Death and Transmigration—The eight similes of rebirth, (The lesson learnt simply by listening, the lamp lighting another lamp, the reflection in a mirror, stamp on paper or a mould to shape soil, fire caused by a magnifying glass, sprout from a seed, saliva at the thought of some taste, an echo)

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: A prática de Vajrasattva e as práticas do Vajrayāna | A importância do refúgio e da Bodhicitta | Os quatro poderes | Purificar os obscurecimentos e acumular mérito | Desenvolver a ligação com os nossos Mestres | Transmissão oral da oração a Kuntuzangpo (por se tratar de um dia de eclipse) | Como fazer a prática de Vajrasattva, desde a atitude mental até à visualização | Explicações detalhadas | Limpeza das doenças, das forças negativas e das ações negativas | Significado do mantra das cem sílabas | Histórias de Aṅgulimāla, do rapaz que queria ser um mercador, de Nanda e de Ajātaśatru | Exemplos de Sūtras | Sinais dos resultados da prática | Instruções para uma sessão | Pós-meditação

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th May 2023 | Morning session
[Audio tracks: 001-011] Main topics: Vajrasattva practice; Vajrayāna practices; refuge and bodhicitta

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th May 2023 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 012-026] Main topics: Vajrasattva practice; the four powers – power of antidote; Purifying obscurations and accumulating merit; Developing the connection with our teachers

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
6th of May | Morning Session
[Audio tracks: 027-042] Main topic: How to do the Vajrasattva practice from the mindset to the visualisation ; The importance of refuge and bodhicitta.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
6th May 2023 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 043-054] Main topic: Vajrasattva practice; Detailed explanation and instructions; Motivation.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
eventTitle: Retiro de Outono | As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas
mainThemes: As 37 Práticas (Estrofes 21 a 24)Prosternações; 5 vias e obscurecimentos; Paramita da generosidade; Diligência; Conselho em quatro linhas; Focando nos outros; Trazer a doença para a via; Sete Ramos; Esperança e medo; O peso das expectativas; Sobre Patrul Rinpoche; Pratica espiritual na vida quotidiana; Partícula do Oceano; Aspirações de Buda Shakyamuni; Tesouro de Bençãos; Grandes Bodhisattvas; 5 vias e 10 níveis; Oferenda vasta; Benefício de dar; Factores que destroem a virtude; Instruções para as oferendas; Sete ramos e mandala; Gerar Bodhicitta; Estabelecer as fronteiras; pequenos retiros; Limpar as causas e condições; Dharani da Nuvem de Oferendas; Atenção plena e vigilância; Oferenda do Mandala; Meses especiais; Sabedoria na via, Qualidades de Guru Rinpoche; Linhagem das 37 Práticas; Confiança e conexão com o Mestre;  Oferenda de Sang; Oferenda de Sur; Retiros paralelos; 3 aspectos da Disciplina; Tirar a vida e outras faltas do corpo; Faltas da fala e faltas da mente; Projectos para Monchique; Mente para lá da dualidade; Inexistência de existência intrínseca

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche | Rangdrol Rinpoche
placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: As Quatro Nobres Verdades | Mandala como forma fácil e poderosa de acumulação de mérito | Esta prática permite superar o nosso apego | As quatro rodas que nos ajudam a progredir | A primeira roda: estar num lugar perfeito para praticar o Dharma | Segunda roda: encontrar e confiar num mestre autêntico | Histórias sobre Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche e outros grandes mestres | Mandala de realização e de oferenda | Como fazer a oferenda | Significado dos trinta e sete elementos | A linhagem da “Lamparina para dissipar as trevas” | A oferenda da Mandala passo a passo | O que esta prática deve ser e o que não deve ser | Guru Yoga: a importância crucial da devoção e o guru | Significado e objetivo do Guru Yoga | A necessidade de um guru exterior e as histórias de mestres passados | Explicação da prática | Visão geral de todas as práticas que precedem o Guru Yoga e conselhos sobre a mesma | Excertos de "A chuva de bençãos"
