sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2022 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 001-016] Main topics: Various aspects of Four Noble Truths;
Mandala as an easy and powerful way of accumulation of merit

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
1st November 2022 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio tracks: 017-021] Main topics: Mandala practice to overcome our attachment for the sake of all sentient beings; All the great masters considered mandala practice so important

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
2nd November 2022 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 022-031] Main topics: No transcription available

Shechen Rabjam Rinpoche
2nd November 2022 | Morning Session
[Audio tracks: 032-039] Main topics: The first wheel: being in a perfect place to practice the Dharma; Second wheel: finding an authentic master and relying upon an authentic master; Stories about Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche and other great masters

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
2nd November | Morning Session
[Audio tracks: 040-053] Main topics: Accomplishment and offering Mandala; how to make the offering; meaning of the thirty-seven elements

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
2nd November 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks: 055-064] Main topics: The lineage of the Beacon to Dispel the Gloom; the Mandala offering step by step

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd November 2022 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio tracks: 067-071] Main topics: What Mandala practice should be and shouldn’t be; Guru Yoga practice: the crucial importance of devotion and the guru

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd November 2022 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 072-083] Main topics: The meaning and goal of Guru Yoga; The need for outer Guru and the stories of past masters; Explanation of practice.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
3rd November 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks: 084-094] Main topics: Overview of all the practices preceding Guru Yoga; Advices on the Guru Yoga practice.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche | Rangdrol Rinpoche
eventTitle: Retiro Primavera | As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas
mainThemes: As 37 práticas dos Bodhisattvas (Estrofe 10 a 21); O Tesouro de Bençãos; O Sutra das Três Jóias Sublimes; O propósito dos ensinamentos de Buda; Solidão; Sofrimento e as suas causas; A Mente de Buda; Dharma dos ensinamentos e  da realização; Disciplina; Qualidades da Sangha; Prosternações; Treino da mente em 7 Pontos; Qualidades do Buda, Dharma e Sangha; Obscurecimentos emocionais; Vida mundana e espiritual; Shamatha e pos meditação; Objecto de concentração; "Oferenda de Sur Branco"; O terreno para os obscurecimentos; Mente ilimitada e aspectos subtis da mente; Um altar simples; Observar as acções negativas, Trabalhar com as emoções; Importância do Refúgio; Bodhicitta relativo e absoluto; Motivação correcta; Ignorância; Percepções limitadas; Dependência dos outros; Necessidade de se ser humilde; As 3 perfeições; A importância da simplicidade; Os fenómenos como sonho; A natureza não nascida da Atenção Plena; Tonglen; Transformar as circunstâncias adversas-perdas

placeTeaching: Faculdade de Medicina Dentária, Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: Despertar a Paz Interior | A Via do Bodhisattva de Śāntideva
mainThemes: Sua Santidade, o XIV Dalai Lama, simultaneamente um dos mais respeitados líderes mundiais pela paz e valores humanos e dos principais mestres budistas da atualidade, explica nestes ensinamentos, conferidos ao longo de três dias, a Via do Bodhisattva de Śāntideva (Bodhicaryāvatāra); ensinando em detalhe o nono capítulo sobre a sabedoria e percorrendo de forma breve e resumida os restantes capítulos que compõe esta obra essencial do Budismo Mahāyāna.

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Objetivo da oferenda da maṇḍala e explicação da prática | Leitura dos tópicos principais da oferenda da maṇḍala de acordo com o livro “Charriot to Freedom” | Método para completar as duas acumulações | Maṇḍala de trinta e sete elementos como uma oferenda externa | Oferenda interna e secreta da maṇḍala | Oferecer os sete ramos | Benefícios desta prática | Instruções específicas e adicionais | Prosternações, quando e como fazê-las de acordo com “ O Excelente Caminho da Libertação”

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
22nd April 2025 | Morning Session 1
[Audio Tracks 001-011] Main topics: Purpose of the maṇḍala offering, and
practice explanation.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
22nd April 2025 | Morning Session 2
[Audio tracks 012-015] Main topics: ‘The Chariot to Freedom’ chapter
twelve: “The Maṇḍala Offering, The Method for Completing the Two Accumulations”
| General explanation | Explanation by Chögyal Phakpa of how to
offer the thirty-seven-element maṇḍala in an outward way | How this maṇḍala
description works as a skilful means.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
22nd April 2025 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 016-030] Main topics: ‘A Chariot to Freedom’; chapter
twelve “The Maṇḍala Offering, The Method for Completing the Two Accumulations”;
inner and secret maṇḍala offering; offering the Seven Branches;
benefits of the maṇḍala offering; specific and additional instructions on how
to offer the maṇḍala; forms of veneration; when and how to do the prostrations
according to the ‘Excellent Path of Liberation’.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Significado do refúgio | 4 nobres verdades | Gosto, não gosto, medo e obsessão | 3 tipos de motivação | Semente da verdade do caminho | A preciosa vida humana, impermanência, lei de causa e efeito e sofrimento do samsara | Transmissões: “Os 21 louvores a Ārya Tārā”, “Soberana aspiração para uma excelente conduta”, 9º capítulo do “Tantra da grande perfeição” e “Chuva de bênçãos” | Prática durante um eclipse | Sublimes qualidades do Buda | Meios hábeis | Tomar refúgio com paixão | 3 venenos | Agarramo-nos ao “eu” como independente, singular e permanente, sem fundamento | 3 tipos de sofrimento | 3 tipos de confiança | A palavra Bodhicitta | Perspetiva de destemor | Bodhicitta relativa e última | 4 incomensuráveis | “As minhas crenças” são uma falácia | Tonglen | Bodhicitta em ação – 6 paramitas | O exemplo do rei, do barqueiro e do pastor | Votos de refúgio e Bodhisattva | Aspiração para que acabem as guerras, a fome e a seca.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2023 | Morning Session | Part 1
[Audio tracks 002-007] Main topics: Taking refuge; Taking refuge is a choice; Knowing what refuge truly means; The practice of refuge; Studying and contemplation | The truth of suffering and the truth of the cause of suffering; Accepting, acknowledging to become Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha; Developing discipline; The prospect of freedom

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2023 | Morning Session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 008-0012] Main topics: Taking refuge—going for refuge: Noticing our inner narrative; Being honest, inquisitive; Checking our intentions, motivation for taking refuge; Understanding the refuge practice; Discovering the principle of refuge; Refuge practice during meditation and post-meditation; Refuge, the antidote for truth of cause of suffering; Clean up the mess

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
28th October 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks 013-025] Main topics: The important aspects before taking refuge: training the mind based on the idea of the preciousness of life as opposed to the suffering of saṃsāra; Understanding the truth of suffering and the truth of the cause of suffering; Understanding the idea of the law of cause and effect; Contemplation on impermanence; Without this training one cannot remove ignorance and self-grasping; Removing the belief of things as permanent, singular and independent; Negative actions of the body, speech and mind; Analyses and contemplation; Meditation and discipline; Truth of the path

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
28th October 2023 | Evening Session | Part 1
[Audio tracks 026-032] Main topics: Green Tārā Caryā Dance is performed; Green Tārā Mantra is sung; Pema Wangyal Rinpoche reads prayers of Tārā [page E5 of the prayer book]; Reads the Aspiration of Ādi-Buddha Samantabhadra and transmits the nineteenth chapter of the “Tantra of Great Perfection”

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
28th October 2023 | Evening Session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 033-037] Main topics: Practices and prayers; Ngöndro—preliminary practice from Kyabje Kangyur Rinpoche; “The Shower of Blessings”; Vajra Guru mantra; Seven-line prayer

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio tracks 038-048] Main topics: Prayer of homage to the Buddha; Sublime qualities of the Buddha; Images of the Buddha; Using images, shapes, symbols and sounds as a means; Skillful means: The law of cause and effect; Understanding triggers, motivation; Identifying the truth of suffering and the truth of cause of suffering; Taking refuge; Relating to the three poisons; Developing antidotes

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks 049-062] Main topics: The importance of taking refuge; Text—“The Heart of Compassion”; Exploring bodhicitta; Truth of suffering and truth of cause of suffering; The bodhisattvayāna path; Training in both ultimate and relative bodhicitta; Bodhicitta in intention; Bodhicitta in action; Developing loving-kindness; Mind training; Tonglen; Bodhisattva vow

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
29th October 2023 | Evening Session
[Audio tracks 063-069] Main topics: The Daily Practice in Three Parts;
the short ngöndro practice; Rinpoche reads and teaches from “The Heart of
Compassion”, verses twenty-five to thirty-four

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th April 2025 | Morning Session | part 1
[Audio tracks 001-006] Main topic: Introduction to the relevance and the structure of ‘The Thirty-seven Verses on the Practice of a Bodhisattva’, by Gyalsé Ngulchu Thogme, based on the commentary “The Heart of Compassion”, by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th April 2025 | Morning Session part 2
[Audio tracks 007-012] Main topics: The meaning of saṃsāra and precious human life; An overview of the five sceneries of the mind; The freedoms of the precious human life

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th April 2025 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks 013-24] Main topics: The Heart of Compassion; the preparation for the Mind Training: Verses one to seven; the main teachings illuminating the path; Verse eight

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
15th April 2025 | Morning Session part 1 p. 69
[Audio tracks 025-031] Main Topics: Introduction to the relevance and the structure of “The Thirty-Seven Verses on the Practice of a Bodhisattva”, by Gyalsé Ngulchu Thogme, based on the commentary “The Heart of Compassion”, by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; verses 1-8

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
15th April 2025 | Morning Session part 2
[Audio tracks 032-035] Main topics: Introduction to the relevance and the structure of ‘The Thirty-seven Verses on the Practice of a Bodhisattva’, by Gyalsé Ngulchu Thogme, based on the commentary “The Heart of Compassion”, by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; verses 9-10; refuge and bodhicitta; foundations for awakening

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
15th April 2025 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks 036-049] Main Topic: Relative bodhicitta and the practice of tonglen

"The Heart of Compassion - The Thirty-seven Verses on the Practice of a Bodhisattva", Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, Padmakara

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
mainThemes: As (8) Qualidades dos seres iluminados | O caminho para o Despertar | Importância da Dedicatória | Bodhicitta e meios hábeis | Maha Karuna (Grande Compaixão) | Atenção plena e meditação com suporte (estátuas e dhāraṇī) | Sādhana de Buda Śākyamuni | Sādhana de Chenrezig | Refúgio causal | As 5 perfeições e os três defeitos do recipiente |  Refúgio: as três disposições mentais de tomada de refúgio, duração do refúgio, objectos de refúgio | Causas e codições | Karma; Interdependência | As 3 vias (pequena, média  e de grande capacidade) | Obscurecimentos kármicos | 10 ações negativas | 4 elementos necessários para uma acção completa | Visões erróneas | Efeitos das ações e fatores que determinam a intensidade do resultado | A Intenção determinante da acção | Tomar votos por períodos limitados | Os 3 métodos sublimes | Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche; Kangyur Rinpoche; Ama-la, emanação de Shelkar Dorje Tso; Padmasambhava, Yeshe Tsogyal, Namkhai Nyingpo | Mestres de Tulku Rinpoche | Os 2 tipos de pureza | As 3 qualidades da sabedoria co-emergente | As 3 qualidades do Dharmakāya | Propensões kármicas | Experiências do karma passado de Buda e Nāgārjuna | Observar a mente e mudar as ações negativas | Dedicar as acções positivas | Equilíbrio entre visão e conduta | Purificação das acções negativas e os 4 poderes | Libertação de animais; Eclipses e Efeito dos planetas no vento e corpo

sessionThemes:
[In English, see below] 

2 de Abril 2015 - [Grupo II]
Sessão da Tarde e da Noite - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
[Audio 001 to 018] Sobre: Motivação e resultado, potencial para iluminação; Os três tipos de acções; Universos; Os seres sencientes preciosos; Gerar bodhichitta e compaixão; Os Versos dos Oito Nobres Auspiciosos - A1; A Oração em Sete Linhas - B1; A quadra de Shantideva sobre bodhichitta; Estrutura do livro A Via do Bodhisattva; Dedicatória para valorizar o retiro; A importância da dedicatória; Kamalashila; Segundo Buda: São necessários três elementos para alcançar o estado de iluminação: a compaixão, a mente de iluminação ou bodhichitta, e os meios hábeis; A compaixão como a raiz da omnisciência; Completando a acumulação de mérito e sabedoria; A Grande Compaixão, ou Maha Karuna; Iluminação e nirvana não só para nós próprios; Compaixão ilimitada e imparcial; Segundo Shantideva: “Não há nada que não consigamos treinar;” Compaixão e bodhichitta; A atenção plena: desenvolver a concentração, estar aqui e agora; Meditação com suporte: estátuas ou dharanis; O Tesouro de Bênçãos, a Sadhana do Buda Shakyamuni - L1; A Sadhana de Chenrezig - M1.

3 de Abril 2015 - [Grupo II]
1a Sessão da Manhã - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
[Audio de 019 a 025] Sobre: O Buda começou um certo dia; É precioso pensar nos
outros; Conhecer mestres qualificados; Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche e os seus mestres; As Cinco Perfeições; Tudo depende do nosso estado mental; Alcançar a liberdade para o bem dos outros: O refúgio causal; Ensinamentos de acordo com as diferentes disposições mentais dos seres; Os escritos de Longchenpa; As três disposições mentais requeridas para tomar refúgio; Vimalamitra e Atisha Dipamkara ensinaram maioritariamente acerca do refúgio: Os objectos de refúgio; Os objectos de refúgio mundano; O modo de assistir aos ensinamentos: os três defeitos do vaso [recipiente] e as cinco perfeições.

2a Sessão da Manhã - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
[Áudio 026 a 030] Sobre: Questão sobre ficar preso às situações; Causas e condições; Karma; Interdependência; Fazer orações e aspirações respeitando as causas e condições; Os três caminhos; Obscurecimentos kármicos, obscurecimentos de conhecimento, obscurecimentos de padrões habituais; Obscurecimentos e capacidades dos arhats, bodhisattvas e dos budas.

Sessão da Tarde - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Áudio 031 a 040] Sobre: Karma: o que é, o que o reúne?; Acções: as percepções
dos sentidos dão origem às emoções e às acções, às dez acções negativas; Desconhecer a lei de causa e efeito é uma acção negativa da mente; Os quatro elementos necessários para que uma acção esteja completa: As visões erradas correspondem a acções negativas; As conexões kármicas: o resultado das acções de acordo com uma emoção subjacente; Efeitos de maturação semelhantes à causa em termos de causa e em termos de efeito; Os limites da compaixão; Fazer votos por períodos determinados; Romper as limitações da nossa intenção: os três métodos sublimes; As acções mistas; Os factores que determinam a intensidade do resultado.

4 de Abril 2015 - [Grupo II]
1a Sessão da Manhã - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
[Audio 041 a 045] Sobre: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche; Kangyur Rinpoche; Ama-La, emanação de Shelkar Dorje Tso; Padmasambhava, Yeshe Tsogyal, Namkhai Nyingpo; Os mestres de Pema Wangyal Rinpoche; Sua Santidade Sakya Trizin; A linhagem de Jedrung Rinpoche; O eclipse lunar, os dias especiais e os seus efeitos; A atitude, bodhichitta, renovar os votos; Os três tipos de atitude mental para o refúgio; As qualidades dos budas; As duas qualidades daquilo que é puro; As três qualidades da sabedoria co-emergente; As três qualidades do dharmakaya; As oito qualidades dos seres iluminados.

2a Sessão da Manhã - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 046 a 057] Sobre: Perguntas e respostas; Os pontos fracos das acções
positivas e negativas; O resultado do karma; Perguntas; Atenção plena; A intenção determina a acção; As acções negativas feitas com boa intenção; As visões erróneas são as acções mais negativas porque são as mais perigosas; Na via para tornar-se um ser humano. Os resultados dos três tipos de via; Tendo purificado parcialmente as acções do passado, a nível físico mas não mental; A propensão do karma; Inocência e karma, a culpa e a ignorância; Pergunta: Existe a inocência no budismo?; Karma, julgamento e culpa; Pergunta: Os seres humanos experienciam o reino dos infernos?; As acções positivas e as acções negativas - o arrependimento e a menção do acto cometido; Pontos fracos; O karma e os seus resultados - quais as acção que podem dar resultados imediatos, que amadurecem em primeiro lugar?; Que karma determina a próxima vida?; Buda e Nagarjuna - o experienciar dos resultados do karma passado; A história do rei dos nagas; A história do rapaz que atirou em oferenda uns grãos ao Buda; Pergunta: Como é que o Buda pode passar pela experiência dos efeitos kármicos?; A necessidade da atenção plena e da vigilância nas acções; Perguntas sobre o mérito e o karma; Pergunta sobre a destruição de um brinquedo; Compreender o karma e as acções como compostas e vazias; O arrependimento.

4 de Abril 2015 - [Grupo II]
Sessão da Tarde - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
[Audio 058 a 066] Sobre: Adoptar uma intenção positiva; Nem o Buda pôde mudar Devadatta; O karma não é regressar ao passado; O que fizemos no passado - vejam as experiências do presente - é o espelho da nossa vida actual; As acções mistas positivas; Observar o que passa na mente e modificar as acções negativas; Dedicar as acções positivas; As situações “injustas” como um sinal de purificação do karma; Nagarjuna: “Além da originação interdependente, não há fenómenos, não há nada mais.”; É necessário existir um equilíbrio entre a conduta e a visão correctas; Como contemplar as dez acções negativas; Desenvolver a confiança de que tudo surge de causas e condições; Milarepa e diligência baseada na confiança nas causas e condições; A purificação das acções negativas e os quatro poderes; Tudo o que fazemos com ignorância cria “ondas”; Libertação de seres vivos; Os eclipses; O efeito dos astros na circulação das energias do nosso corpo; Bodhichitta; Voto de refúgio; Agradecimentos de Pema Wangyal Rinpoche

————


Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
2nd April 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | Afternoon and Evening Sessions
[Audio 001 to 018] On: Motivation and result, potential for enlightenment; Three types of actions; Universes; Tree types of actions, precious sentient beings; Giving bodhichitta and compassion; A1, introduction, qualities of the enlightened ones; Seven line prayer; Shantideva’s four line prayer on bodhichitta; Structure of the Way of the Bodhisattva; Dedication so that retreat is worthwhile, on the importance of dedicating; Kamalashila; Quoting Buddha: 3 things to achieve the enlightened state: the compassion, the awakened mind or bodhichitta, and skilful means;
Compassion as the root of omniscience; Completing the accumulation of merit and wisdom; Maha Karuna, Great Compassion; Enlightenment and nirvana not just for oneself; Compassion limitless and impartial,; “there is nothing we cannot train” Shantideva; Compassion and bodhicitta; Mindfulness, develop concentration, be here and now; Meditation with support, statues or the dharani; L1 - Buddha Shakyamuni Sadhana; M1 - Chenrezig Sadhana 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
3rd April 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | 1st Morning Session 
[Audio 019 to 025] On: Buddha started someday; Te thought of others is precious; Meeting qualifed teachers; JKR and his teachers; Five Perfections; It depends on our state of mind; Freedom for the sake of others; Causal refuge; Teachings for different mental dispositions; Longchenpa's writings; Tree different mental dispositions for taking refuge; Vimalamitra and Atisha Dipamkara mostly taught on refuge; Duration of the refuge; Objects of refuge; Wordly objects of refuge; Attending the teachings: three defects of the pot and the five perfections

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd April 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | 2nd Morning Session
[Audio 026 to 030] On: Question about getting stuck; Causes and conditions; karma; seeing things as interdependent; prayer and aspirations in accord with causes and conditions; Tree Paths: small, medium and greater capacity; Karmic Obscurations, Obscurations of Knowledge, Obscurations of Habitual Patterns; obscurations and capacities of arhats, bodhisattvas and buddhas

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rdApril 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | Afternoon Session
[Audio 031 to 040] On: Karma: what is it and what gathers it; Actions, sense perceptions give rise to emotions and actions, 10 negative actions; Not knowing as a negative actions of the mind; Four elements required for a complete powerful action; Wrong views as negative actions; Karmic connections, result of actions according to underlying emotion; Effects: maturing, similar to the cause in terms of cause and in terms of effect; Limits to compassion; Taking vows for limited periods; Breaking limits of our intention; Tree sublime methods; Mixed actions; Factors that determine intensity of result 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
4th April 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | 1st Morning Session 
[Audio 041 to 045] On: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche; Kangyur Rinpoche; Ama-la, emanation of Shelkar Dorje Tso; Padmasambhava, Yeshe Tsogyal, Namkhai Nyingpo; Tulku Rinpoche’s own birth and teachers; HH Sakya Trizin; The lineage of Jedrung Ripoche; Lunar eclipse, effects, practice; Attitude, bodhichitta, renewing vows; three types of mental attitude for refuge; Qualities of Buddhas; Two types of purity; three qualities of co-emergent wisdom; three qualities of dharmakaya; Eight qualities of the enlightened ones

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
4th April 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | 2nd Morning Session 
[Audio 046 to 057] On: Questions and Answers; Weak points of negative and positive actions; Karma coming into fruition; Questions; Mindfulness; The intention determines the action;  negative actions done with good intention; Wrong views are the worst negative actions because they are the most dangerous; On the path to become a human, results of the three kinds of path; Having purified past actions partially, just the physical aspect not the mental; Karmic propensities; Innocence and karma, guilt and ignorance; Question: Are there innocents in Buddhism?; Karma, judgement and guilt; Question: Humans experiencing the hell realms; Positive actions and negative actions – regret and exposing them; weak points; Karma and its fruition, what action matures first; Karma determining next life; Buddha and Nagarjuna experiencing the results of past karma; Story of the naga king; Story of the boy who threw peas towards the Buddha; Question: How can Buddha experience karmic effects?; Mindfulness and
vigilance towards actions; Questions on merit and karma; on breaking of a child's toy; View action and karma as compounded and empty, and total regret. 

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
4th April 2015 - [Group I together with Group II] | Afternoon Session 
[Audio 058 to 066] On: Making sure the intention is positive. Even the Buddha could not change Devadatta; Karma is not about going back to the past; What we have done in the past, look in your present experience, the mirror of your present life; mixed positive actions; Observe the mind and change the negative actions; dedicate the positive actions; “Unfair” situations as sign of cleansing of karma; Nagarjuna: “Apart from interdependent origination, there is no phenomena, there is nothing else.”; the balance of conduct and view needs to be equal; How to
contemplate on the ten negative actions; Developing confidence on cause and conditions; Milarepa and diligence based on confidence on cause and conditions; Purification of negative actions and the Four powers; Everything we do with ignorance creates ripples; Freeing lives; Eclipses; Planets and effect on wind and the body; Bodhichitta; Refuge vow; Tanks by Pema Wangyal Rinpoche

sessionThemes:
04/JULHO/ 2014 - JIGME KHYENTSE RINPOCHE 
O Treino da Mente; Manjushri a Satchen Kunga Nyingpo; “O Abandono dos Quatro Apegos; A Disciplina e as Oito Preocupações Mundanas; Invocação dos Budas e Bodhisattvas; Orações de Aspiração; Causas e Condições, O que é a Mente?; Nem Niilismo, Nem eternalismo; Acumulação de Mérito e Sabedoria 

04/JULHO/ 2014 - PEMA WANGYAL RINPOCHE
Conexões com os Mestres; Os Quatro tipos de Obscurecimentos; Acções negativas do corpo, palavra e mente; Diferentes percepções; Diferentes Votos; Ler a História do Buda e dos Mestres; Ashvagosha e Nagarjuna; A canção do lama Shabkar; Os diferentes tipos de Nascimento; Os diferentes elementos; As dissoluções e os estados de luminosidade ou a natureza da mente; Pensar nos outros; As Quatro ilimitadas; Detalhes da Visualização no "Tesouro de Bençãos" ou nja Sadhana de Buda Shakyamuni; Os Sete Ramos; Continuação da Prática de Buda Shakyamuni; O Rinpoche responde a questões [Q]; Praticante do Dharma; Interdependência; Verdade Relativa e Verdade Absoluta; Verdade Relativa correcta e incorrecta; O “Eu”; Não independente, não permanente e não único; Ausência da verdadeira existência; Originação interdependente; Praticar a Sadhana é um ritual religioso?; Sadhana do Buda Shakyamuni; Refúgio e mente do despertar; Vendo e imaginando o Buda diante de nós

05/JULHO/ 2014 – PEMA WANGYAL RINPOCHE 
As Três Perfeições; Os Quatro Selos um ensinamento do Buda; Os Elos de Ligação Interdependente; Manter a Atenção plena acordados, a adormecer e a dormir; Reconhecer o estado do sonho; Reconhecer a Luminosidade; Recordar a história da vida do Buda; Praticar Shamatha e Vipassana; A Compaixão transforma as emoções; O Sutra das Três Jóias e a Sadhana do Buda Shakyamuni

06/JULHO/ 2014 - JIGME KHYENTSE RINPOCHE 
[Q] Verdade Relativa Correcta e Incorrecta; [Q] Criar Karma Enquanto Sonhamos 
[Q] Experiências Fora do Corpo; A visão, a base; A Via; Ver o Buda não tangível mas presente; Realizar a visão é o resultado; Nem eternalismo nem nihilismo; A sadhana de Buda Shakyamuni; refúgio e visualização; Os sete ramos; recomendações; Até à próxima sessão Reconhecer a Interdependência 21x/dia e Ler a “Aspiração do Nobre Samanthabadra” 1x/semana

06/JULHO/ 2014 - PEMA WANGYAL RINPOCHE 
Impermanência; 4º Jamgon Kongtrul e o 17º Karmapa; Longchenpa; A canção de Longchenpa; Situações difícieis; O sofrimento dos animais; Ser Vegetariano ou vegan; Associação "Mãe terra"; Acumular Virtude; Dedicatória e Conclusão; Outras canções; Rinpoche recita os mantras aos animais
eventBiblio:

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: O que é Śamatha? | As verdades do sofrimento, das suas causas, do caminho e da cessação | Śamatha ajuda a treinar e amadurecer a mente | Medita na respiração simplesmente | Apercebe-te das distrações | Experiencia diretamente as sensações | Investigando as nossas experiências | A visão, como resultado dessa investigação, serve para ser posta em prática | Atenção plena | Iniciar o treino da mente é simples - observar, deixar ir e voltar | Pós-meditação | Tornando-se mais resiliente | Trabalhar com a nossa mente para podermos trabalhar com os outros | Meditação em tibetano significa “habituar-se a” | Neuro plasticidade | Postura correta | Obstáculos | Conselhos para a prática | “Burnout” | Bodhicitta

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
22nd April 2023 | Morning session
[Audio tracks: 001-007] Main topics: Śamatha; The structure of Buddhist meditation; How to meditate.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
22nd April 2023 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 008-013] Main topics: Śamatha; The detail of Buddhist meditation; How to meditate

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
23 April 2023 | Morning Session 
[Audio-tracks 014-018] Main topics: To know, train, and tame our mind; Become more resilient and to reduce the power of truth of cause of suffering; Becoming and being aware, open our mind to the instructions of the Buddha, to apply the wisdom of the path; Counting the breath to trigger awareness; Breath as a neutral and dependable tool; Training in awareness means recognizing our distraction, helping to know our own mind; Right posture.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche

[Audio-tracks 019-025] Main topics: Posture; Purpose and obstacles of meditation; Truth of suffering; Process of practice; Advice on practice.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th June 2019 | Morning session
[Audio Tracks: 001-009] Main topics: Bodhisattva—meaning, how a bodhisattva relates to things, removal of aggression, desperateness and bewilderment. Thirty-seven Practices of a Bodhisattva—introduction.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th June 2019 | Morning session | 2nd part
[Audio-Tracks: 010-016] Main topics: Bodhicitta—relative, in intention, ultimate; The Thirty-Seven Practices of a Bodhisattva—introduction and first verses, Precious human life, Ngulchu Thogme; Explanation of Swift Path to Enlightenment.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
05th June 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 017-028] Main topics: The Mind Training in Eight Verses—commentary verse by verse; The Thirty-Seven Verses of the Practice of a Bodhisattva—It’s importance and context; Bodhicitta—what it is.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
05th June 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 029-035] Main topics: Six pāramitās – instruction on how to practice; Bodhicitta; Mantra of Guru Padmasambhava.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
6th June 2019 | Morning Practice | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 037-044] Main topics: Thirty-Seven Practices of a Bodhisattva—verse 1; Precious human life—cause, numerical, example points of view; The states without freedom Freedoms; Impermanence.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th May 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio-Tracks: 045-051] Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Verses on the Practice of a Bodhisattva—Verses 1,2,3,4; Precious Human Life; Abandoning one’s Native Land; Relying on Solitude; Remembering Impermanence.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th May 2019 | Morning Session | 3rd Part
[Audio-tracks: 052-056] Main topics: Everyday life and practice; Spiritual materialism; Relating with others.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
6th June 2019 | Afternoon session
[Audio-tracks: 057-075] Main topics: Swift Path to Enlightenment— explanation of the sādhana, instructions, the author; Thrity-Seven Verses of the Practice of the Bodhisattva—verses 1 to 7.

placeTeaching: VIP Executive Entrecampos, (antigo Villa Rica), Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: O Nono Capítulo da Via do Bodhisattva - Parte 2 de 3
mainThemes:
A segunda parte dos ensinamentos de Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche sobre o Nono Capítulo do Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra – “A Via do Bodhisattva”, acerca da natureza última da realidade, dos fenómenos e do eu. Estes ensinamentos são baseados no comentário  “Ketaka Norbu”, (traduzido com o título "The Wisdom Chapter") de Jamgön Mipham Rinpoche.

Inclui as sessões de revisão por Wulstan Fletcher, tradutor inglês de ambas obras, onde os ensinamentos de Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche e os textos são analisados e discutidos.

sessionThemes:
Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 1 | 9th Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions
Summary: Refuting the objections to the Great Vehicle | Establishing the Great Vehicle as a valid teaching of the Buddha | Sixteen aspects of the four noble truths | Hīnayāna view of emptiness as unnecessary for liberation | Reliance on the practice of the Vrajnāparāmitā for liberation | Authenticity of a doctrine is not disproved merely by the fact of its being disputed | The true monk is the root of Dharma | Self-clinging is eradicated only through realization of the no-self of phenomena | The only difference between two kinds of emptiness lies in the objects that are taken as its basis.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 2 | 10th Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions
Summary: Refutation of objections | Objections to the words or means expressing
emptiness | The true monk is the root of Dharma, and to be monk is difficult indeed | A permanent self is an idea superimposed on reality | Clinging to the aggregates, clinging to a self | Divergence from the view of Nāgārjuna and Candrakīrti | Where the traditions of the New and the Old Translation differ | Removing clinging to the self as unitary, independent, self-sufficient | The śrāvakas’ two constituting particles of relative truth | The only thing needed to be realized is the emptiness of self | Realization of  personal no-self should be understood to be a part of the realization of emptiness of all phenomena | Teachings on the no-self are what liberates from saṃsāra and is applicable to all the four schools of Buddhist thought | The reasoning of the seven parts composing a chariot | Teachings on no-self can be contrasted with the Mahāyāna’s presentation of the general no-self | Realization of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is extremely limited | The Great Vehicle realizes not only the emptiness of the personal  no-self but also all the rest of phenomenal no-self | Ultimately, there is only one vehicle.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 3 | 11th Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions
Summary: The jewel that dispels the poverty of mind | Without the realization of emptiness, it is impossible to see the truth | Primordial wisdom that realizes the phenomenal no-self may be regarded as a general term | Knowledge that realizes the no-self of a person may be regarded as a specific instance | Whatever arises based on the belief in a self is a defilement of negative emotions | Defilements that appear from clinging to the three spheres are cognitive defilements | The path of the śrāvakas does not remove cognitive defilements | Grosser aspects of both kinds of obscurations that are progressively eliminated on the bhūmis | The example of Maudgalyāyana | Those who are without defilement still behold the influence of karma | Craving arises from feeling and the arhats do experience feeling | Extremely subtle defilements that are to be abandoned | Establishing that there is only one ultimate vehicle in the Buddha’s  teachings | Impossible to simultaneously have two different ways of perceiving an object | Two kinds of craving interpreted by the scholars of the New Tradition is not found in the root text | Buddha and the acacia thorn: Śākyamuni was a body of manifestation and not an ordinary being.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 4 | 12th Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions
Summary: Three Hīnayāna arguments against the Mahāyāna | Mahāyāna teachings are compatible with the three trainings | Not understanding merely shows the greatness of the Mahāyāna | Emptiness as a cure for all sufferings | There is nothing to be afraid of | Establishing the path: the nonexistence of the self | The physical body that we have  cannot be the “I” | The six consciousnesses cannot be the “I” | These are a multiplicity and impermanent | Clinging to the idea of self is the source of all problems and  suffering | Belief in self-identity arises through ignorance | Hesitant questioning supplanted by firm conviction of no self | Refutation of an imputed self | Refutations in a way constitute the path away from delusion | Twenty-five principles of the Sāṃkhya school | Hīnayāna and Mahāyāna views of the Buddha.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 5 | 13 Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions
Summary: Presentation of the imputed personal no-self | The position of the Sāṃkhya school | Refutation of the permanent self | Intrinsic father unable to be intrinsic son | Sound-consciousness is never experienced in relation to an object that is a form |  Sound-consciousness is impermanent because it loses its earlier mode and assumes  another configuration | It is impossible to have a consciousness that is isolated and alone | Conceptual distinguisher of a knowledge object—a “generality,” or a “universal” | The false conception that universals exist; the illusion that many characteristics make up a single entity |The fact of believing in the real existence of universals is a wrong view | Refutation of self that is non-conscious, matter.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 6 | 14th Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions 
Summary: Presenting the imputed personal self | Refutation of the belief that self is made of matter | What does not have mind cannot be the self | Five ways of being in accordance with an object | Two kinds of inherence | In an immutable self, the mind is powerless to make an earlier nature change into something else | Refutation of  objections concerning the no-self | Refutation of the objection that the law of cause and effect is not valid |The bases of an action and a fruit are not the same | A cause coterminous with its result is something quite impossible to see | Effects must manifest from causes | The ineluctable power of interdependence | Continuum is just a  conceptual label: like a garland, it cannot actually exist as such | Since former mental states have elapsed and future mental states are not yet born, the mind as such does not
exist | If one searches analytically, one will find that the self has no reality, no ultimate existence | Refutation that no-self is incompatible with compassion | Two different answers—on the ultimate level and on the relative level | Although the bodhisattvas realize no-self, they immerse themselves in compassion | That which is permanent cannot perform an action.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
Day 7 | 15th Aug. 2018 | Morning Sessions 
Summary: Arguments against the imputed self | Refuting objections to the no-self | Answers on the relative and ultimate levels | Ultimately, nothing truly exists | According to the way that phenomena appear to sentient beings, all these things do exist |  Liberation is but the elimination of error | Affirmation that there is a law of cause and effect | On the ultimate level, there is nothing to obtain, on the level of appearance, there is | Two kinds of two truths explained | Clinging to self and clinging to the path and the result are not the same | The view of self is a temporary deviation of the mind away from the nature of things | Explanation of the phenomenal no-self | Four close mindfulnesses: of body, sensations, mind and phenomena | Everything contained  within the body is emptiness | How to integrate what we have studied.

Revision Sessions
Wulstan Fletcher
Day 1 | 9th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: Textual outline revisited | Refutation of the Mind-Only school | A refutation of objections to emptiness | Prajñāpāramitā scriptures and the Mahāyāna are the same phenomenon | Objections to the Mahāyāna | The eighteen Hināyāna schools | Objections to emptiness | Nirvāṇa as complete enlightenment | Hināyāna arhats as no different from Buddha | Nirvāṇa with remainder and nirvāṇa without remainder | The debate as “weapon” | Exposing illogic and annihilation of opposing arguments |  Realization through sixteen aspects of the four noble truths | Cutting the root of  suffering, clinging to self | arhats gain liberation from saṃsāra, not full enlightenment | Removing the veils to omniscience | Emptiness of self and phenomena | The “true monk” | Consequentialist arguments | Validity of Mahāyāna and validity of Hināyāna scriptural authority | Wisdom that realizes the absence of self is principal aspect of the path | Distinction between the imputed self and innate self | Habitual clinging to self is removed on the three pure bhūmis | Desire realm, form realm and formless realm |  Need to cut the root of saṃsāra, clinging to phenomena as truly existent.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 2 | 10th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: Wisdom as the crucial pāramitā | Confrontation between the Hīnayāna and the Mahāyāna | Controversy over different views of Madhyamaka | Śāntarakṣita and Candrakīrti | Suppression of views | Rise of the Rimé movement | Mipham Rinpoche and the Nyingma view | An environment of freedom | Emptiness of the person and the emptiness of phenomena | The śrāvakas’ partial understanding of emptiness | The distinction between the two truths made on the relative level | Divided, the second and third turnings of the Wheel of Dharma are provisional; united they are both definitive |
Two kinds of obscuration and their removal on the bhūmis| Complexities of translation.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 3 | 11th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: Textual outline explained | Refutation of objections made against the Mahāyāna, which asserts the doctrine of emptiness | True monk being the root of dharma | Madhyamaka and the view of the Nyingma school | Renunciation and leaving saṃsāra | Hinayāna/śrāvaka view of realization of emptiness | Nirvāṇa with and without remainder | Liberation through realization of the four noble truths | Difference on the level of nirvāṇa without remainder between the arhats and Buddha | Hīnayāna realization of emptiness of the personal self | Arhatship is not the same a buddhahood | Twelve links of dependent arising | Undefiled craving and clinging to concepts | Arhats gain liberation but not omniscience |The personal no-self is a part of the phenomenal
no-self | The absorption of cessation | Arousal, entering the Mahāyāna, path and buddhahood | Absurdities ensuing from arhat view of perfect realization of emptiness | Odium academicum among Tibetan scholars | Mipham Rinpoche’s intention | The fault of reacting with anger | Tsongkhapa’s view of liberation | Gelugpas and the text | The position of the Indian commentators | Defiled and undefiled craving | Argument of the two kinds of personal self – two kinds of clinging | The impossibility of two thoughts occurring at the same time in the mind stream | Everything hinges on just one word | Misinterpretation of Śāntideva | The acacia thorn, Buddha, arhatship | The Hīnayāna and Mahāyāna positions | The entire path laid out | On the level of relative truth, any view is a point of view | The contradiction of stating: subjectively to get hold of an objective position.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 4 | 12th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session
Summary: Refutation of objections made against the Mahāyāna | Between saṃsāra and nirvāṇa there is absolutely no difference | The validity of the Mahāyāna scriptures | The revision of the Bodhicaryāvatāra by Loden Sherab | What it is that we ought to fear | Who is there to be afraid? | Groundlessness | Establishing the path: the nonexistence of the self | The coemergent self and the imputed self | Dissolving the innate sense of self | Vedanta and the idea of self.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 5 | 13th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: The Sāṁkhya philosophy | Puruṣa and prakṛti | The self as ultimately
truly existent | Demolishing the confidence in a permanent self | Eternalism and momentariness | Change is a constant replacement of each individual state |  Consciousness that is not a consciousness of something is impossible | A permanent father cannot be also a son | The logic of impermanence | A single consciousness does not cognize two objects | The guṇas: pain, neutrality and pleasure | The root illusion of the independent self | The self as simply pure consciousness | Pure consciousness is just imaginary | Universals as figments of the imagination | Dismantling the innate sense of self.

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 6 | 14th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session
Summary: Khenpo Kunpal commentary structure | “The Ketaka Jewel” as a “meaning commentary” | Refutation of the co-emergent self and the imputed self | Objections concerning the personal no-self | Two theories of causation | Theory of moments can be fixed but not the theory of an immutable self | No-self is not incompatible with compassion | Boundless compassion – the union of the two truths | Liberating beings into non-abiding nirvāṇa | Longchenpa and “Finding Rest in Illusion.”

Wulstan Fletcher
Day 7 | 15th Aug. 2018 | Afternoon Session 
Summary: Nonexistence of the self |The dream of saṃsāra | Who will be the object of compassion? | The ultimate status of phenomena and the way they appear | Idea of emptiness essential on the path | Imputation necessary until we realize ultimate truth | Idea of the ultimate truth is figurative | The need to dream skilfully | Relatively,  nonabiding nirvāṇa is something that can be attained | The final illusion of the  Mahāyāna—the Three Jewels | Losing one’s action in the view and vice-versa | When the two truths are not in union | Importance of following the relative teachings | Ordinary mind is eventually consumed in the fire of wisdom | Because saṃsāra has a cause, it can be transcended | Buddhahood is not produced, it is already there | The supreme way of achieving no-self is just to get used to it | “I” as just a label is not a problem | Tantra rooted in bodhicitta | Ninth chapter relevance for the drubchen |
Refutation of theistic arguments | Refutation of the phenomenal no-self | Four close placements of mindfulness | Investigate the Introduction to the Middle Way.

placeTeaching: Faculdade de Medicina Dentária, Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: A humanidade que nos une em tempos de incerteza
mainThemes: Monge budista, autor, tradutor, fotógrafo e promotor de vários projetos humanitários, Matthieu Ricard foi um dos primeiros ocidentais a explorar em profundidade os tesouros espirituais do budismo dos Himalaias e nesta conferência aborda alguns dos mais importantes temas da atualidade, nomeadamente a pandemia e as alterações climáticas vistas do ponto de vista daquilo que nos une, e não daquilo que nos separa.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
mainThemes: Porque fazer śamatha | A postura e a respiração | Como meditar e sessões orientadas | Atenção plena e consciência | Disciplina | Alegria na prática | Grandes mestres como Milarepa |  A vida de Jedrung Rinpoche.

sessionThemes:
15th OCTOBER 2014 - [Group I together with Group II]
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
On: Spiritual food; Five paths; Different kinds of obscurations; Different kinds of eyes; Four unlimited thoughts; Jigme Gyalwe Nyugu and Jigme Lingpa; Asanga and Maitreya; Mind training; Buddha is free of limitations; Three types of thoughts, Gampopa and Milarepa. 

Afternoon Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
On: The ten negative actions; Nagarjuna and Padmasambhava; Positive and negative actions; The monk and his butcher friend; Developing compassion; Shechen Gyaltsap's text and K. Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; Refuge; Qualities of an authentic teacher; Cultivating Bodhichitta; How to sit; Shakyamuni Sadhana. 

16th OCTOBER 2014
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
On: Publication of transcriptions of teachings; How to study; How to listen to  teachings, the Six points; Milarepa and Marpa Lotsawa; Attachment to objects. 

Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
On: Causes and Conditions; Understanding interdependent origination; What is and is not Karma; Different kinds of conditions; Questions and Answers.

17th OCTOBER 2014
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche  
On: Good heart; Bodhisattva Manjushri; Instructions until next retreat; practices A1,B1; Four advices of Buddha to his disciples; Four unlimited thoughts, Six Paramitas.
Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
On: The meaning of "Awakened"; Law of cause and effect; Positive and negative actions; Questions and Answers; Requests until next retreat.
Conclusion - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
On: Supporting different organizations and projects.

18th OCTOBER 2014 - Group I
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
On: Dharma dances and others; Interdependent origination; Om; Awakened state; Mipham Rinpoche and Eight Auspicious Ones prayer A1; Eight verses of Langri Thangpa; Five perfections; Three worlds and six realms of world of desire; Noble Sangha; K. Trulshik Rinpoche; Dalai Lama; N23; Projects; Vegetarian and Vegan.

Morning Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
On: The Thirty Seven Practices, The Swift Path Sadhana; Practicing all the verses in one session; Questions to students.

Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
On: Daily practice, combining The Swift Path to Enlightenment and the condensed Chenrezig Sadhana M1, The Short Preliminary Practices by Kangyur Rinpoche.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
4th June, 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 001-016] Main Topics: Buddha’s epithets; the four māras—of distraction, of negative emotions, of aggregates, and of death.; Buddha Śākyamuni Sādhana—creating the right setting, step by step explanation.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
4th June 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 017-020] Main topics: Buddha Śākyamuni sādhana— Guided Practice, Seven Branches and pride, visualization and recitation.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
4th June 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 021-034] Main Topics: Four buddhas of fortunate eon; The Buddha life—Birth, enlightenment, Anātha and Jetavana.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
4th June 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
[Audio tracks: 035-038 ] Main Topics: Buddha Śākyamuni sādhana— power of the dhāraṇī; Story of the king and ugly daughter.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Treinar corpo, fala e mente tal como o Buda fez | De um estado mental centrado em si mesmo a altruísta e destemido | Importância de um amigo espiritual autêntico | Entoando em voz alta | A culpa é da crença no “eu” | O refúgio nas 3 Jóias tem de evoluir | Os 5 caminhos | Seres sencientes e Bodhisattvas | Medo e esperança | “As 37 Práticas do Bodhisattva”, “O Treino da Mente em 7 Pontos” e “O Caminho do Bodhisattva” | Karma no âmbito da Bodhicitta absoluta | Ver tudo como ilusório | Lembrar os exemplos de Buda e de Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche | É preciso ler, refletir e meditar, ler apenas não é suficiente | Como treinar-se a ver experiências agradáveis e desagradáveis | O rei Trisong Detsen e sua filha – o poder das aspirações | Crença no “eu” como permanente, singular e independente | As 6 Paramitas | Preceitos do refúgio e da Bodhicitta

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio tracks 001-014] Main topics: Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche’s commentary “The Heart of Compassion” expounding on the “Thirty-seven Verses on the Practice of Bodhisattva” by Gyalse Ngulchu Thogme; bodhicitta; Absolute bodhicitta; Abandoning any belief in the objects of desire and aversion as truly existing

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2023 | Afternoon Session | Part 1
[Audio tracks 015-019] Main topics: Mind training; Questions & Answers; Chanting; Belief in a self; Taking refuge in the Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha; The Five Paths; Sentient beings and bodhisattvas; Hope and fear; Causes and conditions; Karma

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2023 | Afternoon session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 020-024] Main topics: Mind Training; Questions & answers; Proper conduct of a bodhisattva; Qualities of a bodhisattva; Recognising the empty nature of mind; Text: Verse 22 from ‘The Heart of Compassion’ by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche – Instructions on Ngulchu Thogme’s “Thirty-Sevenfold Practice of a Bodhisattva”

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
26th October 2023 | Evening session
[Audio tracks 025-033] Main topics: Mind Training; Text: “The Heart of Compassion” by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, Instructions on Ngulchu Thogme’s “Thirty-Sevenfold Practice of a Bodhisattva”; The root text verses 1 – 14; Advice on reflecting

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2023 | Morning Session | Part 1
[Audio tracks 034-041] Main Topics: Mind Training; Text: “Heart of Compassion” by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, a commentary on Ngulchu Thogme’s “Thirty-Sevenfold Practice of a Bodhisattva”; Verse twenty-three—Abandoning any belief in objects of desire as truly existing; Verse twenty-four - Abandoning any belief in object of aversion as truly existing

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2023 | Morning Session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 042-045] Main topics: Questions & Answers on Verse 22 –ultimate bodhicitta

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2023 | Afternoon Session | Part 1
[Audio tracks 046–049] Main topics: Aspiration prayers; self-centred and selflessness; how to work with our mind; the precepts of training in practices; training in the six transcendent pāramitās; transcendent generosity; kinds of generosity” in “The Heart of Compassion” by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; story told by Dalai Lama; examples of generosity from some masters.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2023 | Afternoon Session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 050–054] Main topics: Reading on transcendent discipline/three kinds of discipline” in “The Heart of Compassion” by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; importance of vows and how to relate to them; precepts of refuge and bodhicitta; understanding diligence; law of cause and effect; reading on transcendent patience; understanding the meaning of “accepting all his harm”; understanding patience and the functioning of the mind training teaching; how to work with patience.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
27th October 2023 | Evening session
[Audio tracks 055-062] Main topics: “Daily Practice in Three Parts”; Reading and explanation of Verses 14 to 25, “Thirty-Seven Practices of a Bodhisattva”; Kangyur Rinpoche saying about non-human beings attending teachings and the importance of applying the practice of a bodhisattva; story about being careful on the path.

placeTeaching: Faculdade de Medicina Dentária, Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: A Essência da Meditação: Uma Mente Feliz nos Tempos Modernos
mainThemes:
Como é que a meditação nos pode ajudar a manter a paz interior e resiliência perante o stress e agitação da vida quotidiana?
Yongey Mingyur Rinpoche fala-nos sobre os benefícios da meditação, apresentando técnicas simples e essenciais para manter o bem estar físico e mental face aos desafios do mundo moderno.

A Sessão de Abertura da Conferência Pública esteve a cargo do famoso monge budista e cientista Matthieu Ricard.

mainThemes: Objetivo da prática de acumulação da mandala | Contextualizando esta prática no âmbito das práticas do Vajrayana e do Mahayana | Acumulação de mérito e sabedoria | A nossa oferenda deve ser tão pura e imaculada quanto possível | Prosternações | A prática do mandala como antídoto ao medo e à esperança | Significado dos vários componentes da oferenda da mandala, como a base, os anéis, os continentes, os atributos de realeza, as deusas de oferenda | Diferentes versões desta prática | Transmissão e instruções de práticas de oferenda de incenso de Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche e Kangyur Rinpoche como a de Riwo Sangchö | Os projetos do templo e apartamentos em Monchique

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Śamatha e treino da mente segundo o ponto de vista Budista | Como nos relacionamos com o nosso mundo material, emocional e mental | As Quatro Nobres Verdades | Os três tipos de sofrimento e suas causas | A curta duração da atenção das pessoas dos tempos modernos | Postura de sete pontos, atenção plena e respiração | O treino da mente deve basear-se no sobressalto | Desenvolver coragem para praticar para o bem de todos os seres sencientes | Buda, Dharma e Sangha | Śamatha envolve disciplina e relaxamento simultâneos | Diferentes suportes de meditação | Vipaśyanā | Treino de meditação é tão simples como “reconhecer-largar-regressar” | Durante a pós-meditação, repousar na consciência que tudo conhece | O que é o “eu” | O conhecimento da ilusão e da impermanência das coisas cria humor | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche reflete nas qualidades dos seus Mestres | História de Kyabje Kangur Rinpoche sobre Monchique

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st October 2023 | Morning Session | Part 1 
[Audio tracks 001-007] Main topics: Śamatha and mind training from the Buddhist point of view | The Four Noble Truths | Three types of suffering| Confusion and its forms | Eighty-four thousand types of emotions | Metaphors on mind control such as likes and dislikes and seeking entertainment as cause of suffering | Interplay of the truth of suffering and the truth of cause of suffering | How śamatha and mind training is a truth of path | Technique and way of practicing śamatha

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st October 2023 | Morning Session | Part 2 
[Audio Tracks 008-009] Main topics: Seven-point body posture | Natural breath | Right attitude for practice | Śamatha in the light of Four Noble Truths | Śamatha in the light of Mahāyāna teachings | No amending of breath and the ways of counting | Resting the mind without counting

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st October 2023 | Afternoon Session | Part 1 
[Audio tracks 010-013] Main topics: Understanding truth of suffering and truth of cause of suffering | Using a support, like the breath, as a means to train our minds and how we relate to our emotions, mind, body and world around us | The practice is to change our habitual patterns in relating to emotions | Paying homage and bodhicitta | Instructions on how to practise śamatha | Discipline is needed to make our mind workable and change our habitual patterns | Śamatha practice is designed to free us from the truth of cause of suffering and truth of suffering | Removing distortion as the basis for starting off on the path.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st October 2023 | Afternoon Session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 014-020] Main topics: Commitment is a necessary requirement for śamatha practice; Application of mindfulness in the practice; Working with distractions and sleepiness; Letting go of distractions to come back to the breath is the practice; Habit of distracting ourselves from our difficult emotions; How to relax during our śamatha practice; How to relate to difficult emotions in the śamatha practice; Managing the waves of emotions; Mindfulness in śamatha practice, being fully present as the basis for following the path.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
22nd October 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio tracks 021-031] Main Topics: Daily practice in three parts; Guided practice with explanations; Taking refuge; Definition of the Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha; The qualities of the Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha—the path to liberation; Wakefulness and continuing to develop qualities post-meditation; Impermanence; Dedication of Merit; Stories of the Buddha; Śamatha practiceJigme Khyentse Rinpoche

22nd October 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks 031-044] Main Topics: Śamatha meditation; Working with the triggers of our stress; Deconstructing our beliefs and concepts; Exploring our mind, our motivation; Coming back to the breath; Confusion and Ignorance; Awareness; Meditation training; Post-meditation; Seaworthiness of the mind

Tulku Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
22nd October 2023 | Evening Session
[Audio tracks 045-049] Main Topic: Tulku Pema Wangyal Rinpoche reminiscing about his teachers; To feel the constant presence, blessings and guidance of these great masters; Introducing Matthieu Ricard; Rinpoche making the aspiration that his sister Jetsun Yangchen and Matthieu will in the future guide us with teachings; the two types of offerings—mental and those made in reality; Rinpoche reading from the text “The Heart of Compassion”, Pages 29-32; The Root Text by Ngulchu Thogme

mainThemes: Sinais do progresso no caminho | Significado de cada etapa das práticas preliminares | Como funciona a prática do Guru Yoga e seu efeito | Como ver o mestre | Os nossos mestres são mais bondosos do que os budas | Ensinamentos: como recebê-los, obstáculos e regozijo | A ideia aqui é abrirmo-nos totalmente ao guru | Exemplos dos discípulos de Milarepa e Patrul Rinpoche | Kyabje Khyentse Rinpoche e Kangyur Rinpoche | A “Oração das Sete Linhas” como expressão de abertura, destemor, gratidão e da nossa ligação com Guru Rinpoche | Ver o medo em termos das quatro nobres verdades | Entre o mestre e o discípulo tem de haver uma capacidade de resposta | Receber iniciações do guru: causas e condições necessárias | Leitura do livro ”The charriot to freedom” | Conselhos sobre como praticar a bodhicitta e fazer preces a Guru Rinpoche.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
20th April 2024 | Morning Session | Part I p. 9
[Audio-tracks 001-008] Main topics: Signs helping us to measure progress on the path; Short remembrance of the meaning of each stage of preliminary practice.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
20th April 2024 | Morning Session | Part II p. 24
[Audio-tracks 009-012] Main topics: Correctly viewing Guru Yoga practice in the context of other practices; How does Guru Yoga practice function and the effect of it.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
20th April 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part I
[Audio-tracks 013-017] Main topics: In what light we need to see the teacher in terms of the Guru Yoga; The reasons we need to see our teacher as a buddha; In what ways our teachers are more kind than the buddhas.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
20st April 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part II p. 51
[Audio-tracks 018-023] Main topics: About the place, transmissions on Preliminary Practices and Guru Yoga, and receving teachings, obstacles and rejoicing for having received teachings.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st April 2024 | Morning Session | Part I p. 52
[Audio-tracks 024-027] Main topics: All the preceding practices are essential in terms of doing the Guru Yoga practice.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st April 2024 | Morning Session | Part II p. 61
[Audio-tracks 028-032] Main topics: The idea here is fully opening ourselves to the guru.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st April 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part I p. 74
[Audio-tracks 033-039] Main topics: Questions and answers; Seeing the fear in terms of four noble truths; The real basis of the guru-student relationship: the need of mutual ability to respond.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
21st April 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part II p. 97
[Audio-tracks 040-046] Main topics: Receiving empowerments from the guru and the causes and conditions necessary for that to happen.

sessionThemes:
5th April 2015 - [Group I]
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 067 to 076] On: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche coming to Portugal; Lineage teachers, Qualified teachers; To have the virtue for to attend his teachings; Training our mind - the heart of the teachings; Everything now and after death depends on state of mind; “Thinking of other” provides means for freedom; Motivation; Bodhichitta; A1 – Verses of the Eight Noble Auspicious Ones; Seven line prayer; M1 Sadhana de Chenrezig – guided practice and explanations; Homage and praise - purification of obscurations of pride; The Thirty Seven Verses of the Practices of the Bodhisattva – verses 1 to 9; Shantideva: Patience as antidote to anger; Practice of patience; Importance of Refuge; Vimalamitra and his six points on refuge: 1 - Purpose of taking refuge, 2 - object refuge, 3 - how long we take refuge, 4- the benefit, 5 -the precepts, what to do and avoid; 6 - the ritual. Precepts; Refuge; Respecting representations of Buddha, Dharma, Sangha; Making offerings physically or mentally; How to take refuge; Three paths: Shravaka, Pratyekabuddha and Bodhisattva yanas. The countries where the Theravada, and the other schools are practiced; In Tibet the three yanas were practiced; Summary of the teachings of Buddha; Shantideva “when we get used we can succeed”

5th April 2015 - [Group I] 
Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 077-087] On: Why we should practice the 37 Practices of Bodhisattvas; It contains all the teachings; Student recite and sing the verses; Introduction to the Preliminary Practices, ngöndro; Refuge; It’s not just for the beginning; The Three Turnings of the Wheel; How many times the teachers did the ngöndro, and also the students of K. Trulshik Rinpoche; External or Common Preliminaries, Internal or Extraordinary Preliminaries; The Four Thoughts; Why is precious the Precious Human Life; Renouncing the causes of suffering; What is real renounciation; The need for the Four Thoughts as mind training; Starting the ngöndro; Organising a retreat day in four sessions; Waking up; how to practice the first stage of calling the Guru; Bodhichita; Visualizing the Guru; Meanings of visualization, lotus sun, moon; Freedom from Eight extremes; Dissolution; Meditating on the Four Thoughts, Freedoms and Advantages; Questions; Guided Practice

6th April 2015 - [Group I]
1st Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 088 to 099] On: Have a good heart; Main practice and advice of K. Trulshik Rinpoche; All beings want to be happy, but cause their own suffering; How you were, look at the present; Believing things truly exist makes everything limited; Taking refuge not enough; The 8 qualities of Buddha; The 8 Qualities of the Dharma; Eight qualities of the Sangha; Budha predicted he would manifest as books and teachers; meaning of Könchok; Refuge; Importance and benefits of Buddha Shakyamuni practice, The Thirty Seven Practices; Preliminary Practices; instructions on sessions; exhalations

6th April 2015 - [Group I]
2nd Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 100 to 105] On: Refuge as described in Maitreya’s Uttaratantra; Refuge is like a Jewel; Qualities of the Refuge; Four buddhas of this time; Stories of the Dog and Pig and Stupa, so on; Statues of Buddha in Lhasa, Jowo; Gonpo Ben; Causal and Resultant refuges; Longchenpa on Object-field of Refuge; Qualities of the Three Refuges; How to go for refuge; The ghost that appeared to Jedrung Rinpoche; The student of Patrul Rinpoche and the piece of bone; Attachment to an object at death and it’s experience; Refuge benefits and as purification; the merit of prostrations; How buddhas and bodhisattvas manifest to benefit beings according to their need; what inspires beings; making aspirations to benefit everyone; Creating connections by chanting in the streets in Paris and New York, so on. 

6th April 2015 - [Group I] 
Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 106 - 111] On: Establishing the Three Sublime Methods for a complete practice; Overcoming the difficulty of thinking of “all sentient beings”; Proper motivation; Practicing knowing that subject, object and action are illusory; To remove clinging to existence; Guided practice session of the ngöndro; How precious is a Precious human life, it’s causes; Appreciating it; Contemplating the eight freedoms and eight advantages; Being an animal, Kyabje Rinpoche’s pets passing away; Kadampa Geshe Chen-ngawa; Nyong Thri; Instructions on the contemplation of the freedoms and advantages, so on; Student sings; Reading transmissions

mainThemes: "As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas” | “O treino da mente em 7 pontos” | As bênçãos de Buda | 2 aspectos do Dharma, lung e togpa | Desejando tornar-nos Sangha | 100.000 não é um número mágico | A minha relação com o meu mundo vai ser perturbada, senão não estamos a tomar refúgio | Refúgio, 3 vezes ao dia | Analisando a Bodhicitta relativa e ultima | Meditação analítica | “Na pós-meditação, considerem os fenómenos como ilusórios” | Tonglen | Os 3 venenos e como transformá-los | Que hábito estou pronto a pôr na tábua de cortar? | Milarepa, Buda, Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, Kangyur Rinpoche | Estudo, Contemplação e meditação | Sentir gratidão para com a terra, natureza e seres sencientes | 3 kayas | Bodhicitta em ação | Purificação | Benefícios do mantra “Mani” | Oferendas a forças negativas e Dharmapalas | Pôr as 5 forças em prática | Tsog e seu significado

24th October 2023 | Morning Session | 2nd Part

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
eventTitle: Retiro da Primavera | Treino da Mente 2
mainThemes: "Despertar" – de que se trata em termos do treino da mente | Bodhicitta absoluta, removendo a ilusão | A Prática como equilíbrio das duas verdades |  Nāgārjuna e Asaṅga explicam vacuidade e luminosidade | 3 tipos de diligência transcendente vs. 3 tipos de preguiça | Concentração transcendente | União de śamatha e vipaśyanā | Vias da acumulação, junção, visão, meditação e a via para além do treino | 3 aspectos da sabedoria transcendente – estudar, refletir e meditar | A realização da vacuidade leva à compaixão espontânea e à capacidade de beneficiar os outros durante éons | 3 níveis sucessivos de amor, compaixão, alegria e imparcialidade ilimitados | "As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas" – do verso 30 ao 37

mainThemes:
Os ensinamentos de Buda; Atenção Plena e Vigilância; Procrastinação; Agitação e afundamento; Estadios da Meditação; Sobre Khyentse Rinpoche; Maitreya; Songtsen Gampo; 
Sabedoria e Compaixão; Príncipe Siddhartha; Vipassana; Canais e Postura; Preciosa Vida Humana; Do Drupchen Rinpoche; Sua Santidade Sakya Trizin; Os Cinco obstáculos; Atenção plena ao corpo e às sensações; Mente e fenómenos; Causa  e efeito; Sete Riquezas; Corpo de Arco-íris

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th October 2018 | Morning session 
[Audio Tracks 040-050] Main topics: The Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas—recitation, overview; Preliminary practices—introduction; Training your mind—Chalenges, facing your mind.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
13th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks 052-065] Main topics: Refuge. Taking refuge in six points—commentary by Vimalamitra.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
13th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 066-079] Main topics: Daily Practice in Three Parts; Seven Branches - Bodhisattvas skilful means; Milarepa and Rechung Dorje—the yak’s horn; Nāgārjuna and residual karma; Daily Practice of Ārya Tārā; reading transmissions.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th October 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 080-085] Main Topics: The Preliminary Practices; ngöndro practice—the foundation of our path, a main practice in itself, instructions.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th October 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 086-093] Main topics: Preliminary Practice to Session—mingling our mind with the Guru, Guided practice; Eight Freedoms and Four thoughts and taking Refuge.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
14th October 2018 | Afternoon session | 1st part
[Audio Tracks: 094-109] Main Topics: Refuge. Taking refuge in six points—commentary by Vimalamitra—Continuation

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
14th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part 
[Audio Tracks: 110-120] Main topics: Daily activities as practice; Thinking of teacher; Collection of Practices—Reading transmission, Stories and instructions.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
15th October 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio track 121-129] Main topics: Explanation on the Ordinary or External Preliminaries: how to contemplate the four thoughts.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
15th October 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks: 130-134] Main topics: Brief Preliminary Practices— Preliminary to Each Session; Precious human life; Bodhisattva Vow.

Khenchen Pema Sherab Rinpoche
15th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 135-150] Main topics: Refuge. Taking refuge in six points—commentary by Vimalamitra.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
15th October 2018 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 151-158] Main topics: Vows of bodhicitta; Karmic connections; Collection of Practices—reading transmission.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
15th October 2018 | Evening Session
[Audio Track: 159] Main Topics: Collection of Practices—Reading transmissions. Vajra-vidāraṇa (D1); Riwo Sanchö (F1); Guru Yoga Based on The Guru of Oḍḍiyāna (H15)—Receiving four empowerments

mainThemes: Conhecer a mente: o que é, por que é importante e como começar o treino | Atenção plena no meio da agitação | Desenvolver uma perceção da nossa própria mente | Meditação — tornando-a honesta, mesmo durante do tédio | Trabalhando com a ignorância | Treino da mente | Meditação guiada | Prática de pós-meditação | Skandhas | Vidas passadas | Somos budas | Budistas, o que são? | Apoiar e encorajar as crianças | Memórias | Karma | A consciência sutil | Exemplo do fio e das pérolas | Sanidade e insanidade | Conexões positivas | Śamatha, lógica, vipaśyanā | Nirvāņa | Usar as emoções | Materialismo espiritual | Entusiasmo | Fé | Métodos para conhecer a nossa mente | Oração na prática | Remover, transformar, conhecer | Devoção ao Guru | Libertação de animais | Apreciar a motivação positiva dos outros | Inteligência emocional

sessionThemes:
25th October 2024 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 001-009] Main topics: Knowing the mind: what it is, why it
is important and how to start training to know our mind

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
25th October 2024 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 010-018] Main topics: Knowing the mind: what it is, why it
is important and how to start training to know our mind.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2024 | Morning Session | Part I
[Audio-tracks 019-022] Main topics: Mind Training — “Know Your Mind”
| Mindfulness amidst busyness | Basic truth of developing an insight into our
own mind | Meditation — making it honest, even through the boredom | Working
with ignorance; attachment to what we want and attachment to what we
don’t want

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2024 | Morning Session | Part II
[Audio-tracks 023-027] Main topics: Mind Training | Guided Meditation
Instructions | Śamatha practice | Understanding the basis of Mind Training |
Post-meditation practice | Questions and Answers

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part I
[Audio-tracks 028-033] Main topics: Mind Training — Questions & Answers
| Skandhas | Past Lives | We are buddhas | Buddhists, what are they? |
Supporting and encouraging children | Memories | Karma | The subtle consciousness
| Meditation and post-meditation; The thread and pearls

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th October 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part II
[Audio-tracks 034-038] Main topics: Mind Training — “Know Your Mind”
| Questions and Answers | Our mental states — sanity and insanity | Making
positive connections | Various aspects of practice, śamatha, logic, vipaśyanā
| Nirvāņa | Using our emotions | Spiritual materialism

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2024 | Morning Session | Part I
[Audio-tracks 039-045] Main topics: Mind Training — “Know Your Mind”
| Do we know our mind? | Enthusiasm | Motivation based on enthusiasm |
Faith

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2024 | Morning Session | Part II
[Audio-tracks 046-050] Main topics: Mind Training — “Know Your Mind”
| Rinpoche guiding students through methods for getting used to knowing our
mind

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part I

| Questions and Answers | Prayer in practice | Working with our emotions |
Removing, transforming, knowing

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
27th October 2024 | Afternoon Session | Part II

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
eventTitle: Retiro de Primavera | A Prática da Bodhicitta
mainThemes: Bodhicitta e o voto de bodhicitta | Como fazer a prática formal da Bodhicitta no contexto das práticas preliminares | Devoção e razão | Práticas Preliminares de Chenrezig e Guru Rinpoche | Acumulações |  Preliminares externas |  Objeto de Refúgio | Diferentes Veículos | Tsa lung tigle | Canais, energia vital e essência | Corpo vajra | Sete ramos | Quatro incomensuráveis | "A Lamparina para Dissipar as Trevas" | Thangtong Gyalpo | Visualização de Chenrezig | Refúgio | Explicação segundo Patrul Rinpoche | As qualidades das Três Joias.
