sessionThemes:
Retreat Group I
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group 1 | 28Th May 2017 | Morning Session 
[Audio 115-134] On: Refuge practice | Ngöndros from Chenrezig and Guru Rinpoche | Merit | Story about monks pretending to have miraculous powers | Outer and inner merit | Considering our teacher as inseparable from the Buddha | Visualizing this place | To be free from suffering is dependent on the removal of the cause | Devotion and reasoning | Other emotional paths of devotion | Reciting in specific numbers | How to taking refuge | Not going naked like the emperor | Shechen Gyaltsab Rinpoche and Vajrakilaya retreat | Accumulation in Tibetan | Renouncing saṃsāra is really like washing | Misunderstandings of renunciation | Jowo Thukje Chenpo Preliminaries | Way to be free from the aggregate of suffering | Wanting enlightenment for sentient beings, that is really an extraordinary quality of the Buddha’s teachings | Compared to bodhicitta, human rights is very narrow minded | It’s for every single sentient being | Buddhas are born of bodhisattvas | Bodhicitta has to be limitless | Clear idea of what is refuge | In the past practitioners spent six or seven years just on the four thoughts | Now a days, preliminaries are taught one after the other | Do it with bodhicitta | Product placing in our mind | Why bodhicitta, why refuge? | Bodhicitta mindset needs focus on sentient beings | Removing the self-centered part | King, Ferryman, Shepherd like bodhicitta | About the Five Paths | The levels of bodhicitta according to the bhūmis | Determination and vast mind. 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 1 | 28th May 2017 | Afternoon session 1st Part 
[Audio 135-144] On: Opening prayers | The field of merit | A Beacon to Dispel the Gloom | The origin of the practice and it’s lineage | On Thangtong Gyalpo and the bridges | The visualization | Chenrezig’s four arms | The Outer Preliminary Practices | Precious Human Life; Death and Impermanence; Cause and Effect; Defects of Saṃsāra | Jetsün Milarepa’s example of study and practice. 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 1 | 28th May 2017 | Afternoon session 2nd Part 
[Audio 145-156] On: The Beacon to Dispel the Gloom – instructions on the practice until the bodhicitta section | The visualizations | Different ways to visualize the object of refuge | Visualization of Chenrezig and its meanings | From The Words of My Perfect Teacher | What is the object of refuge? | Duration of refuge | Refuge object according to each vehicle | Secret mantra Vajrayana | Tsa lung tigle; channels, energies and vital essences | The three channels | The different centres, lotus and petals | Vajra body | What they represent | The three kayas | Ngowo, the nature | Levels of realization according to vehicles | The bhūmis | Elimination of different types of obscuration | Paramitas and the transcending clinging to subject, object and action | Body as support of wisdom | Dharmakaya and qualities | Manifestations sambhogakaya or through nirmanakaya | Manifestations of the Buddha | Five dhyani buddhas | Path of accumulation | Path of joining | Being’s perception of the Buddha | Our teachers are the manifestation of the Buddha | Generating enlightened mind and its application. 

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Group 1 | 29th May 2017 | Morning Session 
[Audio 158-173] On: How to give rise to boddhicita | Bodhicitta vows’ two lineages | How to take the vow of bodhicitta | Prepare and clean your practice place and shrine | Be content with Buddha’s photo in front | Then clean inside | Four thoughts, Refuge | The object of refuge is the witness | How to make the offerings | Go beyond narrow-mindedness | Seven branches | Apology or confession means changing | Strong sense of regret | Preventing proliferation of negative actions | Be free of being a victim | Make aspirations for all beings | Concluding the bodhicitta practice | The essence of the teachings is bodhicitta | We can’t break our promise to infinite beings | Four immeasurables with characteristics and four immeasurables without characteristics | Four immeasurables as a formal practice | Loving-kindness, etc | Doing retreats should not make you more protective | Concluding visualizations | Guided taking of the bodhicitta vow | Instructions for formal practice. 

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
Group 1 | 29th May 2017 | Afternoon Session p. 449
[Audio 175-190] On: Mindfulness; A Beacon to Dispel the Gloom | Künkhyen Tend- zin Gyaltsen | Refuge and Bodhicitta; Qualities of Buddha | Compassion of Buddha | Qualities of the Dharma | The three trainings | Discipline and concentration | Sangha
| Śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas | Bodhisattvas on the first bhūmi | Bodhisattvas on second and higher levels | Kriya tantra | Visualizations of kriya tantra | Forbidden substances in Kriya tantra | Upa and Yoga tantra | Inner Tantra | Commitments | Conclusion and Dedication | N23 and V2 from the Collection of Practices.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio-Tracks: 001-007] Main topics: Śamatha—what it is, recognizing state of mind, entertainment, relaxation, just be, being present, being realistic.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio-Tracks: 008-013] Main topics: Being aware and present; post-meditation; focused and relaxed; not manipulating

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
1st November 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part 
[Audio-Tracks: 014-018] Main topics: Posture and channels; Focus and object of the mind; Movements of the mind.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
1st November 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio-Tracks: 019-025] Main topics: Four close mindfulnesses: Meditation, sleep and dreams; Death and intermediate states

Rangdrol Rinpoche
1st November 2019 | Evening Session 
[Audio-Tracks: Night session-1-nov-2019] Main topics: Subduing the mind; Seven point of Vairocana; Following the Breath.

Rangdrol Rinpoche
2nd November 2019 | Morning Session 
[Audio-Tracks: Morning session - 2-nov-2019] Main topics: Seven
point of posture; Support of meditation.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
2nd November 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio tracks: 026-031] Main topics: Being with oneself; working
with the mind; loneliness; connecting mind with the practice

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
2nd November 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio tracks: 032-036] Main topics: Being present; Sitting; Motivation

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
2nd November 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part 
[Audio tracks: 037-043] Main topics: Our potential; Commitment for
all beings; Training the mind; Right balance.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
2nd November 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio tracks: 044-051] Main topics: Diligence and trust; Judging
our meditation; Awareness; Natural state and non-duality.

Rangdrol Rinpoche
2nd November 2019 | Evening Session 
[Audio-tracks: Night session - 2-nov-2019] Main-topics: Concentration
of the mind; Breathing as a support.

Rangdrol Rinpoche
3rd November 2019 | Morning Session 
[Audio tracks: Morning session-3-nov-2019] Main-topics: Benefits
of regular practice; breath and image as support.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd November 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio tracks: 052-059] Main topics: Buddha—his story; Motivation;
Right balance; Stages of śamatha.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd November 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio tracks: 060 - 065] Main topics: Śamatha—need for it, not selfhelp,
commitment

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
3rd November 2019 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 066-078] Main topics: Practice and view; Love; Motivation;
General aspects of the path.

mainThemes: Opening our mind, the importance Bodhicitta, other-ness and me-ness, wakefulness, mindfulness, vigilance, carefulness, Buddha nature, beginner's main practice
sessionThemes:
Experience is usually personal | We are conditioned by our
habits, such as the birth process | Birth-tunnels and MRI machines | We are
wrapped in the cocoon of me-ness | I have no control over the environment |
How to unknot a bundle of thread | Are there any other options? | Being able
to open our mind, befriending an ant | Total openness is bodhicitta | Recognizing the me-ness | Widening the experience | Openness leads to wakefulness |
The result | The importance of bodhicitta | Don’t become an “ant whisperer”
| “Otherness” is so important | Mindfulness, vigilance, carefulness, and looking toward our Buddha nature | This is a beginner’s main practice | Maintaining bodhicitta and increasing it: remembering | Connecting our wish to those
of the enlightened beings | And dedicating | Catching the moments | Trusting
ourselves

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th November 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th November 2019 | Morning session | 2nd part

5th November 2019 | Afternoon Session

of taking support on a spiritual friend; The four kinds of teacher; Khangsar

mainThemes: Os Versos dos Oito Nobres Auspiciosos  (A1); Sūtra-Coração da Venerável Prajñāpāramitā (C1); Sūtra para a Evocação das Três Joias Sublimes(A10); Louvores a Buda Shakyamuni; Oferenda da Maṇḍala de 37 elementos (L6); Recitação dos nomes do Tathagata; Os ensinamentos de Buda; Maṇḍala do Vajradhātu – Oração Pessoal do Rei e Súbditos (S1); Sadhana de Chenrezig (M1); Orações pela longa vida dos mestres (U1); Orações de Conclusão (V1); O Tesouro de Bênçãos – Sādhana do Buda Śākyamuni (L1); Refúgio e compromissos; Sete Ramos (v. extensa) e Orações para Ensinamentos (B21); Sādhana do Buda da Medicina (L11) e explicação; Oração em Sete Linhas e Oração dos Três Kāyas (B1) Oração Breve à Linhagem (B2); Chuva de Bênçãos – A Sādhana da Oração das Sete Linhas (i1) e explicação; A Confissão Diária (K3); i7 - oferenda de Tsok; Breves Orações a Guru Rinpoche (N23); Lhakma, Chetho e Tenma (i9); A Oração de Yeshe Tsogyal (Q1)

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
16th October 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 160-165] Main Topics: Preliminary Practices—Significance, Refuge, importance of accumulation. Vajrasattva—our nature, cleasing obscurations.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
16th October 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks: 166] Main topics: Vajrasattva—guided practice, postmeditation.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
16th October | Afternoon Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks: 167-186] Main topics: Bodhicitta—Four Boundless; Kyabje Dudjom Rinpoche teaching—Advice on the Bardo of Living, Bardo of Dreaming and Meditation Bardo, Bardo of Dying and Existence Bardo

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
16th October | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part 
[Audio Tracks 184-186] Main topics: Reading Transmission of the Collection of Practices.


Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
17th October 2018 | Morning Session | 1st Part 
[Audio Tracks: 188-194] Main topics: Preliminary Practices—accumulating, refuge, bodhicitta. Vajrasattva practice.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
17th Oct. 2018 | Morning Session | 2nd part 
[Audio Tracks: 194-199] Main topics: Brief Preliminary Practice from the Secret Heart Essence; Different ingredients of a practice; Importance of devotion and confidence; Questions, answers, and conclusion.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
17th October 2018| Afternoon Session
[Audio Tracks: 200-212] Main topics: Vajrasattva practice—our true nature, teacher as inseparable from deity, removing sufferings of others; Sūtra of Immeasurable Life and Pristine Awareness

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
24th April 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 001-010] Main topics: Mind training; The Seven Point Mind Training – a commentary by Ngulchu Thogme Zangpo on the root text verses by Chekawa Yeshe Dorje; Enlightened Courage – a text transcribed from teachings given by Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche on The Seven Point Mind Training.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
24th April 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 011-022] Main topics: Chekawa Yeshe Dorje’s, Root Text: ‘The Seven Point Mind Training’ | Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche’s commentary ‘Enlightened Courage’ expounding on that by Ngulchu Thogme Zangpo | Chapter Two – Bodhicitta | Absolute Bodhicitta | Relative Bodhicitta | Tonglen

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
25th April 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks 023-030] Main topics: Being an explorer of our own mind and to really uncover the purpose of śamatha practice and knowing our motivations with the practice of tonglen as the core of mind training by taking on ourselves the suffering of others and making our mind open and unafraid.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
25th April 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 031-039] Main topics: To recognise the three possibilities of motivation and reducing the power of self-centredness through an understanding of what self-centredness means and what it does, then whoever is in front of me are both good reasons, good conditions to reduce my self-centredness.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th April 2023 | Morning Session part 1
[Audio-tracks 040-045] Main topics: Seven Point Mind Training | Dealing with negative emotions | Being one’s own witness | Lesser vehicle | Mahāyāna, development stage | Ngondro, śamatha | Interdependence| Cultural characteristics | Listen, reflect, contemplate

Jigme Khyenstse Rinpoche and Rabjam Rinpoche
26th April 2023 | Morning Session part 2
[Audio-tracks 046-051] Main topics: Rabjam Rinpoche | Seven Point Mind Training | Preliminaries | Relative and ultimate bodhicitta | Appreciating human birth | Inner and outer culture | Impermanence | Suffering of change | Saṃsāra, the endless roller coaster | Post meditation | Phenomena as dreamlike | Absolute bodhicitta | Examining the notion of self | Tonglen | Śamatha

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
26th April 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 052-065] Main topics: Seven-Point Mind Training instructions 7-11; relative bodhicitta; reversing the habit of self-centeredness and self-cherishing; practice of tonglen; benefits of tonglen; obstacles to the practice; the purpose of mind training; questions and answers

mainThemes: Conceitos de religião e meditação | Importância da postura e seu objetivo | Exemplo sobre macacos e postura | Objetivo da meditação e prática budista | Prática de śamatha guiada | Ferramentas para usar de acordo com diferentes estados mentais | Compreender o contexto de śamatha | Os cinco obstáculos à prática | Os antídotos para a preguiça, o esquecimento, o  torpor e a agitação | Conselhos sobre pós-meditação | História sobre Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche | Estabelecer a atmosfera apropriada para a prática | Construir uma relação segura com o nosso mundo físico, emocional e psicológico | Recitação e explicação da “Prática Diária em Três Partes” | A importância de ouvir, comtemplar e aplicar as instruções sobre śamatha | Os obstáculos de não aplicar os antídotos ou de aplicá-los em demasia | Explicação sobre o Kangyur e o Mahāyāna  | Incentivo para nos tornarmos destemidos

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th April 2025 | Morning session | Part 1
[Audio tracks: 001-002] Main topics: The concept of religion and meditation;
The importance of the posture and the purpose.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th April 2025 | Morning session | Part 2
[Audio tracks: 003-007] Main topics: Guided śamatha focusing on being
aware of the posture and the breath, with detailed description of the meditation
posture; Tools to use according to how our mind is; An introduction to
the obstacles that arise.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th April 2025 | Afternoon session | Part 1
[Audio tracks: 008-012] Main topics: Understanding the background of
śamatha; The five obstacles for the practice; The antidotes to laziness, forgetfulness,
dullness and agitation.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th April 2025 | Afternoon session | Part 2
[Audio tracks: 013-016] Main topics: Q&A about dullness, agitation, what
to focus, and existence; post-meditation advice.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th April 2025 | Morning session | Part 1
[Audio tracks: 017-021] Main topics: The concept of śamatha; The five
obstacles to practice; The antidotes to laziness and forgetfulness.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th April 2025 | Morning session | Part 2
[Audio tracks: 022-024] Main topics: Stablishing an atmosphere for
śamatha; The Daily Practice in Three Parts; Śamatha practice.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th April 2025 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 025-032] Main topics: Questions and answers; The importance
to listen, to contemplate and to apply the instructions of śamatha; The
antidotes for dullness and agitation; The obstacles of not applying the antidote
or applying too much.

eventTitle: Retiro de Outono | Práticas dos Bodhisattvas | Vídeo
mainThemes:
As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas - Estâncias 25 a 37 | Dificuldades na prática | Ambiente e programação mental | Emoções | Importância de ler as biografias do Buda e de grandes mestres | Contos de fadas | Esperança em resultados e recompensas | 6 pāramitās | (1) Generosidade | Medo de dar | Treinar no destemor | (2) Disciplina | Stress no início da prática | O poder da fala | As 10 ações negativas | Ignorância | Andar em volta do Stupa | Angulimala | Visualização e recitação de Chenrezig | (3) Paciência Atenção Plena infantil | Necessidade de tradutores | (4) Diligência | A Via do Bodhisattva | Instinto de sobrevivência | Os 3 Métodos Sublimes | (5) Concentração |  śamatha , vipaśyanā, sabedoria | 4 absorções sem forma | (6) Sabedoria | As 3 esferas | Vigilância permanente | Conclusão do texto das 37 Práticas.

Links para vídeos legendados ver nas faixas.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 1 of 7  Introduction
Main topics: Introduction: Difficulty to practice, long-time beginner practitioners, settings, mental environment, desperation, dissatisfaction, habits, changing our mental environment, mental spin, honesty and humility, addiction (to our phones), prisoners of our emotions, the Buddha’s sanity, reasoning, practice is not a penance, to change the settings read the lives of Buddha and great beings.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 2 of 7  
Verse 25: Generosity
Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices: Verse 25; settings, fairy tales, positive examples, wakefulness, hoarding, habits, changing the settings, hoping for results and reward.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 3 of 7  
Verse 25 & 26: Generosity & Discipline
Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices: verse 25: generosity, fear of giving, mental environment, giving up our mental settings, finding excuses, our perception is unclear, cold showers, stress when we start to practice, training in fearlessness, honesty. Verse 26 : discipline, desperation, lack of discernment, panic, influence of media, violence, carefulness, watching, the power of speech, the 10 negative actions, avoiding them, the power of mind, the power of words, setting the parameter of interest in the Dharma versus “Instagrat”.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 4 of 7 
Verse 26: Discipline
Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices: verse 26; discipline, settings, ignorance, attachment, aversion, stress, anger, conspiracy theories, feeling the world is malevolent, Coca-Cola, proliferation good and bad, social media, antidotes resolve, promise, princess of Sri Lanka, walking around stupas, Angulimala, mind training, Chenresig visualization and recitation, approach, big numbers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 5 of 7 
Generosity, Discipline, and Verse 27 on Patience
Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices: Verse 27; generosity, discipline, feeling discomfort when giving, blaming others, inflammation of the mind, infantile mindfulness, the joys and wealth of virtue, fashion heroes, translators, past and present, the need for translators and support, read the Buddha’s life, change your settings, patience, the real object of patience, 3 kinds of patience.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 6 of 7  
Patience and Discipline (revision) and Verse 28 on Diligence
Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices: Verse 28; 3 types of patience, discipline, captain in a storm, read the Way of the Bodhisattva, survival instinct, hair on fire, snake in our lap, the 3 sublime methods.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Group 8 & 1 | Video 7 of 7 
Verses 29 to 37: Concentration, wisdom and conclusion
Main Topics: Thirty-Seven Practices: Verses 29 to 37; śamatha , vipaśyanā, wisdom, inflammation of emotions, intention, four formless absorptions, clinging to self identity, wisdom needs compassion and vice versa, the 3 wheels, faults of others, attachment to home, harsh words, immediately tend to emotions, vigilance at all times, dedication, concluding verse, colophon.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part p. 9
[Audio Tracks: 001-008] Main topics: Preliminary Practices—summary up to Maṇḍala; Refuge as protection; Bodhicitta vs individual liberation; Different aspects of Vajrasattva practice; meditation and post-meditation.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th October 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part p. 29
[Audio Tracks: 009-016] Main topics: Maṇḍala—introduction to the practice, importance of accumulation of merit; The meaning of Maṇḍala practice; Practical aspects of the Maṇḍala offering.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
29th October 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part p. 53
[Audio Tracks: 017-030] Main topics: The importance of setting aside your time for practice; Ngöndro—overview and accumulations; Maṇḍala—preparation for the maṇḍala practice, stories about offerings from Buddha’s times.
Preliminary Practices - Level III - October 2019

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
29th October 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part p. 87
[Audio Tracks: 031-037] Main topics: The need and purpose of two
accumulations: merit and wisdom; Step-by-step explanation of maṇḍala offering
practice.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
31st October 2019 | Excerpt of Prel. Practice Level 1 Retreat p. 103
[Audio track: 69] Main topic: Cleansing of the maṇḍala according to
Kangyur Rinpoche’s ngöndro commentary.

sessionThemes:
15th OCTOBER 2014
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
On: Spiritual food; Five paths; Different kinds of obscurations; Different kinds of eyes; Four unlimited thoughts; Jigme Gyalwe Nyugu and Jigme Lingpa; Asanga and Maitreya; Mind training; Buddha is free of limitations; Three types of thoughts, Gampopa and Milarepa. 

Afternoon Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
On: The ten negative actions; Nagarjuna and Padmasambhava; Positive and negative actions; The monk and his butcher friend; Developing compassion; Shechen Gyaltsap's text and K. Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche; Refuge; Qualities of an authentic teacher; Cultivating Bodhichitta; How to sit; Shakyamuni Sadhana.

16th OCTOBER 2014
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
On: Publication of transcriptions of teachings; How to study; How to listen to teachings, the Six points; Milarepa and Marpa Lotsawa; Attachment to objects.

Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
On: Causes and Conditions; Understanding interdependent origination; What is and is not Karma; Different kinds of conditions.

17th OCTOBER 2014
Morning Session - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
On: Good heart; Bodhisattva Manjushri; Instructions until next retreat; practices A1,B1; Four advices of Buddha to his disciples; Four unlimited thoughts, Six Paramitas. 

Afternoon Session - Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
On: The meaning of "Awakened"; Law of cause and effect; Positive and negative actions; Requests until next retreat.

Conclusion - Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
On: Supporting different organizations and projects.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th October 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 001-006] Main topics: Refuge—motivations, connecting with experience, to protect our mind.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th October 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 007-015] Main topics: Refuge and bodhicitta—view and method; Bodhicitta—developing it, relative and ultimate; Four immeasurables—why immeasurables, with and without focus.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
30th October 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio tracks: 016-026] Main topics: Refuge; Importance of study; Trust; Importance of a qualified teacher.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
30th October 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 027-040] Main topics: Refuge practice—motivation, visualisation, precepts, etc.. Preliminary Practices: “The Beacon to Dispel the Gloom”—Refuge, visualisation, lineage prayer.
 
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
31st October 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part p. 103
[Audio Tracks: 041-050] Main topics: Four immeasurables—impartiality; Remembering kindness of parent sentient beings.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
31th October 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 051-057] Main topics: bodhicitta—loving-kindness, compassion, combining wisdom and practice; Analytical meditation to develop love and limitless compassion.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
31st October 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 058-068] Main Topics: Bodhicitta—impartiality, loving all sentient beings, importance of enemies, suffering of others.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
31st October 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 069-078] Main topics: Bodhicitta—vows, four immeasurables; five paths, pāramitās.

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: A Prática Preliminar como meio hábil para descobrir a nossa natureza de Buda e eliminar os obscurecimentos | Importância de um Mestre autêntico | Diferentes analogias sobre como ver o Mestre | Devoção e apreciação do Mestre como parte do caminho | Desenvolver o Mestre interno | História do dente de cão | Guru Yoga: a forma correta de fazer oferenda | Seres de abordagem direta vs seres de aproximação gradual | Devoção é o que nos permite estabelecer o laço através do qual a compaixão do guru nos pode segurar | O Mestre é a personificação da atividade do Buda, de bondade inigualável e é o refúgio infalível | Instruções sobre como fazer a prática e receber as quatro iniciações do Guru | Em Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, Kyabje Trulshik Rinpoche e Kyabje Kangyur Rinpoche as qualidades dos Buda são óbvias | As oferendas em sete ramos no contexto do Guru Yoga

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th May 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio -Tracks 002 to 012] Main topics: Preliminary Practice as a skilful mean to uncover our innate buddha nature and cleanse all the obscurations, Buddha nature, Importance of an Authentic Teacher.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th May 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-Tracks: 013 to 023] Main topics: Beginning of the Guru Yoga Practice: making aspirations and appreciate our connection with our teacher | Devotion and Appreciation to the teacher as part of the path | Importance of having devotion, joy and enthusiasm for the path.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
10th May 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-Tracks: 024 to 032] Main topics: Guru Yoga: the correct way of offering; the supreme importance of the guru; beings of direct approach vs beings of gradual approach and the importance of devotion and of reasoning.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
10th May 2023 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-Tracks: 033 to 042] Main topics: Guru Yoga: arousing the proper devotion to provide the loop in which the guru’s compassion can hook us by remembering that our teacher is fully awakened; his activity is none other than the Buddha’s activity; his kindness is unequalled; he is the embodiment of all refuges; he is infallible. Instructions on how to do the actual practice of Guru Yoga.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
11th May 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-Tracks: 043 to 055] Main topics: Q&A regarding Guru Yoga practice; The seven-branch offerings in the context of Guru Yoga.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
11th May 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-Tracks: 056 to 071] Main topics: Developing devotion to the guru and appreciation for his kindness; Instructions and advices on doing the actual Guru Yoga practice.

mainThemes: Sua Santidade, o XIV Dalai Lama, um dos mais respeitados líderes mundiais pela paz e valores humanos, nesta conferência, fala-nos do poder do bom coração e da ética secular: "A compaixão genuína envolve respeito, um sincero sentido de cuidar do outro tal como cuidaríamos de nós, e isso é estendido a todos os outros, todos os seres humanos têm o mesmo direito à felicidade e a não sofrerem, com base nisto desenvolvemos um sentido de cuidado, de preocupação para com todos, chama-se a isso compaixão." (Lisboa, 2007)
audio1-trackNames: HHDL-Lisbon-Sept-2007-Public talk
audio2-tracksTitles: Dalai Lama-Lisboa-PA-Conferência e Perguntas[ENG+PT]

mainThemes: Budismo no Tibete; Bases da Ciência de Buda; Prática e experiência pessoais; Impermanência; Sabedoria; Confiança; Refúgio e Bodhicitta; Sadhana de Buda Shakyamuni: repousar a mente, postura, limpeza dos obscurecimentos, dedicatória e conclusão; Shamatha (instrucções); verso 29 (A Essência da Compaixão); O Sutra do Coração; As nossas expectativas sobre o Budismo; Sofrimento e as suas causas; Permanecer desperto

mainThemes:
37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas | Práticas Preliminares curtas de Kyabje Kangyur Rinpoche | Oito Liberdades, Oito Condições Favoráveis e Dezasseis Circunstâncias suplementares | Prezar a preciosa vida humana | O "dente" do Buda | As bênçãos de Guru Rinpoche | Seis emoções negativas base  | As 20 emoções negativas menores |  Acerca de Śāntideva | "Conselho em quatro linhas" de K. Trulshik Rinpoche | Os 4 tipos de Obscurecimentos | "Conselhos do meu Coração" de Dudjom Rinpoche | Textos de prática como um "guia de instruções" | "Breves Práticas Preliminares" de K. Kangyur Rinpoche |  "Uma Lamparina para Dissipar as Trevas" de K. Trulshik Rinpoche | Os ensinamentos de Buda | Bodhicitta (Relativa, Absoluta, em Aspiração e em Aplicação) | Os Quatro Selos | Conclusão do ensinamento sobre a "Soberana Aspiração do Nobre Samantabhadra", etc.

Gravações áudio e transcrições incluem as sessões do antigo Grupo II de 3 a 4 de Abril.

sessionThemes:
GROUP II+I
3rd April 2016 | Morning Session
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
[Audio 001 to 011] On: Buddha Śākyamuni Sādhana | Creating the right environment Remembering the 3 Jewels | Meaning of going for refuge in Tibetan | Cause of refuge | Thinking of the suffering of saṃsāra and the lower realms | Negative actions and the emotion causing them and the result of them | Why we think of suffering | Karma | Cause and effect as a reason to refrain from negative actions and take refuge | Renouncing even the god realms | Bodhicitta, the ground for it and not turning it into a trip | The importance of contemplating suffering to develop discipline| Developing a genuine renunciation | Cause and effect as the soil for the understanding of the emptiness nature | Transmuting fear into strong resolution not to engage in negative emotions | Proper understanding of cause and effect as basis of Mahāyāna practice.

3rd April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 1st part
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
[Audio 012 to 018] On: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Shechen Kongtrul on Dudjom Rinpoche’s qualities, the head of the Nyingma school | Tsewang Dorje’s dream about J.K. Chokyi Lodrö and his emanations | Kangyur Rinpoche, Jigme Lingpa visions | the birth of Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Buddha Śākyamuni’s enlightenment, Four Noble Truths; Patrul Rinpoche, Longchenpa and the four Mañjuśrīs | 3 Perfections; bodhicitta – “semkye” | Asaṅga’s definition | the view to have in the “middle” | motivation, right view, dedication – bodhisattva’s tricks.

3rd April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 019 to 022] On: Karma | Ripening effects, result similar to the cause, similar to the action and similar to the experience | Transforming neutral actions into positive ones.

4th April 2016 | Morning Session
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 023 to 036] On: The King of Aspirations for Noble Excellent Conduct by Samantabhadra (Zangchö mönlam) | Transforming neutral actions | The title, why it’s the king | Explanation of the verses | Homage to Mañjuśrī | Gathering the causes for the accomplishment of our aspirations | Seven branches | Prostration’s object, removing narrowness | Offering, vast like the bodhisattvas | Confession to cleanse our obstacles to the aspiration becoming a path | Rejoicing | Exhortation and requesting to remain | Dedicating these branches, accumulating merit so that aspirations become reality | Why we meet the Dharma only later in life | Aspiring to be a renunciate | Breaking the narrow view towards our native languages | Gentleness and outrageousness | Bodhicitta and what obscures it | Imperviousness to negativity due to past aspirations | It’s the best poetry | Removing limitations to our activity in benefiting others | Past aspirations as cause for first westerners meeting K. Kangyur Rinpoche | Causes for people meeting or not the Buddha | Prayer of what is conducive to our path.

4th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 1st part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche

[Audio 037 to 043] On: Continuation of commentary on The Sublime Prayer of Good Action (or The King of Aspirations for Noble Excellent Conduct or Zangchömönlam) by Samantabhadra | Perfecting the aspiration | Bodhisattva conduct | Buddha’s speech | Wheel of Dharma | Engaging in Buddha’s activity | The power of awakening | The power of excellent conduct.

4th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 044 to 049] On: The three sublime methods | The sublime bodhicitta | The importance of all beings | Recognizing all beings as our mothers, recognizing their kindness, repaying their kindness | The approach of the three vehicles | The story of the poisonous plant growing in the garden | Deluded perceptions | The importance of dedication | Buddha dedicating the king’s offering to the beggar | Dedicating free of the concepts of the three spheres | Perceptions and channels | Final motivation of K. Trulshik Rinpoche.

Group I
5th April 2016 | Morning Session
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 050 to 061] on: Recitation of verses of the “Thirty-Seven Practices” | Eight Freedoms and Eight Advantages | the Sixteen Additional Circumstances | Calling out for Guru Rinpoche | See place, etc. as not ordinary | Overcoming clinging and ordinary perception | Story of the Buddha’s Tooth | Guru Rinpoche’s blessings | Short Preliminary Practices’ 2nd line on Precious Human Life and Impermanence | Human life as a vessel | Appreciation of human life | Contemplation to help ground ourselves and gain precision | Ticking the boxes | Knowing it’s preciousness and it’s impermanence | It’s an upgrade to our mundane integrity |Misunderstandings on Buddha leaving family life | Not to be alienated practitioners | Why those states are not conducive | Precious human is result of disciple | Objects of refuge as a condition | We are fragile | What matters at time of death | Our hierarchy of importances | Freedoms and Advantages must be part of life, not preliminaries | Pierce the armour of saṃsāric protection | We accumulate the resolution | Guided practice.

5th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | Preliminary practice
Rangdrol Rinpoche
[Audio 062 to 064] on: First part of the Guru Yoga of Kangyur Rinpoche short Preliminary Practices.

5th April 2016 | Afternon Session | 1st Part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 065 to 068] On: Six root negative emotions | I - attachment, attachment of existence | II - anger, irritation | III - pride or arrogance. it’s basis, the labelled perishable aggregate | IV - ignorance, or not seeing, defiled views: defiled intelligence, this innate feeling of “I”, imputed wrong, extreme views, consider these views to be sublime | the defiled view of considering conduct and discipline to be sublime | Must remember why to have respect and maintain certain conducts | V- Doubt, negative aspect, like doubting cause and effect | VI - wrong view, like denying cause and effect, etc. | Taking refute not as ritual or repetition | Taking refuge to avoid negative mental factors.

5th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 069 to 074] on: Three points that are totally indispensable in everything we do | Look to your state of mind | Why Buddha gave 84.000 aspects of teaching | Meditation spaced out is waste of time | Monk that was afraid of losing compassion in prison | Hallucinations of hell come from anger, come from mind; not LSD | Do not follow anger | Practice patience | Patience as the cause of Buddha’s body | Three things to do for oneself: Listen, reflect and contemplate Śāntideva’s life story | Three things to do for others: teach, discuss and write | K. Trulshik’s “Four Lines of Advice” | Investigate the teacher | Be skillful to follow and take his support | impermanence, the four examples | Why we don’t know: four kinds of obscurations | Death is uncertain | Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche’s qualities | View of emptiness as illusion, magic | commentary on “Counsels from my Heart” by K. Dudjom Rinpoche, Pg 27, “The Essence of the Path”.

6th April 2016 | Morning Session
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 075 to 082] On: Ignorance and defiled views | First 10 lesser defilements | Second 10 lesser defilements | Refuge and defilements | Taking refuge | Short preliminaries | About Kangyur Rinpoche’s “Short Preliminary Practices” | Developing the mind-set and the resolve | Practice texts as a “How to” guide | Practice in all situations | Tulku Rinpoche’s service to his teachers and his aspirations | Developing the aspiration right now.

6th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 1st part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 083 to 086] On: K. Trulshik Rinpoche’s preliminary practice: “Beacon to Dispel the Gloom” | Recitation and guided practice | The four thoughts | Precious Human Life | Refuge.

6th April 2016 | Afternoon Session | 2nd part
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche 
[Audio 087 to 092] On: Have a good heart, in Tibetan | Story of the boys that were tested and King Trisong Detsen meeting Vairocana | Five Paths | Different aspects of bodhicitta, relative and absolute, aspiration and application | Generosity of a Bodhisattva | Path of Accumulation, three levels | Ground-conciousness, dreams | Mindfulness of the body | Mind, feeling and phenomena | Medium and great path of accumulation | Four Things That we Need to Overcome | The Four Miracle Feet.

7th April 2016 | Morning Session | 1st part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 093 to 102] On: Thinking on the freedoms and advantages | Taking refuge | Thinking of impermanence | Think of Guru Rinpoche when you are happy or unhappy | The importance of having devotion to Guru Rinpoche | Inwardly we should have the discipline of Vinaya, outwardly we should have bodhicitta and secretly we should have the Great View | The importance of taming the mind | Check the credentials of the teachers | Think of the causes of refuge, suffering of saṃsāra and devotion | The predictions of Guru Rinpoche | Call out Guru Rinpoche, only in that way his blessings can help us | We need to have confidence and trust in the refuge | We need to have a strong renunciation to suffering of saṃsāra | Seeing even temporary pleasure as Truth of Suffering | We need to know the Truth of Suffering, the three types of suffering | Develop the wish to be free, knowing that we have no control at the moment over the experiences of our mind | The craving we have when we are about to die can propel us to the lower realms | Take refuge and not fall into craving.

7th April 2015 | Morning Session | 2nd part
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche 
[Audio 103 to 108] On: Continuation of the commentary on Samantabhadra’s King of aspiration’s Prayer.

7th April 2015 | Afternoon Session
Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
[Audio 109 to 119] On: The teachings of the Buddha — the Four Seals: all compounded things are impermanent (i), conflicting emotions are suffering (ii), all phenomena, its nature is free, not truly existent (iii), transcending pain or saṃsāra achieves peace, freedom | Advice to read the book by Dzongsar Khyentse Rinpoche, What makes you not a Buddhist | On the Buddha’s teachings: do not commit negative actions, engage in positive actions (Hīnayāna, Theravādin school) | wishing to attain enlightenment for the benefit of others, bodhicitta (Mahāyāna, Great
Vehicle) | training our mind (Vajrayāna, Diamond Vehicle) | Transmission and chanting of the Sādhana of Mañjuśrī, A Cloud of Offerings Pleasing to the Gentle Protector, written by the 1st Khyentse, The Great | Transmission of The Twenty-One Praises of Tārā (E5) The Daily Practice of Noble Tārā (E1), written by Dudjom Rinpoche, and the condensed version that Tārā gave to Atiśa Dīpaṃkara | Transmission of The Vajra Subduer (D1) blessed by Buddha himself | Transmission of The Heart-Sūtra (C1) | Transmission of Prayers to Guru Rinpoche (N23).

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: O caminho Vajrayana | Refúgio e Bodhicitta como cinto de segurança | Obscurecimentos kármicos, das emoções negativas, cognitivos e dos padrões habituais | Os poderes do suporte, do arrependimento, da resolução e do antídoto | Limpando obscurecimentos e acumulando méritos | As aspirações de Vajrasattva | Mantra das 100 sílabas | O exemplo dos nossos Mestres | Sinais de que os obscurecimentos foram removidos | Visualização | Tipos de ações negativas | No final da sessão, considerar que removemos os obscurecimentos | Pós-meditação | Explicação da prática no âmbito das Práticas Preliminares, “O Excelente Caminho da Libertação”

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
31st October 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio-tracks: 001-012] Main topics: Understand the basic framework of the path; Importance of contemplating Four Thoughts; Importance of refuge and bodhicitta vows; Four kinds of obscurations

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
31st October 2023 | Afternoon session | Part 1
[Audio tracks 013-017] Main topics: The four obscurations, what they obscure and how to cleanse them.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
31th of October 2023 | Afternoon session | Part 2
[Audio tracks 018-022] Main Points: The four strengths/powers: The power of support, the power of regret, the power of resolve, and the power of the antidote.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
31st October 2023 | Evening Session
[Audio tracks 023-029] Main topics: 37 practices of a bodhisattva, verses 30-35, sound and perception emptiness

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2023 | Morning Session
[Audio tracks 030-042] Main topics: Remembering key points of Vajrasattva practice; Thinking of our teachers inseparable from Vajrasattva, Possible signs of cleansing; Vajrasattva instructions while practicing together; A Brief Preliminary Practice From The Secret Heart Essence”

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2023 | 1st afternoon session
[Audio tracks 043-046] Main Topic: Recitation of A Beacon to Dispel the Gloom until the Vajrasattva section, with detailed explanation of the hundred syllables mantra.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
1st November 2023 | Afternoon 2nd session
[Audio tracks 047-050] Main Topic: Recitation and teachings on The Heart Essence of Lama Phurba — The Excellent Path to Liberation, until the Vajrasattva section.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
1st November 2023 | Evening Session
[Audio tracks 051-058] Main Topic: Reading transmission of The Preliminary Practices from the Heart Essence of Lama Phurba, The Excellent Path of Liberation — Laphur Thugtik Ngöndro, with practice until the four contemplations, with commentaries

sessionThemes:
Shechen Rabjam Rinpoche
17th October 2022 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 001-012] Main topics: The importance of generating property attitude when we receive the teachings and when we practice; Understanding the philosophy of a Buddhist teaching, contemplating about it and then putting it into practice; How difficult it is to develop high spiritual quality without having the basic human goodness

Shechen Rabjam Rinpoche
17th October 2022 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 013-022] Main topics: Four Noble Truths; Among six realms, the human realm is considered to be a perfect condition to practice the Dharma because there is enough suffering; Generating loving kindness and compassion; Mind Training

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
17th October 2022 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 023-030] Main topics: The Daily Practice in Three Parts. Mind training as essence of Dharma.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
17th October 2022 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio: 031-036] Main topics: The reason why we call Buddha the teacher; The importance of going beyond our comfort zone, thinking about all sentient beings, and developing kindness and compassion

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th October 2022 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 037-046] Main Topics: Q&A session; open-mindedness and narrow- 
 -mindedness

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th of October 2022 | Morning session | 2nd part
[Audio Tracks: 047-051] Main Topics: Qualities of the Buddha; meditating without meditating; dullness and sleepiness

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th of October 2022 | Afternoon session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 052-060] Main Topics: Explanation of the Daily Practice in Three Parts; Meaning of some terms | Stories of Nanda and Aṅgulimāla, etc

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th of October 2022 | Afternoon session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 061-064] Main Topics: Questions on merit and anxiety

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th of October 2022 | Morning Session | 1st part
[Audio Tracks: 065-073] Main Topics: Explanation of the Daily Practice in Three Parts, cont.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th of October 2022 | Morning Session | 2nd part
[Audio Tracks: 074-081] Main Topics: Open mind; what is Dharma practice; nihilism and eternalism

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th of October 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio Tracks: 082-085] Main Topics: Opening the mind; dedication

guestName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
mainThemes:
Mestre de mestres, como S.S. Dalai Lama, e cuja grande bondade recordamos com tanta gratidão, foi um dos últimos grandes mestres que completou os seus extensos estudos, treino e prática no Tibete e a dedicar os seus últimos anos a viajar pelo ocidente, transmitindo inúmeros textos e iniciações, especialmente na Dordogne, mas também em Portugal. Nestes ensinamentos, além de uma explicação e bênçãos de Chenrezig e do seu mantra, conferiu inúmeros conselhos sobre meditação e o treino da mente. Contém vários ensinamentos introdutórios de Tulku Pema Wangyal Rinpoche.
Tradução para inglês de Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche.
notes:
Completo
Tradução para Ing de JKR

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1FmwIBDfnATvKSMPQfKWqY0Qi6YnV7ZxD

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
eventTitle: Retiro da Primavera | Refúgio e Bodhicitta
mainThemes:
Refúgio: enquanto alicerce, os seus dois aspetos de devoção e renúncia, teísta e não-teísta.
A prática do refúgio: visualização, repetição, renúncia e alegria.
O refúgio segundo Dudjom Rinpoche, "A Torch Lighting the Way to Freedom", cap. 9.
Como e porquê praticar. A preciosa vida humana.

Comentário e transmissão do "Sūtra da Infinita Vida e Sabedoria". (L13 v.digital)
Comentário e transmissão do "Sūtra-Coração" (C1), entre outros.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th May 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 001-007] Main topics: Why we practice; How to practice; Precious human life; Refuge—Two aspects: devotion and renunciation; Devotion and trust; Antidote to pride.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
29th May 2019 | Morning session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 008-016] Main topics: Refuge—the foundation, why and how to take refuge, visualisation, repetition. Renunciation, joy, satisfaction. Post meditation.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
29th May 2019 | Afternoon Session | 1st Part
[Audio Tracks: 017-027] Main topics: Three perfections. Inter-connectedness and love for all beings. "A Torch Lighting the Way to Freedom"— commentary on refuge and outer preliminaries. Dream yoga and how to reach the luminosity stage.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
29th May 2019 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 028-037] Main topics: Refuge; a Torch Lightning the Way to Freedom—Chapter 9 on refuge continued.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th May 2019 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio tracks: 038-045] Main topics: Preliminary Practices; Refuge—theistic and non-theistic approaches, thinking of other sentient beings, difficulty of feeling the joy, of letting go of the fear.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
30th May 2019 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio Tracks: 046-053] Main topics: Preliminary Practices: Taking Refuge—definition of Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha, stability, feeling inadequate—the idea of individual liberation not being a theistic approach; letting go of pride and arrogance.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
30th May 2019 | Afternoon session | 1st part
[Audio Tracks: 054-061] Main topics: Sūtra of Infinite Life and Pristine Awareness—reading transmission and commentary; Advice concerning our everyday activities.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
30th May 2019 | Afternoon session | 2nd part
[Audio Tracks: 062-070] Main topics: Transmission and teaching on The Heart Sūtra (C1); The Vajra Subduer (D1); Riwo Sanchö (F1) and other incense offerings; Practice session of A brief preliminary practice from the Secret Heart Essence (H10).

mainThemes: Verificando a nossa motivação | Bodhicitta | Compreender o objetivo de qualquer caminho | O caminho Vajrayāna | Estados mentais perturbados | Egoísmo | Percepção impura | Natureza de buda | Limpar as obscurecimentos | Ações negativas | Antídotos para os obscurecimentos | Quatro qualidades e quatro tipos de obscurecimentos | Os quatro poderes | A prática do Refúgio e da Bodhicitta | A prática de Vajrasattva | Percepção pura | Iniciação | Relacionando-se com o dharma | Ngöndro | As quatro incomensuráveis | Treinando a nossa mente | Egocentrismo | Importância de Śamatha | Transmissões orais de “Confissão Inefável”, “Sūtra Condensado da Libertação”,  “Dhāraṇī de Nirvanaviskambin”, “Aspiração do Siddhi da Omnisciência”

mainThemes: Todo o caminho se baseia na limpeza de obscurecimentos e na acumulação de mérito | Mérito: um sentido de destemor | 4 tipos de obscurecimentos: kármicos, das emoções aflitivas, cognitivos e das tendências habituais | 4 poderes: suporte, arrependimento, resolução e antídoto | Os exemplos de Aṅgulimāla, Nanda e rei Ajātaśatru | A prática de Vajrasattva, uma das formas mais sublimes de limpar obscurecimentos | Benefícios de recitar o mantra 6 ou 21 vezes | Sinais de limpeza dos obscurecimentos | Orientações sobre a prática

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th April 2025 | Morning Session | 1st part
[Audio-tracks 001-008] Main topics: Four thoughts; refuge; Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha; Three ways of taking refuge

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th April 2025 | Morning Session | 2nd part
[Audio-tracks 009-015] Main topics: Further exploring the three capacities of beings; the kāyas and wisdoms of the buddhas

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
19th April 2025 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 016-031] Main topics: The Qualities of Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha respectively; Precepts of refuge; Advice on refuge practice session in relation to Excellent Path to Liberation

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
20th April 2025 | Morning Session | 1st part
[Audio-tracks 032-040] Main topics: A Brief Preliminary Practice from The Secret Heart Essence— Joint practice and explanation of the five perfections, the four thoughts and the refuge; Bodhicitta — The purpose, the characteristics, the different types and the actual method of giving rise to it

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
20th April 2025 | Morning Session | 2nd part
[Audio-tracks 041-044] Main topics: The two bodhicittas: relative and ultimate: How to give rise to bodhicitta in daily practice

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
20th April 2025 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 045-058] Main topics: Accumulating merit with the seven branch offering | The practice of refuge, bodhicitta and taking the bodhisattva vow based on The Excellent Path of Liberation and on A Brief Preliminary Practice from the Secret Heart Essence

eventTitle: Retiro de Outono | As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas
mainThemes: O texto das "Trinta e Sete práticas dos Bodhisattvas" | Introdução e estâncias 1 a 6 | Ngulchu Thogme | A prática "O Caminho Rápido para o Despertar" | Origem do Saṃsāra | Preciosa Vida Humana | 6 liberdades adicionais | 8 condições intrusivas | 8 propensões incompatíveis |  Formas de realização | Os Sete Ramos | O simbolismo de Chenrezig | Devoção e o gancho da compaixão | O estabelecimento do Dharma no Tibete e transmissão até hoje | Ngöndro curto; Sampa Nyurdrupma

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
11th November 2016 | Morning Session 
[Audio tracks: 001-013] On: The Thirty-Seven practices of the Bodhisattva | Swift Path sādhana | Buddha taught 84000 for beings of different mental capacities | Expounded and commented by great masters | The Kangyur | Condensed into the Way of the Bodhisattva | Ngulchu Thogme further condensed them | Crucial points | Like those “Books for Idiots” | Don’t file them in the cabinet “I understood” | How great teachers and Tibetans studied texts | 37 P. is the most studied | All due to Ngulchu Thogme compassion | He could be distracted, not even by a certain deity | 37 P. – the homage | Chenrezig, meaning of Lord of the Universe epithet; transcending duality and eight extremes | 37 P. the commitment to write | The real homage is to assimilate the qualities of the teacher | Benefit of resolution | How to view buddhahood | How to think of Buddha | Buddha’s body, qualities, what he symbolises | What the path depends on | Six demarcations or ways of expounding | Categories of different levels of meaning | Expedient meaning is like parents to child: a stork.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
11th November 2016 | Morning Session | Part 2 
[Audio tracks: 014-023] On: Establishing the three perfections | Uninterrupted living transmission thanks to our teachers | King Trisong Detsen’s effort | King Songsten Gangpo | The efforts and quality of the translations | King Ralpachen | The teachers, like Kangyur Rinpoche risked their lives to preserve the books | Reading transmission.
Keywords: Transmission; Tibet—establishing Buddhism; translations; Preserving the books.

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
11th November 2016 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks: 024-049] On: Question and Answer session | Karma, the mind is the chief | Ground, it’s luminosity, recognition | How saṃsāra starts views of different schools | Ground and delusion | Beginning of delusion and duality | The Thirty-Seven Practices | Precious Human Life in detail | Eight freedoms (or leisures) |Why they are considered “leisures” | The ten advantages (five individual and five that depend on others) | sixteen additional freedoms by Longchenpa.


Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th November 2016 | Morning Session | Part 1
[Audio tracks: 050-060] On: Importance of correct motivation and mindfulness | Mindful and also relaxed | Precious human life | Sixteen additional freedoms according to Longchenpa, the ’eight intrusive’ circumstances and the ‘eight incompatible’ propensities, in detail | Give a specific perspective to this human life | We are limited and bound by our emotions | Many kinds of laziness | Backlog of Karma | Enslaved to that certain kind of logic | Where does our Hello come from? | Discipline-Gestapo | Righteousness | Pious and goody-goody as a obsessive-compulsive disorder | Our weakness for saṃsāra | Do not take lightly negative emotions | Vows are a manual on the path.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
12th November 2016 | Morning Session | Part 2 
[Audio tracks: 061- 065] On: Life is very short, making it meaningful |Be where your body is | Reading transmission of a sūtra | Thanks to all volunteers | CASA | Mother Earth | Stūpas in France |Projects in Portugal | Portugal not special | Monchique | Orphanages in Darjeeling | Put teachings into practice | No regrets at time of death | Joy, not burden | Amitāyus Sūtra and other sūtras | Sūtra in blue paper and golden letters.

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
12th November 2016 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 066-077] On: Dharmakāya Buddha’s nature is beyond scope of our  vocabulary | “The Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas” are like a summary of The Way of the Bodhisattva | 1st verse: Precious human life | Discipline is like the ground of everything | Causes of a human life are difficult to find | Merit, if not dedicated can change | A mind devoted to the Dharma is very rare | Floating yoke and the blind tortoise | Handful of peas against a wall | Change the mind | Longchenpa on studying the teachings | 2nd verse Abandon places that trigger our emotions | In solitary place do not rebuild network.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th November | Morning Session 
[Audio tracks: 078-089] On: Thirty Seven Practices sādhana, The Swift Path | Laying the foundation of our practice | Meaning of sādhana as a way to accomplish | Why do visualizations | Changing our perception | Awakening as possibility | Recalling our nature | Our minds and practice requires structure | The sādhanas were developed by those already on the path | Gathering the causes and conditions | Making the path more efficient | Connecting with our visual references | What Chenrezig represents, his symbolism | Devotion and the hook of compassion | Remembering the reasoning | Method for removing clinging | The Seven Branches | Confession – Four Powers | Dedication | To direct the merit | Guided practice.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
13th November 2016 | Afternoon Session | Part 1 
[Audio tracks: 090-091] On: Reading transmission of Short Ngöndro, Sampa Nyurdrupma and sūtras from the Kangyur.

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th November 2016 | Afternoon session
[Audio tracks 092-103] On: Bodhicitta | Different scope of motivation of beings | 3 kinds of attitude | “Thirty-Seven Practices of the Bodhisattvas”, verse 3. | Native land is where patterns are strong | Solitary place is where distractions are lessened | Less conditions for negative emotions | Inner solitary place is less discursive thoughts | When there is gathering, there is separation | Give up concern for eight worldly concerns | Verse 5 | We get the qualities of the companies we are with | Bad company does not come in frightening package | Verse 6 | First, examine the teacher | Know how to be with such a teacher | The qualities of authentic teacher are hidden | Not found on media | Marpa and Milarepa | Commit body, speech and mind | Do not look for teachers that promote your worldly concerns. | Verse 7 | Take refuge due to fear of cycle of existence | Seek a refuge that is not bound by saṃsāra | Suffering of lower realms might be close by | Take refuge until destruction of egotism | Causes and conditions for refuge.

placeTeaching: Faculdade de Medicina Dentária, Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: Meditação e Alegria de Viver: Cultivar a Atenção, a Compaixão e a Sabedoria na Vida Quotidiana
mainThemes:
Como é que a meditação nos pode ajudar a manter a paz interior e resiliência perante o stress e agitação da vida quotidiana?
Yongey Mingyur Rinpoche fala-nos dos benefícios da meditação, apresentando técnicas simples e essenciais para manter o bem estar físico e mental face aos desafios do mundo moderno.

A Sessão de Abertura da Conferência Pública esteve a cargo do famoso monge budista e cientista Matthieu Ricard.

mainThemes: As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas - Estâncias 22 a 26 | Pandemia | Tudo é experiência da mente | Como nos relacionarmos com as experiências agradáveis e desagradáveis | Generosidade transcendente | Disciplina transcendente

 https://youtu.be/d5y3RfzEyuw
sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video Teachings | 1st Part 
Main topics: Relating to the present situation of pandemic | Verse 22: everything is the experience of the mind | Verse 23: how to relate to daily pleasant experiences | Verse 24: how to relate to painful situations in post meditation time.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
May 2020 | Video Teachings | 2nd Part 
Main topics: Verse 25: Transcendent generosity, which is so different from the usual type of generosity | Verse 26: Transcendent discipline, which is about engaging in positive actions and disengaging from negative actions.

placeTeaching: Hotel Marriott, Av dos Combatentes, Lisboa, Portugal
mainThemes: Reconhecido como reencarnação de Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, um mais promissores mestres tibetanos, Yangsi Khyentse Rinpoche, apresenta-nos nesta conferência o modo de gerar a compaixão e a bodhicitta, seguindo a linhagem de mestres que, incansavelmente, enfatizaram a importância de termos um bom coração. Inclui também uma apresentação de Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche acerca de Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche e de Rabjam Rinpoche.

placeTeaching: VIP Executive Entrecampos, (antigo Villa Rica), Lisboa, Portugal
eventTitle: Gerir Emoções Negativas - os Benefícios da Meditação
mainThemes: Tenzin Kunzang Jigme Rinpoche é o sétimo Taklung Matrul Rinpoche. É um dos principais mestres da linhagem Taklung Kagyü do Budismo Tibetano. Neste curto ensinamento, apresenta-nos aquele o nosso maior desafio, lidar com as emoções negativas. Pleno de humor, de forma contemporânea e perspicaz, transmite-nos os pontos fundamentais da meditação e a essência das técnicas para treinar a mente.

mainThemes:

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices II | Video 1 of 4
Main Topics: Benefits of repetition | Addressing our basic settings | The six root disturbing emotions | Removing delusion | Proliferation of disturbing emotions and endless suffering | The need to cleanse obscurations | Vajrasattva—the all-encompassing purification practice | Karma—our work | Two forms of karmic obscuration | Four kinds of obscurations | Confronting obscurations with the four powers | True confession—splitting the disturbing emotions

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices II | Video 2 of 4
Main Topics: Cleansing obscurations and accumulating merit | Refuge and bodhicitta | Changing our settings and our childlike mind | Addressing resistance to the practice | The four powers | 1.the Power of support | Devotion, the connection between outer and inner supports | Three types of devotion | 2. The power of repulsion | 3. The power of resolution | Disconnecting from the disturbing emotions | 4. The Power of the antidote | Confidence in the wish not to suffer
 
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices II | Video 3 of 4
Main Topics: Putting Vajrasattva in tune with what needs working on | ordinary tiresome business | our habitual perfect cycles of ignorance | the courage to face ourselves | repulsion and resolution | repulsion towards discouragement, not towards the practice

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
Autumn 2020 | Preliminary Practices II | Video 4 of 4
Main Topics: Practicing to become free from the vicious circle of saṃsāra | disturbing emotions | habitual settings | power of support | Vajrasattva inseparable from our teacher | the aspirations of Vajrasattva | benefits of reciting the 100-syllable mantra | signs of having cleansed obscurations | visualization of Vajrasattva | Lords of Death and karmic creditors | cleansing the ego clinging and the ego | advice for post meditation

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
4th November 2023 | Morning session
[Audio-tracks 001-009] Main topics: What is Guru Yoga and what is it for?; The examples of great teachers and students of these teachers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
4th November 2023 | Afternoon session | 1st Part
[Audio-tracks 010-020] Main Topics: The genuine Guru and student relations; How one should see one’s Guru.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
4th November 2023 | Afternoon Session | 2nd Part
[Audio-tracks 021-037] Main topics: Student’s request of Mani Kambum and The Seventeen Tantras transmission; the significance of Lhabab Düchen; the kindness of all mothers and the importance to repay it; the life of Padmasambhava and the biographies of the Buddha; the extraordinary life ofAmala; Short Ngöndro; King of Aspirations Prayer—how and when to read it.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
5th November 2023 | Morning session
[Audio-tracks 038-050] Main topics: Guru Yoga in the context of other practices; The power of guru’s blessing; 
The importance of devotion; The activities and kindness of our teachers

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
5th November 2023 | Afternoon session 
[Audio-tracks 051-058] Main topics: 37 Practices of Bodhisattvas; Advice regarding foundational teachings.

mainThemes: As Trinta e Sete Práticas dos Bodhisattvas (Estrofes 25 a 37) | A Via Rápida para o Despertar | Importância da Pós Meditação | Apego aos fenómenos | Doação de bens materiais | Disciplina | Ciência Interior | Padmasambhava | Ratna Lingpa | Sete Versos de diamante | Mantra de Guru Rinpoche; Tsok |“O Abandono dos Quatro Apegos” de Mañjuśrī e Sachen Kunga Niynpo | Corrente de hábitos | Generosidade | Disciplina | Paciência e tipos de paciência | Śamatha | Diligência | Sabedoria | Conselho em 4 linhas | Grupo 2: Objetivo da prática | Apego a esta vida | Disciplina e conduta | 8 preocupações mundanas | A mente; Ligação com o Mestre | Obscurecimentos do corpo, fala e mente | Vidas de Buda | Sofrimento nos Infernos | 4 incomensuráveis | Visualização | Interdependência | Verdades relativa e última | Opondo-se aos hábitos do saṃsāra | Impermanência | Experiências meditativas | Estado de sono | Reconhecendo os sonhos | Sūtra das Três Joias | A Visão, o terreno | A via | Vazio mas aparente | Eternalismo e nihilismo | 4º Jamgon Kongtrul | Canção de Longchempa; etc.

sessionThemes:
[Available only in Portuguese]

06/JULHO/ 2014 - JIGME KHYENTSE RINPOCHE 
Verdade Relativa Correcta e Incorrecta; [Q] Criar Karma Enquanto Sonhamos 
[Q] Experiências Fora do Corpo; A Visão, A Base; A Via; o Buda não Tangível mas Presente; Realizar a visão é o resultado; Nem Eternalismo, nem Nihilismo; A Sadhana de Buda Shakyamuni; Refúgio e Visualização; Os Sete Ramos; Recomendações
Até à próxima sessão; Reconhecer a Interdependência 21x/dia e Ler a Aspiração do Nobre Samanthabadra 1x/semana 

06/JULHO/ 2014 - PEMA WANGYAL RINPOCHE 
Impermanência; 4º Jamgon Kongtrul e o 17º Karmapa; Longchenpa; A canção de Longchenpa; Situações Difíceis; O sofrimento dos Animais; Ser Vegetariano ou Vegan
Associação "Mãe Terra"; Acumular Virtude; Dedicatória e Conclusão; Outras Canções
Rinpoche recita os mantras aos animais

“O Caminho Rápido para o Despertar” [GRUPO II]
Preparação; Visualização; Chenrezi; O Simbolismo do mala / rosário; Hábitos
Chenrezi (continuação); Prática Principal; A utilização do mala

07/JULHO/ 2014 - JIGME KHYENTSE RINPOCHE 
Rinpoche pede o comentário dos versos; A Prática do pós meditação; Verso 25º A Generosidade; Apego; Ser capaz de largar, deixar ir; A oferenda Material; [Q] Ser um Idiota ou Ser Generoso; [Q] O Capitalismo e a Prática do Dharma; [Q] Quem Pede, O Que Dar?; A Intenção; Verso 25º A Generosidade (cont.); Verso 26º A Disciplina

07/JULHO/ 2014 - PEMA WANGYAL RINPOCHE 
A Ciência Interior; Guru Padmasambhava; Ratna Lingpa; Os Sete Versos de Diamante
“O Caminho Rápido”; Tsok

08/JULHO/ 2014 - JIGME KHYENTSE RINPOCHE 
[Q] Sobre os Mantras; [Q] Sobre dar; [Q] Sobre Dar Sem Expectativa; A Generosidade requer disciplina; Verso 27º A Paciência; Os vários tipos de Paciência; [Q] Sobre as bruxas; Verso 29º Shamatha; Verso 28º A Diligência; Verso 30º A Sabedoria
Até à próxima sessão ler “A Essência da Compaixão” e Memorizar os Versos

08/JULHO/ 2014 - PEMA WANGYAL RINPOCHE
“O Caminho Rápido”; “O Abandono dos Quatro Apegos” De Sachen Kunga Niynpo 
“A Grinalda de Jóias” De Longchenpa; As Quatro Recomendações de Kyabje Trulshik Rinpoche; Recomendações

eventTitle: Comentário às 37 Práticas de um Bodhisattva, de Gyalse Thogme
mainThemes: Tenzin Kunzang Jigme Rinpoche é o sétimo Taklung Matrul Rinpoche. É um dos principais mestres da linhagem Taklung Kagyü do Budismo Tibetano. Nesta ocasião memorável, concedeu-nos uma preciosa explicação das Trinta e Sete Práticas dos Bodhisattvas, percorrendo as estâncias 1 a 12.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
eventTitle: Retiro de Outono | As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas
mainThemes: As 37 Práticas dos Bodhisattvas (estâncias 1 a 8) | Ligações kármicas | Qualidades perfeitas | Impermanência | Causas e condições | Raciocínio e experiência | Compaixão e sabedoria | Sofrimento de natureza composta | Treino da mente | Discípulos de Padmasambhava | Raciocínio correto | Sofrimento condicionado | Causas da Budeidade | As 3 perfeições | Bodhicitta | O treino da mente em 7 pontos | Desenvolver a mente-da-iluminação | Os mestres de Atisha | Preliminares: Os sofrimentos nos diferentes reinos | Refúgio | Como nos relacionarmos com o nosso meio ambiente | As 4 atenções plenas próximas | Pós-meditação | Bodhicitta relativo na meditação | Dar e receber alternadamente | Aṅgulimāla | Impermanência | Motivação correcta | Circunstâncias adversas | Apego ao ego | Tomando o sofrimento dos outros | Bodhicitta absoluto - em intenção e em acção | Purificação | Um mestre de confiança | Estabilidade na via | Prática como um modo de vida | As 5 forças | O poder da aspiração | O Sūtra-Coração (C1); “Vajra Subjugador” (D1); Sūtra da Infinita Vida e Sabedoria (Tse Do); Soberana Aspiração Para uma Excelente Conduta“; Oferenda aos Dharmapalas, etc.

eventTitle: A Vida e o Mundo dos Grandes Mestres do Tibete
mainThemes: Monge budista, autor, tradutor, fotógrafo e promotor de vários projetos humanitários, Matthieu Ricard foi um dos primeiros ocidentais a explorar em profundidade os tesouros espirituais do budismo dos Himalaias e nesta conferência, com o seu carisma, partilha um pouco das suas viagens e da sua experiência com alguns dos mais importantes mestres da atualidade recente como K. Kangyur Rinpoche, K. Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche e S.S. Dalai Lama.

teacherName: Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche | Pema Wangyal Rinpoche | Rangdrol Rinpoche
placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: As Quatro Nobres Verdades | Mandala como forma fácil e poderosa de acumulação de mérito | Esta prática permite superar o nosso apego | As quatro rodas que nos ajudam a progredir | A primeira roda: estar num lugar perfeito para praticar o Dharma | Segunda roda: encontrar e confiar num mestre autêntico | Histórias sobre Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche e outros grandes mestres | Mandala de realização e de oferenda | Como fazer a oferenda | Significado dos trinta e sete elementos | A linhagem da “Lamparina para dissipar as trevas” | A oferenda da Mandala passo a passo | O que esta prática deve ser e o que não deve ser | Guru Yoga: a importância crucial da devoção e o guru | Significado e objetivo do Guru Yoga | A necessidade de um guru exterior e as histórias de mestres passados | Explicação da prática | Visão geral de todas as práticas que precedem o Guru Yoga e conselhos sobre a mesma | Excertos de "A chuva de bençãos"

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
2nd November 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks: 055-064] Main topics: The lineage of the Beacon to Dispel the Gloom; the Mandala offering step by step

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd November 2022 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio tracks: 067-071] Main topics: What Mandala practice should be and shouldn’t be; Guru Yoga practice: the crucial importance of devotion and the guru

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
3rd November 2022 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks: 072-083] Main topics: The meaning and goal of Guru Yoga; The need for outer Guru and the stories of past masters; Explanation of practice.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
3rd November 2022 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks: 084-094] Main topics: Overview of all the practices preceding Guru Yoga; Advices on the Guru Yoga practice.

mainThemes: Tenzin Kunzang Jigme Rinpoche é o sétimo Taklung Matrul Rinpoche. É um dos principais mestres da linhagem Taklung Kagyü do Budismo Tibetano. Neste curto ensinamento, apresenta-nos aquele que é uma referência para todos nós, S.S. Dalai lama, e aborda também questões como: o conceito de tempo, as emoções e a inteligência, a expectativa e a desilusão, etc.

eventTitle: Retiros de Outono | Práticas Preliminares -  4 pensamentos
mainThemes: As práticas preliminares: a sua estrutura, preliminares externas e internas | Invocação de Guru Rinpoche | Os 4 pensamentos que afastam a mente do saṃsāra | A natureza-de-buda | Uttaratantra de Maitreya | Refúgio | Rei Trisong Detsen, Guru Padmasambhava e Śāntarakṣita | História de Vairocana | Motivação apropriada | Aspiração da bodhicitta; Preliminares externos e internos | As 4 Nobres Verdades | Os Quatro Selos | A natureza-de-buda: obscurecimentos, prova de que a possuímos | Devoção, razão, fé, atenção plena e precaução | O refúgio na via Mahāyāna | Perceção pura | A oferenda de tsok | Guru Rinpoche e a sua terra-pura, etc.

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th November 2016 | Morning Session | Part 1 
[Audio tracks 001-006] On: Calling out to Guru Rinpoche | Guru Rinpoche is none other than our own teachers | Blessing is to have renunciation | What it means to take refuge in Guru Rinpoche | Ngöndro | Reflection on the four thoughts | Suffering of saṃsāra | Precious human life | Guru Rinpoche as the embodiment of the all the buddhas | Refuge visualization | How to recite refuge and the actual recitation | Elements to cultivate refuge | To begin with, we are all fakers | Guided practice | Tulku Rinpoche’s request to the translators.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
9th November 2016 | Morning Session | Part 2 
[Audio tracks: 007-010] On: Study will not cease | King Trisong Detsen, Guru Padmasambhava and Śāntarakṣita | The great Tibetan translators were not ordinary | Story of Vairocana | A preserved unbroken lineage | What is bodhicitta | The four lunar calendar months that are important in Buddhism | The proper attitude | Non human beings also benefit | Recitation of the Refuge | Sūtra reading transmission.

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
9th November 2016 | Afternoon Session 
[Audio tracks: 011-018] On: Importance of the proper motivation and conduct | The importance of study, contemplation and meditation | The vast aspiration of bodhicitta for the beings of the three realms: the desire, form and formless realm | Importance of compassion | Aspire for awakening, have this idea that we are going to become a buddha | In terms of the preliminary practices there is the outer and inner preliminaries | The outer preliminaries consist of the four thoughts that turn our mind away from saṃsāra | The search for a guide should be made in a very unbiased manner, based on reasoning | The Four Noble Truths | The refuge in the Three Jewels | Serkya, or Kapila | Give rise to devotion that is based on reasoning | Devotion and faith has to meet with mindfulness and vigilance, carefulness | Buddha said: “I have showed you the path, based on which I have attained enlightenment; enlightenment depends on you!” | Based on that we should practice the preliminaries, refuge, bodhicitta, etc.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
10th November 2016 | Morning Session 
[Audio tracks 030-034] On: Taking refuge | The object of refuge | Determination to not get distracted | If meditation is shallow, bring up the Four Thoughts | Be able to define what are the Three Jewels | Checklists that we need as practicing Buddhists | Refuge as protection from cycle of existence | Remembering the Buddhist perspective | The Four Seals | "Zak che" - falling | Refuge on the Mahāyāna path | Conduct | Result.


Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
10th November 2016 | Afternoon Session | Part 1 
[Audio tracks 035-038] On: Instructions on what to do during this session | Reading transmission of sūtra | concluding words.

Khenchen Pema Sherab R. & Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
10th November 2016 | Afternoon Session | Part 2 
[Audio tracks 039-063] On: Question and Answer on the basis of Khenchen Pema Sherab’s teaching from the previous day | the Buddha’s real intent (according to Maitreya’s Uttaratantra) | Buddha-nature, the four obscurations that prevent the buddha-nature from flourishing | Proof that we have the buddha-nature | The source of the commentaries on these vast and profound teachings (Nāgārjuna, Maitreya, Asaṅga) | The importance of remembering our buddha-nature.

Pema Wangyal Rinpoche
10th November 2016 | Evening Session | Tsok session pg. 169
[Audio tracks 064-071] On: Feast offering or tsok | Preparing the offerings | Making offerings limitless | Consecration | How to view the place and others | Why we do the feast offering | To remember our teachers | Kangyur Rinpoche, 11th day | Reading transmissions: N23, N100 | Description of the buddhafield of Guru Rinpoche | Call Guru Rinpoche | H.H. Sakya Trizin | Initiation | Guru Rinpoche never fails | Remove others sufferings to remove ours.

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Porquê repetir o refúgio? | Clarificar a intenção de se livrar do sofrimento e suas causas | O verdadeiro refúgio é quando realizarmos a Bodhicitta absoluta | Os 4 pensamentos como preparação | Decidir: aqui está o meu caminho | O estado mental do Mahāyāna e do Vajrayāna | Não há diferença entre nós e os Budas | Alcançar o corpo de arco-íris nesta mesma vida, nesta mesma sessão | 100.000 ou 1.000.000, depende da nossa capacidade de estar presente | Guru Padmasambhava e Chenrezig | Se não nos sentimos inseguros, porque praticamos? | Gerard Gaudet | Estar preparado para confrontar a irrupção da impermanência | Amala | O refúgio causal e resultante | Confiança e devoção | Bodhicitta em intenção - Imparcialidade, Amor bondoso, compaixão e alegria incomensuráveis| Mestres Kadampa | Bodhicitta em ação, aliando sabedoria e meios hábeis | A filha do rei Trisong Detsen | Marpa e Milarepa

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th April 2024 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio tracks 001-005] Main topics: Developing certainty | Four thoughts
as preliminary to the preliminaries. | Precious human life, Impermanence,
Law of cause and effect, Suffering of saṃsāra. | First two noble truths.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th April 2024 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio tracks 006-013] Main topics: Mahāyāna mindset | Vajrayāna mind-
set | Five perfections | Motivation | Preliminaries and refuge practice in “The
Excellent Path of Liberation” and “A Beacon to Dispel the Gloom”.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
13th April 2024 | Afternoon Session
[Audio tracks 014-025] Main topics: Contemplating impermanence and the
objects of refuge | Explanation of the causal and resultant refuge according
to the path of individual liberation | Mahāyāna and Vajrayāna | How to visu-
alise the objects of refuge in “The Excellent Path of Liberation” and in “The
Beacon to Dispel the Gloom”.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th April 2024 | Morning Session | 1st Part
[Audio 026 – 028] Main topics: Questions & Answers: Visualisation when
taking refuge | The meaning of blue Akṣobhya | Meaning of the guru, yidam
and the ḍākinī in Vajrayāna | To act or not to act while being stained by ego or
self-cherishing | The accommodating qualities of our teachers.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th April 2024 | Morning Session | 2nd Part
[Audio 029- 035] Main topics: Refuge, bodhicitta and impartiality — How
to turn an irritating situation into something that we want to work with.

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
14th April 2024 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 036 - 049] Main topics: Training bodhicitta in intention |
Four immeasurables | Immeasurable impartiality | Immeasurable loving kind-
ness | Immeasurable compassion | Immeasurable joy | Bodhicitta in action.

placeTeaching: Centro de Retiros do Covão da Águia, Monchique, Portugal
mainThemes: Śamatha, em que consiste de acordo com os ensinamentos Budistas | Quais as nossas expectativas? | Śamatha, um método para desenvolver sabedoria e acalmar a mente |As 4 Nobres Verdades | Os 3 tipos de sofrimento | Verdade da causa de sofrimento – confusão, desejo e frustração | Estar presente, usando a respiração para comunicar com a mente e o corpo | Trabalhar com a ignorância e o desejo | Usar a nossa inteligência como caminho para a sabedoria | Diferentes objetos de meditação | Objetivo de Śamatha | Vipaśyanā | Colocar a mente e colocar a mente continuamente | Claridade, grande felicidade e não-pensamento | Duração de Śamatha | Impermanência | 4 aplicações da atenção plena | Coisas a abandonar e a adotar | A prática diária em 3 partes | O que são ações negativas | Investigar mente, corpo e emoções | Os 4 selos | Compreender que Śamatha é um método simples, claro e eficaz | Usar o Mestre como referência | Como lidar com o aborrecimento e a irritação

sessionThemes:
Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
17th April 2025 | Morning Session
[Audio tracks: 001-013] Main topics: Beginning of the teaching of the
common preliminaries: the four thoughts that turn our mind to the Dharma—
precious human life, impermanence, law of cause and effect, and suffering of
saṃsāra; reading passages of the 'Guide to The Words of My Perfect Teacher'

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
17th April 2025 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 014-027] Main topics: Continuation of the morning session
about the mind training, the common preliminaries, the four thoughts that
turn our mind to the Dharma, the correct attitude for listening to the teachings,
the preliminaries for each session, story of the discover the Lapur Thugtik
Ngöndro by Kangyur Rinpoche and the holder Kyabje Dilgo Khyentse
Rinpoche

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th April 2025 | Morning Session | part 1
[Audio Tracks 028- 031] Main topics: Four Seals | All things are impermanent
| All emotions are suffering | Precious human life | eight lack of freedom
with relation to ourselves | How to practice the preliminaries

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th April 2025 | Morning Session | part 2
[Audio Tracks 032-040] Main topics: Precious human life | Freedoms and
advantages | How to practice the preliminaries

Jigme Khyentse Rinpoche
18th April 2025 | Afternoon Session
[Audio-tracks 041-063] Main topics: Summary of morning session about
the eight lack of freedoms; eight intrusive circumstances; eight incompatible
propensities; how to practice the preliminaries
